Conceding that they are keeping a close watch on the negotiations between Shaheen Bagh protestors and the interlocutors, Omair Khan and Satish Das, convener and co-convener of the Samvidhan Bachao Morcha, said, “The only reason why we keep a tab on Delhi developments is that the issue of both the protests was common.”

Asked whether the withdrawal or relocation of the Delhi protest at the instance of the interlocutors would make them revisit their strategy, the duo said the SC has appointed the interlocutors only for Shaheen Bagh and not for other places where anti-CAA protests are going on.

“The nature of protest too is different. Unlike Delhi, the Gaya protest is being held on private land and as such alibis like public inconvenience do not hold good here,” Khan said. The Gaya protest would continue till the CAA is either rolled back by the Centre or the SC passes a verdict on the constitutional validity of the controversial Act, asserted Das.

“The Morcha has full faith in SC as the custodian of citizens’ rights and basic character of the Constitution that does not make any discrimination on the ground of religious belief,” Khan and Das said.

Das complained that some sections wanted to portray it as a purely Muslim protest. “NRC would affect all Indians, more so the poor and as such it does not have any religious overtones,” he added.

Das claimed that the Gaya protesters have got the support of all right thinking people and besides Kanhaiyya Kumar, CPM leader Brinda Karat, CPI leaders Atul Kumar Anjan and Amarjeet Kaur, retired police officer Amitabh Das, ex-Bihar CM Jitan Ram Manjhi, former speaker Udai Narain Chaudhary, leader of opposition in the Bihar assembly Tejaswi Yadav and celebrated poet Imran Pratapgarhi have visited the dharna site to express solidarity with the protestors. On 22 Feb (Saturday) well-known political thinker and activist Yogendra Yadav would be addressing the protesters.

Sources said Sharjil Imam, who is accused in a sedition case, wanted to use the Shantibagh platform, but the Morcha leaders refused to play host to Imam for his “aggressive and provocative” rhetoric.

Title: Thousands throng Shiva temples on Mahashivaratri
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Devotees offering puja at Shiva Temple, Boring road crossing on the occasion of Maha-Shivaratri festival in Pa... Read More

PATNA: Thousands of devotees thronged the Shiva temples since early morning to offer puja and perform Rudrabhishek on Mahashivaratri on Friday.

Altogether 21 ‘shobha yatras’ were taken out by members of different puja committees across the city reached Khajpura Shiva temple where bhajan sandhya, Shiva Vivah and kirtan were organized on the occasion. Tableaux on various aspects of Lord Shiva , including his marriage with Goddess Parvati, were made on the occasion.

Tipu Singh, treasurer of Shri Shri Khajpura Puja Samiti said several prominent personalities, including chief minister Nitish Kumar, also visited Khajpura Shiva temple and offered prayers. Besides, devotees in huge numbers gathered at the temple in order to see tableaux and shobha yatras, he said. “Huge number of devotees were present during the ceremonial Shiva Vivah, which was organized from 9pm,” he added.

Over 400 additional police personnel were deployed near Khajpura Shiva temple to manage the crowd. Apart from that, hundreds of police personnel were deputed at other temples in the city.

Harikant Prasad, an official at the Mahavir Temple near Patna Junction said: “The number of devotees visiting the temple was much more than last year. People thronged the temple since 5am. Devotees, who had booked slots for ‘Rudrabhishek’ on the three ‘shivalingas’ in the temple were given an hour’s time each for the rituals.”

Arvind Pandey, a priest associated with the Shiva temple near Sabjimandi , said people offered prayers and participated in ‘jagran’.

Devotees had to wait for hours at temples to offer puja. “Even though I went early morning, the crowd was unmanageable. It took me around two hours to perform ‘jalabhishek’ on the Shivalinga,” said Pritee Prasad of Kadamkuan.

Chief minister Nitish Kumar extended his greetings to the people on Mahashivaratri. “It is a festival of unbounded faith and devotion. By maintaining mutual trust, love, brotherhood, social harmony and religious goodwill, I wish the state to achieve progress, peace and prosperity,” he said.

Title: Dense fog in the city disrupt flight, train services
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Fog blanketed the entire Diamond City with the morning temperature falling to 18°C

Surat: Dense fog enveloped Surat and parts of Bharuch and Navsari on Friday morning. Poor visibility even disrupted flight and train operations in the region with one Spice Jet flight from Delhi to Surat had to be diverted to Ahmedabad. Around five trains too were reportedly running late by more than an hour due to the foggy conditions.

The entire Diamond City wore a blanket of fog with the morning temperature falling to 18°C. The dense fog extended to other parts including Bharuch, Navsari and Valsad where traffic on the national highway too was affected.

Sources in Spice Jet confirmed that the Delhi to Surat flight with about 150 passengers had to be diverted to Ahmedabad owing to poor visibility for fog at the Surat airport. The flight was to arrive at 7.31 am at Surat, but after it had to be diverted to Ahmedabad, it departed at 9am to reach Surat airport at 9.31am, sources added.

A senior airport officer said, “The instrument landing system (ILS) is functioning at the airport, but only a pilot who is trained in ILS can land the aircraft when the runway visual range (RVR) is minimum 200 metres. On Friday, the visual range at the airport was more than 300 metres and the pilot could not land the aircraft and hence, it had to be diverted to Ahmedabad.”

Weather department officials said that the minimum temperature in the morning dropped 18.7°C and humidity was recorded at 91%, which resulted in the dense fog situation.

Area railway manager, Surat railway station, CR Garuda said, “There was a dense fog situation from Bharuch to Surat and Navsari. About five trains including Mumbai-Vadodara Express, Gandhidham Express, Rajdhani Express, Garib Rath and Gujarat Queen were running late by 20 minutes to one hour. The traffic situation was normal after 10am.”

Title: Fire engulfs bldg; 8 vehicles gutted
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Bhopal: Mystery shrouds the cause of fire which broke out in the parking lot of a four-storeyed building occupied by postal department employees at the Post & Telegraph Colony in Kamla Nagar in the wee hours of Friday. Eight two-wheelers, including bikes and scooters along with a kid's bicycle parked under the building, were completely gutted. No casualty was reported.

The heat and intensity of the flames were so severe that they spread through the entire staircase from the ground floor to the terrace damaging a plastic overhead water tank along and a trunk and other goods kept on the terrace.

After getting information after the incident, minister PC Sharma and the local corporator reached the spot to review the situation.

The police and fire brigade were alerted about the blaze by an alert woman, who resides in a flat in front of the apartment. The apartment, where the incident took place, has 12 flats in which 10 families reside. Fortunately, the three flats on the ground floor were vacant.

All the families were trapped in their respective flats on the upper floors as the staircase was filled with smoke and flames.

The entrance doors of all the flats on the ground floor to fourth floor were burnt from outside and electric metres fitted outside were gutted. Two women employees of the post office, who live in one of the flats, jumped off to safety from the first floor. Ambalika Vishwakarma sustained injury on her legs while Sakshi Patel escaped unhurt.

SHO Kamla Nagar SI Vijay Sisodia said that police have registered a case of arson and are investigating the cause of fire. Prima facie, it seems that short-circuit caused fire. A marriage function was going on in the colony premises, so there is a little possibility of any outsider setting the fire, he said.

There are no CCTV cameras and no security guards in the colony. Building residents and locals suspect foul play and have suggested that miscreants torched the vehicles. They are linking the incident to the series of vehicles vandalised and torched in the area by miscreants.

Title: Cong demands probe report in three days
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Surat: The city Congress and youth Congress leaders on Friday held dharna at Surat Municipal Institute of Medical Education and Research (SMIMER) on Friday demanding immediate submission of inquiry report into the episode of allegedly stripping of female employees of the civic body before gynaecological exam.

Congress leaders and elected municipal councillors seated outside SMIMER shouted slogans for completing the inquiry early. “By giving 15 days time to submit the inquiry report the municipal commissioner is trying to cover up the issue. The ruling BJP and officials of Surat Municipal Corporation (SMC) have lost all humanity,” said Aslam Cyclewala, Congress municipal councillor.

“When we demanded that the inquiry should conclude in three days, we were told that the senior most member of the probe team was busy with some personal assignment due to which the report may get delayed. If one member is busy she should be replaced. But the report should be submitted in three days,” said Cyclewala.

“It seems SMC top officials are trying to pour cold water on a burning issue. We will sit on dharna along with the victims at municipal commissioner's office if the report is not submitted in three days,” said Pradeep Sindhav, a Youth Congress leader.

Women working in different fields expressed shock and disbelief at the insulting manner in which the tests were conducted. They said that dignity and privacy of all individuals should be maintained.

“Everybody has right to privacy. The women should be provided details of such tests in advance and their privacy should be maintained in any situation,” said Vibha Marfatia, a social worker. Marfatia is director of Sahas, an NGO working for awareness in health.

A women doctor employed at a government hospital explained, “For a gynaecology test it is required that proper method is followed where the patient does not feel insulted. In most cases, all the tests are not required.”

Photo quotes

If the finger test was done it is unethical. And what the authorities will do if the woman is found to be pregnant. By taking a job do women forgo their right to become pregnant

Vibha Marfatia, Social worker.

This should not have been done in any case. Actions will be taken in the issue and state commission for women is monitoring it closely

Leela Ankoliya, chairperson, Gujarat State Commission for Women

Title: Trader kidnapped over financial dispute, released
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Rajkot: A trader from Andhra Pradesh was allegedly kidnapped and then released over a financial dispute in Morbi on early Friday morning.

Complainant Naga Shivshankar Gupta (42) alleged that he was kidnapped by Rupesh Panara, Tejas Panara and their men identified as Vipul, Jiga and their unidentified associate.

“Gupta said he was released by the accused who made him sign blank cheques and a register after thrashing him black and blue,” said D V Dangar, sub-inspector with Morbi taluka police station.

The accused used to supply tiles to Gupta in Bengaluru. However, when the cheques issued by Gupta were bounced, the accused decided to kidnap him to recover their money.

Rupesh had filed a court case against Gupta for cheque bouncing, in hearing of which Gupta had come to Morbi. However, before Gupta could go to the court he was kidnapped.

Gupta was confined in a godwon in Rafaleshwer and later at a ginning mill in Tankara, before the accused freed him Morbi bus depot.

Meanwhile, the police have launched a manhunt for the accused.

Title: Bihar: Youth lynched in Vaishali district
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: A 24-year-old youth was lynched by a mob on the suspicion of being a thief at Korigama village under the Goroul police station area in Vaishali district in the wee hours of Friday.

The incident took place around 2 am when the youth was reportedly spotted trying to break open the locks of a shop located at Korigama village on the borders of Goroul and Mahua police stations in the district on Friday. The mob thrashed him badly leading to his instant death.

Vaishali SP Gaurav Mangla said the deceased was identified as Subash Rai, a resident of Jadhua village under the Ganga Bridge police station area in Vaishali district. The family members, however, told the police that Rai had left home around 8 pm on Thursday to meet an acquaintance. His body was found at Korigama village early on Friday morning.

The SP said the Goroul police reached the spot after being informed about the incident by the village chowkidar on Friday morning. “The body bore external injuries. The victim had died before police reached the spot. Later the body was sent to the sadar hospital at Hajipur for postmortem,” the SP said, adding that action would be initiated against those taking law into their hands.

Goroul police station SHO Anil Kumar said the identity of the deceased was ascertained with the help of some documents he was carrying with him at the time of the incident. “How he reached Korigama village, which is nearly 30 km from his native place Jadhua, is subject to investigation,” he told this newspaper over phone.

Police said that the antecedents of the deceased were being verified, if any. “So far there is no criminal case pending against the deceased with the Ganga Bridge police station in the district. Efforts are on to collect more information from other police stations in the district,” the SHO said adding that one person involved in mob lynching has been arrested.

A close relative of the deceased, however, claimed that he (Subhash) had called his family members and revealed that he had been held captive by some local residents near Korigama village and was subsequently beaten up mercilessly. “He had succumbed to his injuries by the time his relatives reached the spot,” an investigating officer quoted a family member as saying.

Meanwhile, the deceased’s body was handed over to the family after postmortem. A case has been lodged with the Goroul police station against unidentified persons in connection with the incident. The incident took place a day before DGP Gupteshwar Pandey is likely to address a ‘chaupal’ (public meeting) at Hajipur on crime control and proper implementation of prohibition law.

Title: ‘Government will provide permanent space to local artisans of Bihar’
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Visitors during Mahila Udyami cum Rojgar Mela at Gyan Bhawan in Patna on Friday

PATNA: Chief secretary Deepak Kumar said on Friday that state government and Women Development Corporation (WDC)would provide a permanent platform to local artisans of Bihar to sell their handmade products throughout the year.

Speaking at the inaugural function of ‘Mahila Udyami Mela-cum-Rozgar Mela’ organized by WDC at Gyan Bhawan, Deepak said, “I feel satisfied to see that women from different sections of society are coming forward and learning new skills. Women entrepreneur could avail various skill development initiatives provided by the state government to improve their job prospects.”

He said women entrepreneurs should assess the demand of the product before selecting their start-up plans. He urged the women entrepreneurs to be the job creators instead of job seekers. “It is good to see that women have become self-dependent but they should also strive hard to provide employment to other women as well. For example, in Mumbai, dabbawalas start-up has grown leaps and bounds. It has provided employment to large number of people who deliver the food to offices and other places,” Deepak said. He also visited few stalls put up there and encouraged the women entrepreneurs.

WDC managing director Harjot Kaur said permanent premises to display and sell local arts by artisans would be ready within one year. “The state government and the WDC will lay out a plan for the same. Besides, the WDC and Bihar Mahila Udyog Sangh (BMUS) will jointly promote the local artworks of Bihar at national and international level by organizing fairs,” she said.

Additional chief secretary of social welfare department, Atul Prasad, and BMUS president Usha Jha were also present.

Handicrafts, Madhubani painting, Tikuli Art, appliqué work, wall-hangings, live plants and artificial flowers, home decors, kurti and other dress materials, artificial jewellery, accessories, lamps, utensils and edible products were being sold at around 70 stalls put up by the women entrepreneurs at the fair.

Nupur Naryan, who was selling live plants, said, “We also have a unique kit for kids to learn the gardening skill. It costs Rs500.”

Soni Kumari, who is associated with Bihar Upendra Maharathi Shilp Anusandhan Sansthan, was selling Tikuli Art, handicrafts like tea coasters wall-hanging, mirror, painting and tray. “The decorative items cost between Rs60 and Rs4,000,” he said.

The customers were thrilled and hopping from one shop to another. Shalini, a resident of Boring Road, bought appliqué design bedsheets, Sujni handicrafts and Madhubani artwork purse. “I really like the purse. I can carry it in parties as it is unique,” she said.

Title: New Town Kolkata Development Authority adopts green buildings practices
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose only

KOLKATA: The New Town Kolkata Development Authority ( NKDA ), in consultation with enlisted architects, structural engineers and other stakeholders, has adopted several neighbourhood- and environment-friendly construction practices.

Some of the measures to be in place include preventing harmful effluents from piling rigs from flowing into the sewerage and drainage lines, not allowing construction materials to be piled on the blacktop portion of the roads and ensuring use of low-noise alternative machines for work during the day instead of diesel engines or generators between 8pm and 6am. Additionally, all under-construction buildings will have to be covered so that no dust, debris or construction material fall outside the property boundary. Contractors will also have to ensure that there is no water accumulation on the premises.

NKDA officials also suggested that to develop sustainable and eco-friendly buildings, reflective paint could be used on rooftops to reduce room temperature by around 4°C to 5°C to reduce power consumption.

Title: Kolkata airport cleanest among eight busiest AAI facilities
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport

KOLKATA: The Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose International Airport has been declared the cleanest among the large state-owned airports , pipping Chennai and Jaipur that are ranked second and third respectively. Coming after years of passenger grouse on the state of washrooms, the award is a recognition of strides taken in the past year to overhaul the toilets and improve upkeep. However, the improvement in the indoor ambience is offset by terrible experience outside as passengers encounter shabby touts and chaotic traffic on exiting the terminal.

In the Swachhata Awards 2019, announced by the ministry of civil aviation for clean and safe airports, Kolkata has been declared the best AAI airport with annual passenger traffic in excess of 5 million. Of the 13 big Indian airports, eight are operated by AAI — Kolkata, Chennai, Ahmedabad, Pune, Goa, Guwahati, Lucknow and Jaipur. Delhi, Mumbai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad and Cochin are private airports.

While Kolkata airport has won laurels for terminal design and efficiency, the state of its washrooms — particularly their cleanliness — has been a sore point among travellers. Though maintenance was handed over to private contractors, it failed to impress passengers. Recognizing the need for a complete make-over, AAI decided to redo the facilities, complete with new sanitary ware, fixtures and signage. In addition, airport managers were tasked with diligently monitoring the cleanliness of washrooms and attendants were stationed in each of them round-the-clock.

The difference began to be noticed in the second half of last year with criticism over the toilets on social media beginning to wane.

“Over the past several months, we have been alert about the toilets. Regular feedback from passengers, either on social media or through smiley machines installed near washrooms, were monitored and acted upon,” said an airport official.

While the change in washrooms is obvious, other initiatives that helped Kolkata airport score points include reducing single-use plastic, installing a plastic bottle crushing machine, getting enrolled and achieving level 2 in the Carbon Accreditation Programme, sensitizing employees and passengers, and setting up green walls inside the terminal.

“Outside the terminal, modern grass cutting-cum-collecting machines have been deployed to keep the grounds clean. Rubber deposits on the runway are also regularly removed to ensure that the landing strip has the desired friction level,” an airport official pointed out.

However, the issues outside the terminal continue to fester. The menace of touts — controlled intermittently through police drives — remains a problem as does illegal parking of VIP vehicles in front of the terminal.

Passengers say that if Kolkata airport is to indeed project itself as a world-class facility, it needs to clear the problems outside as well.

Title: Workshop fire: No assurance to car owners on repairs yet
Content:
Representative image

KOLKATA: Owners of cars that were gutted in the workshop fire off EM Bypass on Thursday remained on tenterhooks a day later with the automobile dealer expressing inability to provide any assurance till the damage had been assessed by insurance surveyors.Though officials of One Auto — the dealer principal of Maruti Suzuki whose workshop went up in flames — said they had intimated National Insurance about the incident, no official from the insurance firm has surveyed the damage yet.“It is only after our insurance firm gives a report that we can proceed with the survey of cars by firms they were insured with. Any assurance on repair or replacement will be provided to the owners thereafter,” said an official. He, though, acknowledged that since the vehicles were in the workshop’s custody at the time of the fire, the onus of the damage lies with the management and not car owners.The vehicle owners, while being assured that the cars they get would be road-worthy, have not been provided with a timeline.

Title: Rivals slam PhonePe's 'ATM' business, question launch in absence of rules
Content:
(Representative image)

BENGALURU: PhonePe ATM , a new service that lets consumers withdraw cash from its offline merchants via the Unified Payments Interface ( UPI ), has angered rivals who have drawn the attention of the regulator to the issue, three people aware of the matter said.On Friday last week, this became the centre of an intense debate during the steering committee meeting of the National Payments Corporation of India ( NPCI ). The meeting saw banks and PhonePe’s rivals — including Paytm — raising questions on PhonePe being allowed to launch this service in the absence of any regulatory framework on cash withdrawal through UPI.While cash withdrawal at point-of-sales (PoS) machines is allowed by the Reserve Bank of India ( RBI ), NPCI hasn’t yet formulated norms for this using the UPI platform. Sources said NPCI is now working on framing guidelines for the same.The corporation also debated with banks if the service should be charged to consumers, which PhonePe is not in favour of as it feels a charge on cash withdrawal will “kill” the service. NPCI is considering following the model for cash withdrawal at a PoS device to issue its own circular for a similar service through UPI.Another source aware of the goings-on added that PhonePe being allowed to launch the service in the absence of existing guidelines has been highlighted by its rivals to the regulator, putting NPCI under pressure. The ATM-like service, which clocked 1 lakh withdrawals over Friday and Saturday last week, is available with a million merchants in India. PhonePe has 10 million merchants in total.Sources close to PhonePe added it is not considering stopping its ATM service, which was highlighted as “revolutionary” by Walmart’s international CEO and president Judith McKenna in Tuesday’s annual investor meeting in New York.“It has to be dealt with carefully since some stakeholders can misuse the cash withdrawal without adequate checks and balances. Banks are pushing to levy a charge, which PhonePe is resisting. PhonePe’s UPI rivals are contesting that everyone should be given an equal opportunity when adequate guidelines are not in place,” a source said.Another person aware of the talks said, “Now that NPCI is working on guidelines, anyone with existing products should ideally pause operations until a further update from the umbrella payments body comes.” According to current discussions, NPCI is of the view that a maximum of Rs 10 can be charged for each cash withdrawal via UPI with a daily limit of Rs 2,000 through three transactions.Emailed queries to PhonePe and NPCI did not elicit any response. “We already have a Paytm ka ATM service that offers cash-in and cash-out facility from more than 67,000 locations in India for our customers,” Paytm said in a statement without commenting on PhonePe ATM.Paytm ka ATM was launched in December 2017 via its payments bank, enabled by banking correspondents, or BCs.“If such models are allowed before NPCI frames rules, what happens to the jobs of BCs?,” one of the people mentioned earlier added. PhonePe ATM is part of the company’s aggressive marketing plan, which entails a budget of Rs 800 crore for 2020 with Bollywood actors Aamir Khan and Alia Bhatt as its brand ambassadors.

Title: Indus Towers, Bharti Infratel can merge: DoT
Content:
Vodafone Idea chairman Kumar Mangalam Birla (File photo)

NEW DELHI/MUMBAI: Cash-strapped, struggling operations of Vodafone Idea saw a glimmer of hope to raise funds with the department of telecom ( DoT ) approving the merger of Indus Towers with Bharti Infratel to form one of the world’s largest tower companies.The merger, which had been first announced in April 2018 but had been pending, will give an opportunity to Vodafone Idea to divest its little over 11% stake in the combined entity and raise around Rs 5,000 crore. The fund-raising will be crucial for the telco, which has to pay Rs 53,000 crore to the government following the October 24 AGR ( adjusted gross revenues ) judgment of the Supreme Court . So far, it has paid only Rs 2,500 crore, while there is speculation that it may have given another Rs 1,000 crore.The deal is understood to have received a go-ahead after the merging companies received the foreign direct investment (FDI) nod from DoT on Friday evening. Sources attributed the delay in merger to a withholding tax dispute between UK’s Vodafone Group and India. There is no official confirmation from the companies on the matter.According to plans, the combined entity will be called Indus Towers with over 1.63 lakh towers, and this would own the respective businesses of Bharti Infratel and Indus Towers. Indus Towers is a three-way joint venture between Bharti Infratel, Vodafone Group and Vodafone Idea, with the first two holding 42% each. Vodafone Idea owns 11.2%, while the remaining 4.9% is with private equity firm Providence. On the other hand, Airtel has a majority stake in Bharti Infratel.The Bharti Infratel and Indus Towers merger deal was first signed on April 25, 2018, and was to be concluded by October 24 last year. Subsequently, the companies extended the deal completion initially by two months to December 24, and thereafter another two months to February 24.The clearance comes just days after K M Birla , chairman of Vodafone Idea, held a series of meetings with the government regarding the AGR matter and health of the telecom sector. Birla met telecom secretary Anshu Prakash earlier this week, while also meeting FM Nirmala Sitharaman on Thursday. The government has assured Vodafone Idea, and even Airtel (which has to pay Rs 35,000 crore in AGR dues), that it is working out ways to enable the companies to stay afloat.Top officials in the telecom department have said that while adhering to the apex court’s order is “priority number one”, efforts are also on to ensure that existing companies get an enabling environment to save their operations.

Title: Ahmedabad has just 0.54 metre of road per vehicle
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Ahmedabad has 48 lakh registered vehicles which works out to just 0.54m of road per vehicle.

AHMEDABAD: You may have bought your dream car, but if driving it in the city is proving a nightmare, blame poor town planning and the rapidly growing number of vehicles in the city.

According to an analysis of figures from the government, Ahmedabad city that has 48 lakh registered vehicles which works out to just 0.54m of road per vehicle. The situation is bound to get worse, as the city is rapidly adding vehicles while its road length is stagnant since 2017.

According to the ‘Road Transport Yearbook for 2016-17’ published by the Union ministry of road transport and highways, Ahmedabad’s vehicle population was 39.05 lakh in 2017 and 9.05 lakh vehicles were added till 2019, taking the total to 48.10 lakh.

The vehicle population in Ahmedabad city is increasing by 2.5 to 3 lakh vehicles a year, or 5-6% annually.

Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) officials said that the city’s total road length is 2,580km, which has been stagnant since 2017.

H M Shivanand Swamy, executive director of the centre of excellence in urban transport at Cept University, said that the city’s road length is too low for to meet prescribed road safety standards. “The city should have about two metres of road per vehicle. Authorities cannot control the increasing number of vehicles, but it can always create a strong public transport system,” Swamy said.

“The AMC’s decision to move AMTS buses out of the dedicated BRT corridor has made traffic congestion worse in the city,” said a senior AMC official.

The failure of the BRT and AMTS bus systems has also added to traffic woes, he said. Road safety expert Amit Khatri says, “The public transport system has failed miserably, which is the reason for the increase in the number of private vehicles.”

The report states that the 42 Indian cities with populations higher than 10 lakh have 7.28 crore motor vehicles registered, up to March 31, 2017, or 28.75% of all vehicles registered in India.

According to the report, Delhi has the most registered motor vehicles (1.03 crore), followed by Bengaluru (68.33 lakh), Chennai (52.99 lakh), Ahmedabad (39.04 lakh), Greater Mumbai (30.53 lakh) and Surat (28.87 lakh).

These six cities account for 44.27% of the vehicles in the 42 cities mentioned in the report. Surat reported the fastest growth (12.21%) in vehicle numbers in the last 10 years.

Title: Bihar: Will disapprove divisive statements, says Chirag Paswan
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Chirag Paswan

PATNA: Lok Janshakti Party (LJP) national president Chirag Paswan on Saturday made it clear that he will not support any hate speech of his alliance leaders and said development should be the only agenda of the NDA. Chirag admitted that NDA had to suffer in Delhi assembly election because of such statements.

Responding to questions regarding controversial statement made by BJP MP Giriraj Singh in Purnea on Thursday that all the Muslims should have been sent to Pakistan during partition in 1947, Chirag before launching his ‘Bihar first Bihari first Yatra’ said, “There are leaders in alliance with whom I do not agree. Even if such divisive statement is made during the election, I will disapprove of it. The way government has been formed in Delhi, development should be the agenda for Bihar election. Everyone should leave the politics of caste and religion and focus on development.”

This is not for the first time that Chirag has opposed controversial statements. Even on the day of Delhi assembly results, he had tweeted, “Today Delhi’s result has proved that people reward for the work done. The way in Lok Sabha election vote was given on PM Modi’s work, similarly in Delhi election Arvind Kejriwal ji has got the blessings. Lots of best wishes for today’s victory (sic).”

On a question pertaining to ongoing protests in the state, including that by sub-inspector aspirants, he replied, “I have talked to chief minister Nitish Kumar to hold dialogue with them. Lathicharge is not the solution.”

Talking about his yatra, he said LJP will be going to all the districts. In the first phase, he will interact with party functionaries to know the local problem of that region. This yatra will conclude on April 14 at Gandhi Maidan in Patna with a proper vision document. Chirag further said LJP will soon be launching a toll-free number on which people could tell about their problem.

“Our aim is to make Bihar the number one state in the country. Though we got independent with other states, we are still lagging behind others on many parameters. We have had a golden history and we have to revive that. Right now migration is a big problem and we have to stop that.”

However, he said, CM Nitish had worked a lot to bring the state out of Jungle Raj era. “A lot has been done and a lot more has to be done,” said Chirag.

Without taking the name of leader of opposition in state assembly Tejashwi Prasad Yadav , Chirag mocked at his ‘Berozgari Hatao Yatra’ saying such yatra had no vision and had negative thoughts attached. On a question regarding poll strategist Prashant Kishor, who too was emphasizing on development of Bihar in the coming election and if there were chances of their coming together, Chirag replied, “That is a hypothetical question. My thoughts regarding development are quite old, but it is good to see that people are now discussing this issue.”

Title: SHO, constable suspended for releasing drunken people in Patna
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: An SHO and a police constable were put under suspension, while the contract of a village chowkidar was terminated on Friday for releasing six people detained for violating prohibition law , from the police station in Patna district late on Wednesday night.

The disciplinary action was initiated against Dhanarua police station SHO Suman Kumar, driver Yogendra Kumar and chowkidar Amitabh Bachchan by Patna SSP Upendra Kumar Sharma on the basis of a detailed investigation conducted by City SP East Jitendra Kumar.

Confirming the action, the SSP on Friday said, “Such lapses on part of any police officer in the district will not be tolerated. Police personnel found to be lax in implementing prohibition law at Dhanarua police station have already been suspended and departmental proceedings have been initiated against them. In addition, suitable action has also been taken against the chowkidar.”

According to reports, altogether six people were detained at the Dhanarua police station on Thursday night after being found in drunken state. One of them, stated to be nephew of an influential mukhiya of the area, was first released from the police station. Five others were also let off with the connivance of the cops manning the police station the same night.

Patna SSP Sharma swung into action and ordered an investigation soon after receiving complaint from some local residents that those detained at the Dhanarua police station for consuming liquor in violation of Bihar Excise and Prohibition Act 2016 were released from the police station after being obliged by their relatives.

City SP (East) Kumar along with Masaurhi SDPO Sonu Kumar immediately visited the police station and inquired about the allegations levelled against the police personnel. “All six people, who were released from police custody, were summoned at the Dhanarua police station. Breathalyzer test, however, confirmed that five of them had consumed alcohol,” the City SP (East) said.

He said one of them, who had not tested positive in the test, was, however, released after verification. During investigation, it was found that five of the drunken people were earlier released from police custody under pressure. “We didn’t find any evidence of illegal gratification as alleged by some people,” Kumar said.

As per the provisions of the new prohibition law, Suman Kumar, a sub-inspector of police, would be deprived of being posted as SHO of any police station in the state for next 10 years. “The SSP is not in a mood to let off any cop found to be lax in implementing prohibition law under his jurisdiction,” an SP rank officer told this newspaper on the condition of anonymity.

Earlier, DGP Gupteshwar Pandey had ordered the suspension of Gaurichak police station and transfer of all the police personnel posted there on the complaints of residents of Chipura village that the cops were hands in glove with liquor smugglers.

Title: Bihar: Rats blamed for nibbling saline bottles in hospital
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Rodents are at it again in Bihar! After the state government had blamed rats for consuming seized liquor kept in police malkhanas (storerooms) in dry Bihar and damaging the river embankments causing floods in 2017, the rodents have reportedly nibbled hundreds of saline bottles stored in the government hospital at Katihar .

The saline bottles meant to be supplied to the primary health centres across Katihar district were found damaged in the storeroom of Sadar hospital a couple of days back. The matter came to light when the acting superintendent of Katihar sadar hospital, Dr Arvind Prasad Shahi, inquired about the saline bottles earlier supplied by the health department.

When contacted, Shahi said, “I have been told by the hospital employees that the saline bottles were damaged by rats. I immediately visited the storeroom where medicines and saline bottles were stored to be provided to patients. I found the bottles badly damaged and some of them not fit for use. I have already ordered an inquiry into the matter.”

Shahi further said the drugs and saline bottles have been stocked outside the storeroom, which is already packed. Moreover, another building meant for the purpose is under construction. He, however, didn’t rule out mishandling of a few cartons full of medicines and saline bottles damaged during the course of unloading from the vehicles or transportation.

Shahi is also holding additional charge of civil surgeon. He said the medicines have been supplied from the central storeroom more than the storage capacity of the storeroom in Katihar sadar hospital. As a result, a few cartons were kept on the verandah of the storeroom. “The storeroom is the centre from where medicines and saline bottles are supplied to the PHCs in the district,” he told this newspaper over phone on Friday.

Efforts to contact senior officials of health department in Patna, however, proved futile. The cellphone numbers of senior officers of the department were either found switched off or went unattended. However, an employee of the department said, “The senior officers are not picking up phone calls due to Mahashivaratri holiday.”

Earlier, rats were accused of drinking hundreds of litres of seized liquor from the police malkhanas in Patna and Kaimur districts. Later, the then state water resources department minister Rajiv Ranjan Singh alias Lalan Singh (now a JD(U) MP from Munger) had accused rats for causing holes in many river embankments causing floods in several districts of north Bihar in 2017. Besides, a huge cash stored in the vigilance police station in Patna were eaten by rodents.

Title: Coronavirus scare: Education officers to conduct awareness drive in Bihar government schools
Content:
Representative image

PATNA: Following the Centre’s directive, the state education department has instructed district education officers (DEOs) and district programme officers (DPOs) to conduct awareness drive on coronavirus in government and government-aided schools in the wake of its outbreak in China.Bihar Education Project Council project director Sanjay Kumar Singh issued a letter to the officials concerned on Thursday evening, directing them to spread awareness about the virus and step to be taken to keep students safe. He asked the DEOs and DPOs to share information pamphlet furnished by the Centre in this regard.The preventive measures mentioned in the letter include frequent handwash and respiratory etiquettes like using handkerchief over mouth or using tissue paper or the shirt’s sleeve covering upper arm while coughing and sneezing.The other preventive interventions are staying away from school and avoiding public gathering when sick.“Experts still not have much information about coronavirus, but since it is a communicable disease, we need to make people aware how to prevent this disease by adopting measures. Along with the letter, I have also sent the Centre’s advisories for coronavirus, which will help the teachers and students understand precautionary measures. The pictorials in advisory are self-explanatory,” Singh said.“There is no medicine or vaccine available for coronavirus. Only the awareness can prevent such disease,” he added.In the letter, Singh stated: “The aim of the advisory is to make students aware of what the virus is and not to panic unnecessarily. Informed kids can be agents of change for their family, relatives and society at large.”

Title: Teachers’ protest continues in Patna
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Hundreds of government schoolteachers staged protest at district education office here on the second day on Friday against the show-cause notices issued to niyojit (contractual) teachers and termination of regular teachers in Patna district.

The protesting teachers also performed ‘havan’ on the occasion of Mahashivaratri and offered Friday namaz outside the DEO office.

Prem Kumar, a niyojit teacher and member of Bihar State Primary Teachers’ Association, told this newspaper that they organized ‘havan’ and prayer to ebb away bad omens. “Tomorrow, we will protest with plate and glass. We will not let them work until they revoke the termination order and show-cause notices,” he said.

Manoj Kumar, a regular teacher terminated, said the state government must hear our demands of equal pay for equal work, pension scheme and service conditions for contract teachers among others.

Rameshwar, another niyojit teacher said, “We will not move an inch till the Patna DEO takes back his FIR against teachers. Protest is our democratic right. We had only gheraoed the DEO office. We neither caused inconvenience to them nor ransacked anything. Then why he lodged complaint against the teachers?”

Patna district education officer (DEO) Jyoti Kumar on late Thursday evening filed an FIR against seven niyojit teachers for gherao and disturbing the office functioning.

Jyoti said on Friday that he cannot revoke the termination order or take back the show-cause notices. “We are acting on the direction of education department. If they keep hampering the office work, we will take action. Today, the staff worked amid heavy police deployment,” he said.

“Altogether 250 show-cause notices were issued to niyojit teachers. Also, two regular teachers were issued termination order and FIR was lodged against seven teachers,” he said.

Around 4.5 lakh teachers of government and government-aided schools have been protesting under the banner of Bihar Rajya Shikshak Sangharsh Samanvay Samiti (BRSSSS) across the state, hampering the academic activities in 75,000 schools in Bihar.

BJP MLC Nawal Kishor Yadav has supported the teacher’s agitation. He said the dismissal of teachers was wrong. “The state government should seriously consider the teachers’ demands,” he said.

42 examinees expelled

Altogether 42 matriculation examinees were expelled on Friday for using unfair means during the ongoing exam being conducted by Bihar School Examination Board. Three impersonators were arrested from exam centres in Gaya district

According to BSEB sources, those expelled included 10 in Patna, eight in Nalanda, six in Bhojpur , three each in Munger, Nawada and Saran and one each in Jamui, Saharsa, Madhepura, Darbhanga, Rohtas, Gaya and Siwan.

Around 12.83 lakh students appeared for Hindi paper, 1.67 lakh for Urdu, 3,134 for Bangla and 78,651 for Maithili on Friday.

Title: Bihar: Preference to research in teachers’ appointments
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: Youths aspiring for assistant professorship in the universities of Bihar would now get more weightage on their research publications and post-doctoral work in selection by the Bihar State University Service Commission (BSUSC). This is a major highlight of the draft statute relating to the appointment of assistant professors finalized by a three-member committee constituted by the chancellor recently.

The draft statute prepared by Magadh University vice-chancellor Rajendra Prasad, Purnea University VC Rajesh Singh and Munger University VC Ranjit Kumar Verma is likely to be assented to be by the chancellor in a week, paving the way for initiating the process of appointment of assistant professors against existing vacancies.

According to sources, the new statutes envisage selection on 115 marks, including 100 marks on academics and 15 on interview. Earlier, the selection was made on 100 marks, including 85 marks on academics and 15 on interview.

The draft statutes provide for a maximum of 15 marks on graduation and 25 marks on postgraduation degrees. A candidate having MPhil degree would get seven marks, while a candidate having a PhD degree as per the UGC guidelines would get 30 marks. Candidates who are NET qualified with JRF will get seven marks, while who is NET qualified without JRF would be awarded only five marks. On the other hand, a BET/SLET qualified candidate would be awarded three marks.

A candidate would get a maximum of 10 marks on research publications (at the rate of two marks on each paper published in journals validated by UGC or Scopus). Similarly, a candidate would get a maximum of 10 marks on teaching experience. Candidates are also entitled for a maximum of three marks on getting state or national awards.

The state education department has already requisitioned the details of existing vacancies of assistant professors in different subjects from all the universities and the same would be advertised by the university service panel shortly, said sources.

It may be mentioned here that with a view to addressing the issue of shortage of teaching faculty in higher education institutions, the UGC had in June last year issued fresh guidelines for recruitment of faculty and had also set a time frame of six months for completing the entire recruitment process. Unfortunately, Bihar failed to meet the deadline. The UGC guidelines state that the higher education institutions should follow the selection process as per their Acts and statutes and in accordance with the UGC (Minimum Qualifications for Appointment of Teachers and other Academic Staff in Universities and Colleges and other Measures for the Maintenance of Standards in Higher Education) Regulations, 2018.

Title: Bihar: Chhatra JD(U) to reach colleges to counter Prashant Kishor
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Prashant Kishor

PATNA: In an apparent attempt to counter Prashant Kishor ’s ‘Baat Bihar Ki’ programme, Chhatra JD(U) -- the student wing of ruling JD(U) -- on Friday decided to launch a ‘Chalo Nitish Ke Sang’ (move along with Nitish Kumar ) programme at all 477 constituent and affiliated colleges and 10 traditional universities across the state from March 15.

“Workers of the Chhatra JD(U) will go to all colleges and universities and hold a series of programmes on the campus to inform youths about the works done by Nitish for improving educational scenario in the state,” JD(U) MLC and party incharge for Chhatra JD(U) Ranbir Nandan told TOI on Friday.

He said the Chhatra JD(U) would soon launch a toll-free number also. “Any student can enrol as Chhatra JD(U) member by making a call on that number. We will soon issue the said number,” Nandan said.

Kishor has already launched a toll-free number for enrolling youths under the ‘ Baat Bihar Ki ’ programme.

The JD(U) MLC said the ‘Chalo Nitish Ke Sang’ programme would continue till May 15. During the period, the Chhatra JD(U) activists would hold different types of programmes on the campuses and also make people aware about the benefits of the state government’s flagship programme — ‘Jal-Jevan-Hariyali Abhiyan.’

“Recently, questions were raised as to what Nitish Kumar has done for improving quality of education in the state,” Nandan said without taking Kishor’s name. “Now, Chhatra JD(U) members will move to campuses and make person-to-person contact among students and inform them how Nitish Kumar brought changes in the education scenario in the state,” he said.

Kishor, during his press conference on Tuesday, had alleged that Nitish failed to improve quality of education in Bihar during his last 15 years. More than three lakh youths registered for Kishor’s ambitious programme by Friday evening.

To a question, how the JD(U) will counter Kishor when he had already started enrolling youths by launching a toll-free number, Nandan said, “We do not have competition with any one. But our toll-free number will be released soon.”

Title: Agra mayor to welcome US President Donald Trump by handing over silver key of city
Content:
US President Donald Trump. (AFP photo)

AGRA: In a symbolic gesture to pay respect to the state guest, Mayor Naveen Jain will welcome US President Donald Trump by handing over a ‘key of the city’ which is made of silver.The key designed by the AMC administration will be of 12 inches. It will have a picture of Taj Mahal and ‘Welcome to Agra ’ and ‘ Agra Municipal Corporation ’ carved on both sides. The key is being prepared by a Delhi based jewellery designer.Mayor Naveen Jain said, “As the representative of the citizens of Agra, I will welcome the US president by handing over a key of the city at the Kheria airbase. This is a gesture to convey the cultural message of ‘Athithi Devo Bhava’ (guest is god). Grand arrangements are being made to welcome the president Trump and first lady Melania Trump.”According to the district administration officials, governor of Uttar Pradesh Anandiben Patel and CM Yogi Adityanath will be visiting Agra on February 24 to welcome the US president and first lady.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: 8-month-old boy rescued, kidnappers arrested
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

VARANASI: An eight-month-old boy abducted from Mirzapur district in December 2019 was rescued on Friday after his kidnappers , including a woman and a minor, were arrested on a tip-off.

Dharmraj of Sikari village under Padari police station of Mirzapur, had lodged an abduction FIR against unidentified persons after his son Sagar went missing on December 17.

Padari inspector Manjay Singh said the name of one Shankar Chauhan of Devapur village came to light during investigation. Police followed a tip-off and caught Shankar, his wife Shivani and his 14-year-old brother at Dagmagpur Crossing. The infant was with them on a bike.

During interrogation, Shankar confessed that he had abducted the baby boy because his wife was unable to conceive. His juvenile brother and he had picked up the infant from Dharmraj’s shop during a visit last year.

Title: Kolkata: Pension plan for government art college models
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee

KOLKATA: Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Friday announced that models working at the government art college will get a pension of Rs 1,500 per month. At an ‘ International Mother Language Day ’ programme at Deshapriya Park, Banerjee handed over cheques to 15 models working at Government College of Art and Craft, Kolkata, and Rabindra Bharati University .

“After a certain age, it becomes hard for the models to work. The condition of the models is really pathetic and the government has decided to provide them with a pension of Rs 1,500 per month. The first cheque will be handed over today,” the CM said.

Altogether, 15 models — of which 14 are women — were handed cheques on Friday. “Among the 14 models, 10 are from the art college and four are from Rabindra Bharati University. Most of them are above 60, but still have to work because they have no other income source,” said Prodosh Pal, the painter who approached the CM for the pension.

“On February 3, I gave the CM details of the models and today she made a permanent arrangement for them,” Pal added.

Title: Morbi bank loot: All robbers history-sheeters from Punjab, Haryana
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Rajkot: Six robbers who carried out a daylight robbery in Bank of Baroda-Dena Bank in Morbi on Thursday are hardened criminals from Punjab and Haryana who are wanted for serious offences in the two states.

It was after a nearly 100 km chase in the internal roads and villages of Morbi that lasted for nearly three hours that four of the six were nabbed said Morbi local crime branch (LCB) sources on Friday. Six pistols which included three pistols of Turkey, Russian and Serbia make and three country-made revolvers alogn with 131 cartridges were seized from them.

Those nabbed were Ranjeet Singh Jat, Mandeep Singh Jat (28), Balveersingh Jat (25), Arunkumar Singh Majabi (30) and Sandeepkumar Gujjar (30) and their unidentified associate. They are history-sheeters in bank robbery, murder and drug trafficking cases. Except Ranjeet Singh and his aide, four others were nabbed by the police with the help of villagers.

LCB inspector VB Jadeja said, “After robbing Rs 6 lakh cash from the bank, the robbers fled in their car towards Halvad.”

“We alerted Halvad police station and asked them to barricade the road. However, the robbers spotted the cops near Halvad and took a U turn. They turned towards Thara village and went to Sundari Bhawani village and then to Mathak,” Jadeja told TOI.

Police then informed Mathak sarpanch Sukhdevsinh Zala who took locals and those from adjoining Naldari and Khetaradi villages and blocked the road by putting tractors, trolleys and bullock carts.

When cornered, the robbers drove their car into a farm. On hitting a dead end, they abandoned their car and started running into the field spreading 30 bighas which had maize crop.

Villagers were already deployed along the fringes of the field and they were armed with bats and iron pipes.

Jadeja formed four teams consisting of 12 cops. While one team caught three robbers, the other team nabbed another.

Police also recovered Rs 6,09,600 cash that was looted from the banks, three cellphones and a digital video recorder from the robbers.

RANJEETSINH WAS THE MASTERMIND

None of the accused had an idea of Morbi except for Ranjeetsingh Jat who was well-versed with the topography of the ‘ceramic town’. “Jat had visited Morbi as a truck driver earlier. He knew how wealthy the city was, and he passed on this information to the other accused. Together they had plotted the bank robbery,” said Jadeja.

THERE WERE REPORTS OF FIRING

Though the police have denied, there have been reports of firing by the robbers. “The villagers say the robbers had fired in the air to scare them away at the road block. The robbers also opened fire in the field,” said a source.

MASTERMIND CHANGED THE CAR

After fleeing in a car from Morbi, Ranjeetsingh alighted at Mahendranagar crossroads, got into another car and fled with another accused, whose identity could not be ascertained.

Title: Tamil Nadu signs MoUs with three foreign firms
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Chennai: The Tamil Nadu government on Friday signed memorandums of understanding with Japan-based Mitsuba Sical, South Korea-based Hanon Automotive Systems and US-based Jogo Health at the two-day Diplomatic Outreach event for projects worth Rs 1254 crore in the State. The MoUs were exchanged by officials in the presence of chief minister Edappadi K Palaniswami. The chief minister also virtually laid foundation stone to Polymer Industries Park project with an investment of Rs 217 crore in Tiruvallur district, at the two-day ‘Diplomatic Outreach’ event which aims to focus on economic and investment opportunities in the State was jointly organised and hosted by the ministry of external affairs and Tamil Nadu State Government.

Tamil Nadu Polymer Industries Park Ltd is a JV of TIDCO and SIPCOT.

“This state-of-art park is planned with a coverage area of 250 acres and aims to generate an additional investment of Rs 3000 crore and create employment for around 7,000 people,” Palaniswami said. Referring to the high-level team which travelled across the US, UK and UAE and mobilized investments worth Rs 8,835 crore in 2019, he added “One such project, Jogo Health has increased its investment 16 times more than the actual investment committed by them.”

Addressing trade partners and diplomats, the state’s chief secretary K Shanmugam said, “Tamil Nadu being the second biggest economy in the country, also leads as the manufacturing hub while provide unlimited opportunity to investors to levy the potential and preferred. Despite gloomy business climate globally, the state has registered an impressive growth of 8.2% in 2018-19, and continue to maintain the growth momentum.” TN’s projected growth rate stood at 7.2% this year higher than the national average. “The per capita income at constant price has gone up by 53% from approx. Rs 92,000 in 2011-12 to Rs 1,47,000 in 2019-20,” Shanmugam said.

He also requested the state’s trade partners and diplomats for their cooperation and mutual understanding to facilitate investment and promote innovation and technology.

Over 50 foreign diplomats and senior government officials attended the event.

Title: Hotel, 2 firms fined for serving food in plastic
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kolhapur: The civic administration on Friday slapped fine on two food delivery service firms and a hotel for delivering and packaging food in plastic carry bags.

Municipal commissioner Mallinath Kalshetti had received complaints that the firms involved in food delivery service were using plastic carry bags for packaging food. Kalshetti asked a staff of the sanitation department to order food from Zomato and Swiggy. When the delivery boys arrived at the KMC building with the order, the packages were checked.

“We found that the food we ordered was packed in plastic carry bags. We immediately fined Rs 5,000 on the Zomato and Swiggy. We have also slapped a fine of Rs 5,000 on the hotel, Kolhapur Dining, for packing the food in banned plastic material,” said Vijay Patil, in-charge of solid waste management.

Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) has decided to make the city plastic-free from March 31. The civic administration has already initiated a drive to fine traders storing and dispensing plastic carry bags. The bags are bought from the trading town of Gandhinagar. Recently, Kalshetti fined a medical shop owner where had gone as a chief guest to inaugurate a health check-up camp.

“After our city-wide drive commenced, many citizens started reporting to us about the use of plastic bags and materials used by traders and online delivery service firm. Since last month, over 200 traders have been fined for dispensing plastic bags. We are already making citizens aware as to how plastic carry bags are choking up drains and contributing to filth in many localities,” said Patil.

Title: CA dupes textile trader of Rs 3 crore on overdraft loan
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Surat: Police have registered a complaint against a Chartered Accountant (CA) for allegedly cheating a textile trader of Rs 3 crore by misusing overdraft loan facility against property from the latter’s bank account.

Complainant Pankaj Jain, 42, a textile trader and resident of Ratan Ansh Apartment in Vesu had met CA Pratik Kumar Meghani, having an office in Varachha’s Hirabaug in 2017. Since Jain was in need of money, Meghani lured him to use overdraft facility against his property to get a loan.

Meghani promised Jain to get him approval of overdraft facility from the complainant’s Axis bank account against his property and also by using his influence on Axis bank officials. He also showed Jain his own cash credit worth Rs 1.5 crore in Kotak bank account.

According to the police, Jain had given property documents of his apartment at Satkarm apartment in Saroli to be mortgaged in Axis bank. On March 28, 2017, the accused had informed Jain that the bank has accepted the documents and that an overdraft loan amounting to Rs 3.1 crore would be approved from the Axis bank.

Police stated that the complainant had to visit Delhi for some personal work and also informed Meghani about it. Meghani asked Jain to submit five letterheads of his firm duly signed for presenting in the bank. However, after his return, Meghani told Jain that the bank has stalled the process of approving his overdraft loan and that it will take some time.

In June 2017, the complainant received a call from his bank asking him to pay outstanding interest on his overdraft loan. When he inquired with the bank, Jain came to know that his overdraft loan was approved and Rs 3 crore was transferred to two other accounts.

Talking with TOI, police inspector of Umara police station, ML Salunke said, “When the complainant realised that he was cheated, he approached the CA and threatened him dire consequence. The CA then paid him Rs 35 lakh interest money and promised to pay the remaining amount soon, which he, however, did not till date. The textile trader then lodged a complaint with the police.”

Salunke added, “The CA is on the run and we have launched a manhunt to arrest him.”

Title: Elephant expert inspects tusker
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Thrissur: Elephant expert from Assam Dr K Kunal Sharma, on Thursday, inspected the health of Guruvayoor Padmanabhan , a tusker of the Guruvayoor Devaswom, on a request from Devaswom officials.

Recently, the Devaswom-appointed expert committee found that the tusker suffered swelling on its body and they are providing ayurvedic and allopathic treatment to it .

Guruvayoor Devaswom deputy administrator S Sasidaran said, “Dr Kunal Sharma, who inspected the tusker, recommended the continuation of its treatment. The doctor said that the tusker’s health will be better within a week.”

“The doctor also suggested against the forest department’s decision of forcible rest to the tusker. Instead, he advised morning and evening walks. The doctor also said the tusker is suffering from age-related issues,” Sasidaran added.

The forest department had imposed curbs on Guruvayoor tuskers ‘Guruvayoor Padmanabhan’ and ‘Valiyakesavan’ on December 7 over participation in any functions due to age and health-related issues.

Title: Private bank hired goons who called up EMI defaulters & threatened them posing as cops
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Agra: A gang of eight men was busted by Agra police who were allegedly hired by a leading private bank to make threatening calls to customers who failed to pay EMI on time. Operating a fake call centre, the gang also recovered loan money from customers via e-wallets, which were later wired into bank accounts.

Posing themselves as policemen, lawyers and bank managers, the gang used to make calls from SIM cards which were issued on fake IDs. Most of the victims were from Indore, Ranchi, Patna, Lucknow, Ahmedabad, Chandigarh, Delhi, Mumbai and other cities. They received threatening calls for failing to pay EMI on time.

The apprehended accused were identified as Desh Deepak Singh (28), Bantu Singh (27), Kanhaiya Sharma (28), Manoj Kumar (24), Gautam Rathore (24), Dharmender Kumar (27), Sachin Verma (27) and Bhudev Singh (27). All the accused were booked under IPC section 419 (punishment for cheating by personation), 420 (cheating), 384 (extortion) and 507 (criminal intimidation by an anonymous communication).

“The gang was operating for the past six months from a fake call centre based at a rented property on Ukhra road. The gang’s kingpin Desh Deepak Gautam used to charge 20% commission from the private bank for each successful loan recovery. An absconding accused identified as Raj Kumar of Bah area is the broker between bank and the gang. He used to bring the list of bank customers to the gang, who were marked defaulters by the bank for not paying EMI on time. The gang members were extorting money over the phone after threatening them for legal action as well as dire consequences,” said Kamlesh Kumar, station house officer (SHO) of Sadar police.

One of the victims, identified as Santosh from Delhi, who failed to pay EMI of his loan time, said that he had paid Rs 2,500 via e-wallet to the gang, after one of the callers claimed himself to be sub-inspector of Delhi police. While Aryan of Indore said, “They claimed themselves to be lawyers, representing the bank and threatened with legal action if loan taken by mother was not paid on time. I somehow managed to gather the amount and paid it to the gang.”

“Posing themselves as policemen, lawyers and bank managers, the gang used to create an impression on customers that they were actually policemen or associated with police. The gang used to play app on smartphone which emitted sounds of police siren, walkie-talkie, police radio ringtone in the background etc. Even on the true-caller, the phone numbers of the gang were saved as SSP, police inspector, advocate, bank office and with other names,” the SHO said.

The SHO added, “Our investigation will now shift to bank’s involvement. We need to establish as how deep they are equally responsible for threat calls and extortion. Soon, we will lodge FIR against them, once the sufficient evidence is collected.”

Title: Lead state team to PM, Vijai tells CM
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Panaji: Taking a dig at the BJP-led state government over the Mhadei issue, former deputy chief minister Vijai Sardesai said the governemnt has compromised Goa’s interests to remain in power.

He also called on all opposition members to unite and hit the streets to oppose the functioning of chief minister Pramod Sawant ’s government.

Sardesai said that Sawant should lead a delegation of state MLAs to Prime Minister Narendra Modi informing the Centre about the collateral damage that depletion of water flow in Mhadei will have on Goa’s economy and ecology.

“He should resign because there is no moral right for him to continue after he traded something that he calls his mother,” Sardesai said.

Former water resources minister Vinod Paliencar said the state government is allowing Karnataka to institutionalise and regularise the illegalities in the construction of the Kalasa Bandura project.

He said that the BJP was resorting to lies to portray Goa’s loss as a victory.

Title: Lone teacher for Class 1 to 8 as colleague on ‘poll duty’ for a yr
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Mhow: About 100 students of class one to eight of Kushalgarh government school in Mhow tehsil are taught by a lone teacher as the other teacher posted there has been attached to the election commission office in Indore since 2018 assembly elections.

The primary and middle school were integrated two years back and thus the school has two teachers Jainarayan Ninama and Manish Malviya respectively. Ninama, however, who is a primary school teacher, is forced to teach all the students up to class eight. Malviya, a resident of Indore, allegedly managed to remain attached to the election commission office so that he won’t have to travel to Kushalgarh, 40 km from Indore, daily.

Ninama said that he asks all the students to sit together and manages their studies. Though he tries his best, the parents of students say that their studies were badly affected due to the absence of Malviya.

When contacted, Malviya said that he was working with the election office following the order of higher authorities and not on his own. He said about a week’s work is still remaining on his part.

Indore district panchayat CEO Neha Meena said she will take strict action if the teacher is found guilty and those shielding him will also face action.

Sources said Meena has asked her subordinates working for the education department to submit a detailed report on the matter.

Title: CBSE exams: Entry at 7.30am at four centres in city
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

City officials of the Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) on Friday said that students at four examination centres near the route of PM Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump road show will be allowed entry from 7.30am instead of 9am. The exams begin at 10am.

The decision has been taken to reduce any potential trouble for students and their parents, the officials said. Question papers and answersheets will reach these centres — Kendriya Vidyalayas in cantonment and Shahibaug, Poddar International School in Chandkheda, and Rachana High School in Shahibaug — at 6.30am.

Class X students will take the language paper on the Trump trip day, Monday, and Class XII students will take the physical education exam, the first paper.

Mrugen Shah, the city coordinator for the CBSE and principal of Prakash High School, said that about 400 students of Classes X and XII along with 17 external students will take the exams at these four centres. “We already have had a word with city police officials who have assured us of all support,” he said. “The students can show their identity cards and hall tickets if they face any difficulty on Monday.”

The school officials have also been asked to ensure that students and their parents can enter the premises —excluding the examination classrooms — before the lockdown of roads begin. The schools will provide refreshments to students in case the lockdown stays in place after the exams end at 1pm.

Title: 30 constituencies reserved for elections
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Panaji: For the upcoming zilla panchayat polls 30 of the 50 constituencies have been reserved for various sections of society. The reservations have been done according to the population with one-third of the seats kept for women, 2% for SC, 12% for ST and 28% for OBC, state election commissioner R K Srivastava said.

Srivastava said that reservation of constituencies and delimitation for various categories is the domain of the government/director of panchayats.

“We have nothing to do with that,” he said. Similarly, fixing the election date and changing the date has to be done by the government in consultation with the state commission where the state election commission proposes a date to the government, and it considers it, he said.

Recently, some opposition parties had alleged that BJP was dictating terms to the commission on issues of reservation and delimitation of constituencies. tnn

Title: Patil asks KMC to draw plan to develop truck terminus, bus terminus
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kolhapur: District guardian minister Satej Patil on Friday directed the Kolhapur Municipal Corporation (KMC) to draw a plan for developing a truck terminus in the Tawade Hotel area of the city.

Patil, along with civic officials, visited the spaces identified by the KMC for parking of heavy vehicles. Currently, heavy vehicles — both trucks and private transport buses — are parking along the roads.

He visited the proposed site of truck terminus in the Tawade Hotel area, a bus terminus proposed at Shiroli Jakat Naka and the Gaddi Adda area near Venus Corner.

“KMC has acquired three-and-a-half acre space in the Tawade Hotel area to develop Truck Terminus. I have asked the municipal corporation to clean up the space and draw the plan to develop infrastructure. Around 100 trucks can be parked at the site. We are ready to provide funds for the same,” Patil said.

Patil also asked civic officials to clear the space near Shiroli Jakat Naka which can be used for parking private buses. He said that no heavy vehicle should enter the city. “I have asked the KMC to frame a time-bound plan to develop the infrastructure. In case of the Gaddi Adda area, there is need to shift the local shops to an alternate place. The site is proposed for multilevel building for parking of the cars of the visitors of Mahalaxmi temple. The traffic department should take up the lead to get the private transporters to park their buses at the Gaddi Adda area,” said Patil.

The KMC is likely to rope in private contractor to develop infrastructure for truck terminus. The public-private-partnership (PPP) model is likely to be adopted as the KMC lacks funds to develop and maintain the infrastructure. Private truck operators will be charged with parking fare to compensate for the infrastructure building costs. The private transporters catering to the nearby towns will also benefit from the truck terminus.

Title: Record of animal volunteers to help in case of emergency
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

PUNE: An online open directory compiling information of animal volunteers across India was launched recently with the aim to uplift animal welfare. The directory, which is in the form of a website, makes it easy for people to register as and reach out to animal volunteers.

Entrepreneur Mayuri Jain, who conceptualised the directory, said the open directory of animal volunteers in India would provide an exhaustive database to citizens committed to making animals lives better. “Anyone requiring help in a district can get in touch with a volunteer from their area. The volunteers are not necessarily from any group or animal welfare organizations. They range from people who simply feed the animals in their building to those that engage with governments to change policy. The purpose of the website is to create an army of compassion towards animals,” Jain said.

Jain met Maneka Gandhi in New Delhi around a month ago while she was working with an adoption facility. “During our conversation, she had suggested that I should do something to bring together animal volunteers,” she said, while recalling how the idea germinated.

She added that many times animal-related emergencies happened on the road and nobody is able to help them. “A lot of animal lovers can help the common people, but they normally call the animal centres or municipal authorities seeking help. Each centre has its own limitations in terms of occupancy, limited funds, etc. Even if they are willing, they are unable to help. By the time they reach the site, the emergency is already over because you can’t predict whether the animal would still be there a half-hour after the calamity. Citizens can have the data on their fingertips through the open directory,” she said.

In the five days since the website launch, around 12,000 volunteers have registered from across 27 states. An interactive map shows users every registered volunteer from the Indian subcontinent. In one day alone, over 50 people from Pune registered as volunteers. “It’s a community of people wanting to volunteer and give their time. No professional qualifications are required to be a volunteer,” Jain said.

Title: Fest to promote searing hot Nimar chilli
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Khargone: On the lines of Chhindwara’s corn festival, a chilli festival will be organized at Kasrawad town of Khargone district on February 29 and March 1 to establish Nimari hot chilli as a brand.

In a review meeting held recently at Kasrawad with officials of Bhopal directorate, Indore, Ujjain division and local chilli traders, agriculture minister Sachin Yadav said that Nimari hot chilli was not only recognized in the country but all over the world. Due to lack of technical knowledge of chilli cultivation, farmers do not get the desired production, so technical information and regular branding of their products is order of the day.

Talking to reporters, he said the department’s efforts were to brand the crops which are famous for their quality and are in demand in the country and abroad.

During the technical session, he said that scientists from various institutions would give special attention to repel microbial and pest attacks on Nimari chilli.

District collector GC Daad said the festival is being organised to increase the production, provide economic benefits to farmers and to make them aware of the technical aspects. The government is trying to establish Khargone as the chilli capital of north India.

He said now cotton is slowly becoming stable, but Khargone farmers have set record prices and production of chilli. Hence, it was necessary that chilli gets adequate market. The government will try to establish chilli industries and processing units here so that companies can buy their produce directly from farmers, he said.

Khargone is the one of the largest chilli producing districts with 60,000 metric tonne production in 23,000 hectares. Bedia Krishi Mandi of the district is the second-largest chilli market in Asia.

In the two-day festival, seed, fertilizer and pesticide producer companies, scientists, agronomists, progressive farmers and processing companies will participate. More than 120 stalls will be set up where Nimari Kavi Sammelan, a food court with Nimari dishes, Gangaur dances and Bhagoria will keep visitors hooked.

Title: Maharaja Exp passengers welcomed on Shivratri
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Varanasi: Foreign tourists travelling in Maharaja Express were accorded a warm welcome on their arrival at Varanasi station on the occasion of Mahashivratri festival on Friday.

As many as 65 foreigners and some domestic tourists reached Varanasi in the luxury train. The assistant director India Tourism Amit Kumar Gupta said that the district administration made arrangements for the convenience of the visiting guests.

The people of travel associations including Abhishek Singh, Anand Srivastava and Vishal Singh were present at the railway station to welcome the passengers amid chanting of Vedic mantras. The visitors were also presented flowers and Rudraksh.

After a brief stay at a hotel, the visitors went to Sarnath and reached Dashashwamedh ghat in the evening to witness Ganga aarti. After taking dinner at Darbhanga Ghat they left for their next destination.

Title: Coastal bridge to be named after Marakkar
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kozhikode: A coastal bridge , coming up at Kottakkal in the district, will be designed as a fitting tribute to Kunhali Marakkar , who was the naval chief of Kozhikode Zamorin .
