The bridge is named after Kunhali Marakkar as it is situated near the ancestral home of Marakkars. The tourism department is also set to convert the ancestral home of the naval chief into a monument.

“The public works department (PWD) has designed the bridge as swords to commemorate the warrior and all other legendary warriors from Kadathanadu,” said P B Baiju, assistant executive engineer of PWD (NH division). The swords designed on the bridge will reflect the tradition of Kalarippayattu and warriors from Kadathanad, including Unniyarcha, said Baiju.

Kunhali Marakkar bridge is one of the two major bridges that are part of the coastal highway in the district. Total length of the coastal highway in Kozhikode is 78km. The design work was completed by the design, research, investigation and quality (DRIQ) wing of the PWD, he said.

The Kunhalimarakkar Bridge connects Vadakara sandbanks with Kottakkal, said Baiju. The total length of the bridge across the Kuttiady river is 547 metres, he said.

The NH division of the PWD has already submitted a detailed project report (DPR) for the Kunhali Marakkar bridge and are soon expecting approval for it.

As per the project report, the bridge will be designed in such a way that solar panels affixed along the walls will help produce electricity worth at least Rs 27 lakh per year.

According to officials with NH division, the innovative design will highlight the history of the region, thus attracting tourists.

While the bridge at Kottakkal is designed on swords, the bridge at Beypore is modelled on a shipping vessel to highlight the tradition and history of these two locations, said an official with the NH division. Both the bridges will be scenic attactions to the tourists, he said.

Title: Kathgodam-Nainital highway to remain closed till March 7 for maintenance work
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Nainital: The Nainital district administration has said that the Kathgodam-Nainital national highway (NH-87) will remain closed from February 22 till March 7 due to road-broadening work.

Speaking to TOI, Nainital district magistrate (DM) Savin Bansal said that at some parts, the road is too narrow and the Public Works Department (PWD) has been asked to widen it. “The road is too narrow near the Bedhiya Pakhad area which can cause an accident anytime. Therefore, the PWD is going to start working on the stretch to increase its width. As a safety measure, the motor road will remain closed from 10 am to 5 pm,” Bansal said.

He added that the entire project is expected to take at least two weeks to finish and, therefore, the road will be opened for public only on March 7. “We know that several tourists use the highway to travel from Kathgodam to Nainital. Hence, tourists would be diverted through Bhimtal. However, after 5pm, the road will be open for public use,” he said.

Notably, several tourists come to Nainital from the Kaladhungi side but because trains terminate at Kathgodam railway station and the buses from Delhi also come to Haldwani, NH-89 is the preferred route for most tourists to come to the lake town.

If tourists are routed through Bhimtal, it will add another 10 km to the route. Hoteliers agreed that the work will be an inconvenience for a few days but added that it won’t affect the overall tourist footfall. “Once the road is broadened, it will ease the traffic flow on the route and will benefit us in the next tourist season. We just want the administration to ensure that the quality of the road is maintained,” a Nainital-based hotelier said.

Title: Homeless man hit by car, dies at spot 4 hours later
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Ahmedabad: A 60-year-old unidentified man died after being run over by a speeding car near Bhidanshanpeer shrine on Riverfront East Road on Thursday morning. He was homeless and lived on streets near the shrine said sources.

According to an FIR filed with B division traffic police, a head constable on Thursday evening received a message from control room that a man had been run over by a speeding car. The cops could not identify the man, who is aged around 60, as they did not find any identity proof on him.

The FIR reads, “The man had met with an accident at around 11.30am on Thursday and suffered injuries to his head. Locals called up 108 ambulance and medicos of the 108 ambulance came there and gave first-aid to the injured man and went away. At around 4.10pm on Thursday, the man was found dead.”

Title: VHP seeks action against Waris Pathan & Sharad Pawar
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Sharad Pawar

PIMPRI CHINCHWAD: The Vishwa Hindu Parishad on Friday demanded action against NCP chief Sharad Pawar and All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen leader Waris Pathan for their recent alleged controversial statements.

Addressing a news conference in Pimpri, Milind Parande, the national secretary of the VHP , said, “Supreme Court has not mentioned anything about formation of a trust for the construction of the mosque (in Ayodhya ).” So, Pawar’s demand to set up a trust for the construction of the mosque was unnecessary and inappropriate, he said.

Pawar, the NCP chief, recently said why the Union government had not set up a trust for the construction of the mosque when it constituted a trust for the Ram temple construction at Ayodhya.

Parande said AMIM leader Pathan’s statement in Gulbarga about 15 crore minority community members outweighing the majority community was a hollow threat.

VHP will take out huge rath yatras from March 20 to April 8 to reach two lakh villages across the country to mark the Supreme Court verdict in the Ram Janmabhoomi case. He also demanded action against cases of anti-national slogans raised during the anti-CAA protests in different parts of the country.

Parande said there were no hard feelings for the omission of the VHP from the Ram temple trust. “They (trust members) are working for the same aim of constructing the Ram temple. We shall cooperate with them,” he said.

He said a nationwide awareness campaign about the CCA would be conducted in the country and all India meeting of Bajrang Dal would be held in Chinchwad on February 22 and 23.

Title: Trump visit: AMC begins scientific treatment at drain near Taj to remove foul smell
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Agra: The Agra Municipal Corporation (AMC) on Friday started phytoremediation process to reduce foul smell emitting from a major drain located just 200 metres from the east side of the historical monument ahead of the high-profile visit of US President Donald Trump and First lady Melania Trump. This is the first time the technique is being used to clean any drain in Uttar Pradesh.

Phytoremediation is the direct use of living green plants for in situ, or in place, removal, degradation, or containment of contaminants in soils, sludges, sediments, surface water and groundwater. The process takes 72 hours to remove any foul smell from the time it is implemented.

Additional municipal commissioner KB Singh, who is supervising the cleaning of the drain, said, “Deep cleaning of the drain is taking place on priority basis. We are scientifically treating the area using phytoremediation technique which will show results within 72 hours. Besides reducing the stench, it will also help us to keep pollution in check from the drain.”

The civic body decided to implement this method after CM Yogi expressed discontent over unbearable stench in the vicinity of Taj Mahal while taking stock of preparedness for the high-profile visit on Tuesday.

Mayor Naveen Kumar Jain had informed the CM that the stench comes from the drain on the east side of the main mausoleum following which the CM had issued orders to get time-bound solution of the problem.

The US first couple is expected to enter the Taj complex from the east gate.

Rajiv Rathi, AMC executive engineer (environment), said, “In the phytoremediation process, microbes consume the organic mass of the wastewater and utilize nutrients from sewage for their growth, thereby enhancing the cleaning action. The process also helps reduce biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) in sewage and checks odour.”

The Taj east gate drain, with a catchment area of approximately 815 hectares, is primarily a storm water drain which passes through the Tajganj area. The 4.4km-long drain has over the years been reduced to carrying untreated waste water and sewage from several settlements upstream to the Yamuna river. Five more drains located at Pathak Press, Katra Jogidas, Sevaram and Kapoor Galli, Gudiyai Mandi and Sanjay Colony and Taj Khema also merge into it after Kullayee sewage pumping station, with sewage being dumped directly into Yamuna.

The stench from the untreated waste greets visitors to the mausoleum and creates unhygienic living conditions for the residents nearby. Local residents complained that deep cleaning of the drain has not been done at least in a decade.

Title: Kolhapur to soon raise Miyawaki forest
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kolhapur: The Kolhapur and Sangli districts are set to get man-made forests under the Miyawaki Forest Project.

The technique comprises testing the fertility and water-holding capacity of the soil before the plantation activity is undertaken. Dr Akira Miyawaki, a famous Japanese botanist, found about this artificial forest cultivation process after 60 years of research on the natural forests.

Saplings planted by this method grow 10 times faster and are low on maintenance after two-three years of care. Around 1,600 saplings were recently completed in Sangli district and a similar plantation drive is likely to be held in Kolhapur shortly.

“In this process, the soil where plantation is to be carried out is first tested after which a 1-meter-deep pit is dug where a mixture of rice, wheat skin, coco peat, compost and Jeevamrut (organic manure) is mixed and added to the soil. The sapling is then planted on this organic bed,” Harshad Diwekar, coordinator of the Miyawaki Forest Project in Sangli, said.

“The saplings are planted close to each other. Hence, while growing these plants compete against each other to grow taller in order to get more sunlight. This fastens their growth by 10 times in comparison to the ordinary process. Using this process, a forest is created within 30 to 40 years where the natural process takes around three hundred years,” he added.

Ravi Kempwade, contractor for the project in Sangli, said, “The plantation project in Sangli was undertaken at Chivte colony in Miraj by the Sangli Municipal Corporation and was implemented by Nature Conservation Society of Sangli. Around 100 volunteers contributed in the plantation drive,” he added.

Only Indigenous plants were planted during this drive. Vivek Kuber, a volunteer, said, “Plants such as hirda, behda, fig, jamun, mango, ritha, golden shower, sesame, pongame oil tree, palash, indica, aden apple, jackfruit, among others, were selected so that they can attract birds, butterflies and honey-bees in large numbers. Sangli plantation activity is now complete and now the plantation drive for Kolhapur is at primary stage. It will soon be undertaken with the help of KMC and environment lovers.”

Title: Reservation exercise favours BJP, says Cong
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Panaji: Congress has alleged that the reservation exercise for the zilla panchayat polls has been manipulated to favour BJP.

“How could the BJP government reserve 30 out of 50 seats, leaving only 20 to be fought in the general category,” questioned state Congress president Girish Chodankar.

Instead of following the reservation of seats on rotation basis, the government has done it as per the whims and fancies of the BJP leaders, he alleged. Congress has charged that the exercise has been done to ensure that its “strong winning candidates” cannot contest. He also said Congress stronghold constituencies such as Benaulim, Velim and Calangute have been reserved for OBC candidates after knowing that its candidates would sweep the polls.

Stating that there is no level-laying field, Chodankar said that Curtorim, where his party’s state committee secretary is the sitting zilla member, has been reserved for women, while Aldona, Taleigao and Penha de Franca have been reserved for women OBC.

He also alleged that Pale has been deliberately designated as a ST seat to make it easy for CM Pramod Sawant to get his candidate elected. Pale falls in Sakhali constituency represented by Sawant.

Title: ‘Commissionerate isunder consideration’
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kolhapur: A proposal sent by the Kolhapur police for establishing a commissionerate in the city is under consideration, minister of state for home Satej Patil, who is also guardian minister of Kolhapur district, said.

“The state government will take up the issue on a priority and look into the technicalities to clear the proposal,” Patil told TOI.

As per the proposal sent by Kolhapur police, a total of 13 police stations, including four from Kolhapur city, would be included in the commissionerate. Police have already identified the space for it at Golibar maidan in the city.

“The commissionerate will help in keeping a check on the steadily rising criminal activities in Kolhapur city and Ichalkaranji. Once approved, there will be increased staff of around 1,200 police personnel. This will ultimately help in keeping a check on crime,” said a senior police officer on condition of anonymity.

The government is expected to take a step in the same direction, the recent incidents of police busting ganja nexus, arresting criminals involved in these type of narcotics, the prevalent of an inter-state gang in the district, illegal private money lending business, etc indicate that the local criminals have developed network with the gangs from other parts of the country.

Police stations like Karveer, Gokul Shrigaon MIDC, Gandhinagar, Shiroli MIDC and all the police stations from Hatkanangle taluka except for Peth Vadgaon which include Gavbhag, Shivaji Nagar police stations from Ichalkaranji, Shahapur, Hatkananagle, and Hupari will be included in the Commissionerate.

Title: Index II extract of old buildings to go online in Pune
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

PUNE: Citizens planning to invest in Pune-based properties registered between 1990 and 2002 will soon be able to search for their detailed ‘ Index II extract ’ online as the registration department has decided to upload this data on its website by July this year.

The Index II extract is a document that a person gets after registering the document of immovable property. It is the official document of transaction recorded in the records of registering authority, confirming the completion of the transaction.

For the Pune properties registered from 2002 onwards, this data is already available on the IGR website. “In Mumbai, the data of the old properties is available as a part of e-search facility. The same will be replicated in Pune before covering the entire state,” IGR Omprakash Deshmukh said.

Registration department officials said the data was earlier checked manually. With the hiring of additional staffers as data entry operators, the work of uploading the detailed Index II extract should be completed soon, they said.

Once the online facility for old properties is in place, citizens would no longer have to depend on real estate agents to procure certified hard copies of property transactions. It would also help in checking the possibility of cheating as the buyers would be able to check the transaction history of a particular property before investing in it.

The feature would be made available under the eSearch facility on the official website (igrmaharashtra.gov.in) of the inspector general of registration (IGR).

“If a person is interested in purchasing a property anywhere in Pune, s/he just need to know its city survey number (or the Milkat number or the plot number) and the concerned revenue village. Entering these details on the IGR website will throw up the property’s transaction history,” another official of the registration department said.

Citizens feel that the move would help buyers wishing to invest in old properties. “I recently sold my flat, which was registered in 2000. I had to employ a lawyer for getting the e-search of the property done. Once the search facility for old properties is available, the entire process would become easier,’’ a Kondhwa resident said.

A lawyer, who helps citizens register their properties, said for these old properties, one had to sit with the sub-registrar’s office for hours to check for the data manually. “It is good that they are uploading the data online. This will help citizens,’’ he added.

Title: Thousands turn up at Panaji's Azad Maidan, vow not to provide information for NPR, Census 2021
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Protesters climbed trees and even spilled on to streets making Friday’s meet at Azad Maidan the largest anti C... Read More

PANAJI: The several thousands who showed up at Azad Maidan in Panaji on Friday to protest against CAA, NPR and NRC pledged not to furnish “any information whatsoever for the purposes of NPR or even for the purpose of Census 2021” till all three are withdrawn.

The grounds couldn’t contain the massive crowd that climbed up trees and spilled on to streets and in front of the police headquarters, making it the largest anti CAA-NPR-NRC protest the state has witnessed till date. Speakers included students from JNU and lawyers from Assam and Delhi, who spoke about police brutality on college campuses and termed the CAA, NPR and NRC as tools to persecute minorities.

Despite the Church supporting the protest and sending out letters to all parish priests and chaplains to mobilise people for the rally, no Church representative featured among the speakers.

The Goa Alliance Against CAA, NRC and NPR, which organised the rally, stressed on the large number of OCI card holders in the state who have surrendered their Indian citizenship for Portuguese citizenship and noted the apprehension over “arbitrary grounds for cancellation of OCI registration”. Activist and advocate Albertina Almeida said there was no assurance that OCI cards wouldn’t be cancelled.

The lethal combination of CAA, NPR and NRC could render some citizens stateless encouraging land grab, which is affecting the marginalised sections of society, the alliance stated in their resolution to oppose it. Stating that CAA, NPR and NRC go against the principles of justice, equality, secularism, socialism and democracy on which Constitution was founded, the meeting began with the reading of the Preamble. B R Amedkar’s photograph was displayed during the meeting.

Activist Arturo D’Souza urged participants to teach those MLAs who defected to the BJP and who have supported the CAA, a lesson in the next election.

Dalit activist Dadu Mandrekar, who was one of the speakers, said the central government was trying to destroy the Constitution and expressed uncertainty about the rights of the GAKUVED (Gawda, Kunbi, Velip and Dhangar) community, many of whom don’t have proper documentation. Julio Aguiar appealed to deputy chief minister Chandrakant Kavalekar, tribal minister Govind Gaude and tourism minister Manohar Ajgaonkar on the issue, while activist Rama Kanconkar said it was a shame that tribal leaders were assuring tribals in Goa that they would not be affected by the CAA, NPR and NRC.

“Lakhs of people surveyed in Assam have been sent to detention centres,” advocate of the Guwahati high court, A S Tapader, said. Jamia Milia Islamia student Ayesha Renna spoke about police brutality on campus.

PhD candidate at JNU, whose research focuses on Dalit movements and leadership, Rahul Sonpimple said the CAA-NPR-NRC movement is not only anti-Muslim, but anti-Dalit. Advocate Nabila Hasan from Delhi said the purpose of the CAA-NPR-NRC was only to persecute minorities. Hasan filed a PIL seeking Rs 1 crore compensation over the December 15 police brutality at JNU.

Former revenue minister Rohan Khaunte, leader of opposition Digambar Kamat, Congress state president Girish Chodankar, AAP functionary Valmiki Naik and former mayor of Corporation of the City of Panaji Surendra Furtado were present.

Title: Gujarat: Woman crushed at her home by reversing car
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Uma Sharma

AHMEDABAD: A 65-year-old woman, who was sitting on the patio of her house in Khokhra, was killed on Thursday after she was hit by a car. The driver was reversing the vehicle. The deceased, Uma Sharma, was a resident of Gujarat Housing Board in Khokhra, according to I division traffic police.

According to the complainant Dinesh Sharma, the son of the deceased, his mother suffered severe injuries to her hands and forehead. As family members heard her screams and the noise of a vehicle, they ran out of the house and found the elderly woman unconscious and severely injured.

She was taken to Asarwa Civil Hospital where she was declared brought dead. The driver left the car at the spot and fled.

Title: Cong welcomes Trump but says trip should yield results for India
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

NEW DELHI: Congress Friday welcomed US President Donald Trump’s upcoming visit to India as continuation of strategic partnership between the two countries but added that it should yield concrete results for the hosts. It warned that the visit should not become an extension of US presidential election “like Howdy Modi event”.

Addressing a press conference, AICC spokesman Anand Sharma said there are issues with the US having withdrawn the General System of Preference (GSP) status to India, having declared India a developed country and reducing the number of H1B visas. He said restoration of social security to Indian professionals visiting the US is also an agenda item.

He expressed hope that Prime Minister Narendra Modi would take up these issues with President Trump.

“There should be gravitas, seriousness and depth in Trump’s visit as well as tangible outcomes on substantive issues,” Sharma said.

The Congress spokesman said the US President’s visit should not become like “Howdy Modi” rally in Texas where Trump and Indian PM addressed a gathering together.

“This visit should not become an extension of the US presidential campaign for the Indian diaspora. We do not become active party in the polls in another country.” This mistake was made in Texas at the ‘Howdy Modi’ event and the PM ought to be careful as these are setting wrong precedents,” he said.

Title: Devotees give plastic-free Mahashivratri a thumbs-up in Sainikpuri
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Residents of Sainikpuri provided reusable bamboo baskets to devotees to keep plastic out of the Umamaheshwari ... Read More

SECUNDERABAD: Volunteers at Umamaheshwari temple in Sainikpuri ensured Mahashivratri celebrations were plastic-free. Devotees were not allowed to take plastic covers and sachets into the temple. Many were appreciative of the move.

Medha M, who has been behind the ‘Fenko MaTt’ (don’t litter) campaign in the area, was actively involved in the effort. “Religious practices are closely related with water bodies,” said Medha. “Traditionally, puja samagri (offerings) is put into the water to ensure that people don’t stamp on it. But with the introduction of plastic, non-biodegradable substances have made their way into water bodies, choking them.” She said simple flower garlands too have plastic decoration on them, making it tough to segregate.

Medha said, “A group of 20 volunteers asked devotees to leave plastic outside. We provided them reusable bamboo baskets to hold their items.” She bought about 100 baskets for the occasion.

Deepa Shailendra, a Sainikpuri resident, said, “People were asked to avoid plastic sachets to hold their haldi and kumkum and instead use paper. Steel utensils were provided at the temple for pujas.”

Volunteers could be seen nudging devotees to dispose off waste in correct bins placed in the temple complex, with even young children actively involved in the process.

“Three large sacks of plastic were collected. We want to take this message to other temples in the next year. We also hope that flower sellers start using paper for packing,” said Deepa. The plastic would be handed to a waste aggregator from where it would be sent for recycling.

Suryanarayana M, who was among the volunteers, said, “Far from being offended, people were apologetic. There is awareness on the issue, but this must translate into practice.”

Title: Lobo sets 2-year target for Cacora, Bainguinim, Verna garbage plants
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Panaji: Waste management minister Michael Lobo said the Goa Waste Management Corporation has set a two-year target to complete the three solid waste treatment plants at Cacora, Baiguinim and Verna.

The minister said that the process to set up the solid waste treatment plant at Bainguinim is on track while the construction of a similar treatment plant at Cacora has already begun.

Lobo said that the expression of interest for the proposed waste treatment plant at Bainguinim would be issued in the coming week.

A month earlier, the department headed by Lobo floated an expression of interest to select an agency to conduct the rapid environment impact assessment for a waste treatment plant at Verna.

“A small garbage treatment plant at Vasco will be setup to treat wet waste till the Verna plant comes up,” Lobo said.

On the show cause notices issued to certain village panchayats, Lobo said that the notices were issued based on the directions of the high court bench.

He said that segregation machines will be installed at Campal and Mapusa to treat legacy waste which remains piled up.

Title: Shah will visit city: Laxman
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Hyderabad: Telangana BJP president K Laxman on Thursday confirmed that Union home minister Amit Shah will visit the city to address a public meeting on CAA. He said they will also invite Jana Sena chief Pawan Kalyan for the meeting.

Laxman alleged that chief minister K Chandrasekhar Rao remembers employees, people and farmers only before elections. Speaking to reporters, he said the CM forgets the promises after elections. Demanding implementation of PRC immediately, he said KCR is threatening government employees if they raise any demand. tnn

Title: Pune: Scientists develop miniature flow reactors
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

PUNE: The CSIR-National Chemical Laboratory has developed miniature glass-coated flow reactors with high performance and better compatibility with chemicals in a lesser space.

Such reactors will be used to manufacture agrochemicals and in pharmaceutical sectors, mostly in terms of handling halogenated reactants, intermediates and related products.

Already equipped with US and European patents, the scientists who developed the miniature version said the new reactors would probably be half the cost of the variety currently available in the market.

The NCL on Monday signed a licencing agreement with GMM-Pfaudler Ltd for the design, engineering, fabrication and marketing of the precision reactors.

Amol Kulkarni, one of the lead scientists of the project, said, “At present, the flow reactors’ market is largely dominated by multinational companies. The existing micro and flow reactors are available in metals, polymers, glass and ceramic. The metal reactors need to be coated with an alloy so that it does not react with chemicals. Alloy is costly so even the reactor is high-priced. Reactors can get damaged under too much pressure or extreme temperature changes if only glass is used. However, the glass-coated micro-reactor will not face these problems.”

Kulkarni, Vivek Ranade and a team of scientists worked for six years on the project. Kulkarni explained its uses beyond its compatibility with corrosive chemicals. “The reaction happens in the glass-coated miniature channels. It means a continuous reaction will occur that will be 1/10th or 1/20th of the size of the bulky batch reactors. This smaller size will also ensure better heat dissipation, which will ensure better safety standards.”

Title: Surrender land in 7 days, Mahabubabad district collector warns encroachers
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

WARANGAL: Cracking the whip on forest encroachers in Mahabubabad, district collector VP Goutham has directed them to surrender the land within a week.

Stating that around 3,500 acres of forest land in Mahabubabad has been encroached by 119 land grabbers, of which as many as 10 are government employees, Goutham said that strict disciplinary action will be taken against the land grabbers if they fail to surrender the land.

The government employees can even be terminated from service for encroaching forest land. The district collector has also asked for cooperation from police for retrieving the land.

Even though the forest department has repeatedly issued notices to the government employees, they continue to stake possession on the land.

The issue of encroachment is not limited to Mahabubabad. Around 12,144 acres of land in Bayyaram forest area of Bhadradri Kothagudem district and 49,607 acres in Mulugu district has also been claimed by illegal occupants.

Title: Holy city echoes with chants of ‘Har har Mahadev,’ locals take out Shiv Baraats
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Varanasi: The festival of Mahashivratri was celebrated with religious fervour in the city on Friday. While devotees started thronging the city temples including Kashi Vishwanath Temple since early morning to offer prayers, long queues could be seen infront of prominnet temples since early morning hours.

Traditional Shiv Baraats were also taken out from several localities to celebrate the auspicious occasion. A huge rush of devotees was seen at Kashi Vishwanath Temple and other Shiva temples of the city including Tilbhandeshwar, Mrityunjay Mahadev, Vishwanath Temple in Banaras Hindu University and others. The roads leading to the temples remained crowded throughout the day. Long queues could be witnessed on the road leading to Kashi Vishwanath Temple. Several makeshift shops selling devotional items were set on the roads leading to the temples.

A grand Shiv Baraat was carried out from Tilbhandeshwar Mahadev temple. The Keshwarwani Vaishy Samaj also took out a Shiv Shobha Yatra. Besides, people prepared bhaang as prasad of Lord Shiva at various tempes and local events organised to celebrate the day. Bhaang, n different forms like thhandai, burfi and other sweets, is consumed as prasad of Lord Shiva on this day.

Meanwhile, colourful performances on the second day of Mahashivratri Mahotsava, being held on the banks of the Ganag at Rajghat, added to the festivities of the city.

In view of huge crowd of devotees, elaborate security arrangements were made to avert any untoward incident. Trafic was resricted on routes leading to temples .

Title: Donald Trump’s visit: Taj Mahal to be closed for public from 12pm on Monday
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Security personnel patrol the premises of Taj Mahal ahead of US President Donald Trump's visit. (PTI photo)

AGRA: Taj Mahal will remain closed for the general public from 12 pm on Monday for the US President Donald Trump’s visit . A battery-operated golf cart or an electric bus will take Trump to the monument’s East Gate from hotel Oberoi Amarvilas, where he will arrive straight from the airport.

These decisions were taken on Friday during a high level meeting attended by the advanced security liaison team comprising MEA, IB, MHA, CIA, and ASI, CISF officials, DM and Agra SSP. According to officials, the earlier plan was to take the US President to Taj in his personal limousine ‘The Beast’, but it was decided against it in view of the Supreme Court order which disallows vehicles within a distance of 500 metres from the East Gate of the monument.

According to an ASI official, while battery operated open golf cart was used by Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, eco-friendly bus was provided to former French President Nicolas Sarkozy and British royal couple Prince William and Kate Middleton. He said that both vehicles have been prepared and will ply according to their wishes.

Besides, the district administration has shortlisted three hospitals in Agra, including SN Medical College for emergency purposes. A private hospital in Mathura has also been selected by the US officials for services, if needed.

President Trump would travel a distance of 10.5 km from Kheria airport to Taj Mahal, via Eidgah crossing, Tank crossing, GPO, ASI crossing, TDI mall, Shilpgram and Taj Mahal. The entire stretch would be lined up by 25,000 schoolchildren and nearly 4,000 folk artists, who will perform to welcome the visiting star couple.

ASI superintending archaeologist (Agra circle) Vasant K Swarankar said that US President Trump is expected to spend an hour at the Taj Mahal after arriving in Agra at 4.30pm and would see the monument of love with his family members at sunset. He would leave for Delhi at 6.45pm.

He will walk along the right pathway of the fountain after entering from the Royal Gate, said an official, adding that special shoe cover designed for VVIPs will be provided to them for walking into the main mausoleum.

A three-tier security structure comprising the US Secret Service, NSG and ATS commandos and more than 6,000 UP police personnel will be in place for the US President’s security, according to officials.

Title: Ports department seeks Rs 50 crore central funds for small jetties across Goa
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Bouncers hired by Big Daddy Casino were deployed at the entrance of the CoP jetty and on the floating jetty to... Read More

PANAJI: The department of ports has moved 30 proposals to the Inland Waterways Authority of India (IWAI) seeking Rs 50 crore from the ministry of shipping under the national waterways project to build small jetties across the state and start fast passenger ferries.

Ports minister Michael Lobo on Friday said most of the proposals moved by the department are for small jetties in villages so that fast passenger ferries can connect the villages to the towns.

“Around Rs 50 crore will be required for the projects , but if it is more than that, the state government does not mind spending. The main tender has to be floated by IWAI. More than 100 small ferries can come up in Goa,” said Lobo.

He asked the minister of state for shipping Mansukh Mandaviya to approve the proposals moved by the state. The ports minister spoke about a comprehensive waterway transport plan to push inland water transport.

Under the centre ’s Sagarmala programme, nine jetties that will exclusively be used for passenger carriages and vessels conducting cruises for tourists are proposed in the state. These are apart from the four floating jetties proposed under the waterways project.

Jetties have been proposed for Old Goa, Banastarim, Borim, Shiroda, Durbhat, Cortalim, Aldona, Bicholim and Ribandar at a cost of Rs 76 crore. The four floating jetties will cost Rs 9.6 crore and the Centre will be funding all these projects.

“Fast ferries to connect Vasco and Panaji will be started. Goan businessmen who want to invest in this are welcome first,” he said adding, Goan youth should start passenger ferry services in the state with the help of the ports department.

“Unemployed youth can take a loan and buy these passenger ferries. We will register them and connect the rivers of Goa. We will give them all the places where our floating jetties will come up,” Lobo said.

Title: Crematorium revamp with KIIFB fund
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kozhikode: City corporation authorities will take up major developmental works of the crematoriums in its limits by availing the funds of Kerala Infrastructure Investment Fund Board ( KIIFB ).

The corporation has invited the expression of interest seeking the services of an experienced consultancy to prepare a detailed project report to submit it to KIIFB to obtain its fund.

The civic body has initiated plans to switch over it to gas-operated crematoriums and to improve the infrastructure facilities of all the existing crematoriums. It had already commissioned the gas-operated crematorium at Mavoor road.

It will submit the DPR (detailed project report) to KIIFB to ensure funds for the revamping works.

It has begun the official process to switch over to gas-operated crematorium after directions from the state government last year to go for eco-friendly crematorium across the state which is free from smoke and smell. It also aims to bring down the maintenance and operation cost of the crematoriums and to put an end to the public complaints about pollution of the surrounding areas owing to the traditional burial process.

Civic body had commissioned the gas-operated crematorium at Mavoor road last year. Works to set up gas-operated crematoriums at other crematoriums situated at Gotheeswaram, Mankavu, West Hill and Puthiyapalam at a cost of Rs 1 crore under its annual plan for the financial year have been progressing on a war footing.

Title: Kashi-Mahakal Exp arrives at Bairagrh on maiden run
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

The photos of deities, which were placed on a berth in the pre-inaugural run, have been shifted to the pantry ... Read More

Bhopal: Kashi-Mahakal Express arrived at Sant Hirdaram Nagar (Bairagarh) on Friday on its maiden run from Indore to Varanasi. IRCTC officials have made it clear that there is no plan to add Bhopal station as its halt in the future. Passengers demanded that the train should have a halt at Bhopal station too.

The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) operated third train between Varanasi and Indore (Kashi Mahakal Express). The train began its first commercial run from Thursday. The new Kashi Mahakal Express will connect three places -- Jyotirlinga-Omkareshwar (near Indore), Mahakaleshwar (Ujjain) and Kashi Vishwanath (Varanasi in UP).

This train will halt at Ujjain, Sant Hirdaram Nagar, Bina, Jhansi, Kanpur and Allahabad stations in both directions but Bhopal station is not included. IRCTC’s DGM (hospitality), Pinakin K Morawal said, “There is no plan to add Bhopal station with Kashi-Mahakal Express. It will consume extra time,” said Morawal.

Passenger felt that the train should have a stoppage at Bhopal station. “Sant Hirdaram nagar station is a small station. Besides, the station is far for the people living in Arera Colony. I am surprised that such an important train was not given halt at Bhopal station,” said Anuj Sinha, a banker.

Another passenger, Sita Sahay said, “I am told that it is a fantastic train connecting three Jyotirlingas. I look forward to visiting all these places. However, there is no stoppage at Bhopal station, which is very disappointing.”

Title: ‘I don’t agree with Pathan’s statement’
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Aurangabad: Reacting to the statement made by AIMIM leader and former MLA Waris Pathan, Aurangabad MP Imtiaz Jaleel said that neither he nor his party supports such a statement.

He said that he is going to Mumbai to meet Pathan on this issue.

He said that Waris had issued clarification through a written statement and the party chief has asked the members to not make any controversial statements that provides a place for divisive politics, he said.

Jaleel said, “We are not against any community, be it Hindus, Dalits, Christians or any other religion. Our fight is against the divisive forces in the country and those who are against the constitution. There is law in place, and let the law take its own course of action.”

About five days back while addressing a gathering in Gulbarga, Pathan allegedly made a controversial statement.

Title: Keep seat vacant for pregnant LRD candidate: HC
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Ahmedabad: The Gujarat high court has ordered the state government to conduct physical test of a pregnant woman candidate for Lok Rakshad Dal (LRD) job three months after her delivery, if she succeeds in her claim to have made to the final merit list.

The high court has issued notice seeking reply from the government and LRD Board by March 27. It said, “In the facts of the case, it is observed that if the petitioner is able to establish her case finally, it will be open for the petitioner to seek and the respondents will be obliged to conduct physical test of the petitioner and permit the petitioner to participate in the entire process of selection.”

In this case, one Parulben Rajput has sought directions to LRD Board to permit her to undergo the physical test after three months of the delivery, as she is six-month pregnant. Physical test is conducted of those candidates who figure in the final list.

Rajput approached the HC after she was turned down by the examiners, when she appeared in the test as a pregnant woman on December 27, 2019. She requested for keeping a seat vacant for her till her selection process gets over.

The petitioner submitted that she did not figure in the first merit list when the cut-off marks were 47 for general category women. But following a litigation, there is a change in cut-off marks and it rendered her eligible for the next stage of recruitment.

The petitioner said that when she did not figure in the merit list, she lost all hopes for getting a call letter and planned and conceived a baby. She has conceived twins, and now is six-month pregnant. She is eligible for the physical test but considering her advanced pregnancy, running for 1,600 metre was impossible and life-threatening for her and her babies.

Title: 80% attendance, staff shortage depriving medicos of leaves: MARD
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Aurangabad: The Maharashtra Association of Resident Doctors (MARD) has written to the central and state government authorities that the Medical Council of India (MCI) norms making 80% attendance mandatory was depriving them of their legitimate leaves.

MARD’s state general secretary Vijay Pawar told TOI that this was particularly the case with women doctors going on maternity leave. While women doctors are eligible for six months’ maternity leave, many of them end up losing a term for not fulfilling the attendance criteria or else they cut short this leave and get back to work. Several women doctors also postpone their plans to have children, he said.

Often, resident doctors treating TB patients also get infected with the disease, for which six months’ rest and treatment is required, Pawar said. However, many of them cut short their leave for fear of losing a term, he claimed.

The postgraduate medical studies lasting three years is divided into six terms. Though the respective heads of department assure that they will get 20 days’ leave each year, the resident doctors claim that the shortage of medicos forces them to surrender this leave. Pawar said the residents do not get weekly offs and work on public holidays too.

Maharashtra has 4,378 resident doctors, out of which 2,278 serve with the 19 medical colleges and hospitals in the state.

Pawar, who is pursuing his PG in ENT from SRTR medical college, Ambajogai, said a senior resident doctor recently lost a term after contracting multi drug resistant (MDR) TB, which requires six months of rest and treatment. He cited several examples of other residents cutting short their maternity as well as TB leaves to save their terms.

A woman medico said that despite taking three months’ maternity leave, instead of six, her term was extended. Another woman resident doctor, fearing losing a term, returned to work barely 40 days after delivering her child.

Title: Bihar woman rescued by RPF, abductor held
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Varanasi: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) rescued a woman kidnapped from Bihar and arrested the abductor travelling in a train at Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Junction (Mughalsarai) in Chandauli district on Thursday night. They both were handed over to Bihar police.

According to RPF sub-inspector Kanhaiya Lal, the RPF post at DDU received an input that a woman was found weeping in a general coach of Anand Vihar-Baijnathdham Express (22466). Acting on it, the RPF personnel went to the coach when train reached platform number 1 of Deen Dayal Upadhyaya Junction. The woman, a resident of Samastipur (Bihar), told the RPF personnel that she was kidnapped 15 days back by one Vinay Kumar.

The RPF succeeded in nabbing the abductor, who was trying to flee from the scene after seeing the police. A case of kidnapping was registered at Town police station in Samastipur. Later, they both were handed over to Bihar police.

Title: Hyderabad: Police emergency button in Ola app
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: To enable seamless sharing of ride information including driver and car details, GPS coordinates of the vehicle, and customer’s contact information, the ride-hailing platform Ola has integrated its in-app emergency button with Hyderabad City Police control room.

According to a press release, as part of this technology integration, whenever a customer presses the ‘emergency button’, they will have the option to call the police directly via 100.

Title: Centre moots institute for seamen in Goa, mantri says 10,000 jobs up for grabs
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

India’s first floating jetty in the state capital was inaugurated by minister of state for shipping Mansukh Ma... Read More

PANAJI: An international training institute for those aspiring to work aboard cruise liners will be set up in Goa in partnership with an international cruise line, minister of state for shipping Mansukh Mandaviya said on Friday.

Inaugurating India’s first floating jetty , setup in Panaji, Mandaviya also announced that Goan seafarers would benefit from a one-time amnesty scheme for seafarers who had secured qualification certificates without attending training.

“I have spoken to chief minister Pramod Sawant about this. I will open one centre in Goa where Costa Victoria will set-up an institute to train youngster and with that training they will get certification to work on international cruises,” the minister said.

Stating that 10,000 jobs are up for grabs in the maritime cruise sector, Mandaviya said Goa needs to develop the maritime sector, which will in turn drive economic growth and employment generation.

Meanwhile, speaking on the occasion, Sawant said, “We are starting with more certificate courses at the marine institute. The Union minister has announced a new institute and this is another opportunity for Goans. Certified courses are important.”

Mandaviya also spoke to Sawant and ports minister Michael Lobo, discussing ways to propel adoption of passenger ferries and waterways transport.

“Congestion on roads, trains and at airports has increased. The best solution is to develop the waterways. This can both, generate economic activity and improve ease of living,” the minister said after inaugurating the jetty.

The new jetty has been built by Marinetek India as per a contract for four floating jetties that will come up in Goa under the national waterways project.

“Floating concrete jetties are the need of the hour for India’s waterways. In the CRZ regime, it is a long, tedious and expensive process to construct fixed concrete piled jetties. Floating concrete jetties, on the other hand, are eco-friendly, with no permanent intrusions in the river or the seabed. Hence, they can be ordered and installed quickly, without the need to wait for formal CRZ sanctions,” Marinetek India, managing director, Gautama Dutta said.

The government plans to commission the remaining three floating jetties in the next three months while the ports department will also prepare a comprehensive plan for waterway connectivity.

Title: Crime branch registers case in seized Nawab era documents and artefacts
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Bhopal: A day after the national archives’ team inspected the truck load of Nawab-era documents seized by the crime branch three days ago, cops on Friday registered a case against the two Gujarat-based businessmen under relevant sections of The Antiquities and Art Treasures Act.

ASP (crime branch) Nishchal Jharia said that team from national archives visited the crime branch to check the documents. Their report states that documents sold as scrap were as old as 1858, and some of the documents match the series of erstwhile Bhopal Nawab’s documents available at national archives. Jharia said that accused Bhavik Barod, a resident of Ahmedabad, and Vipul Mehta, a resident of Morbi in Gujarat, had violated many sections of The Antiquities and Art Treasures Act by purchasing these artefacts.

Crime branch had seized the truck load filled with the documents on Tuesday when they were being taken to Gujarat. Cops detained the two Gujarat-based collectors, who had purchased the documents as scrap from an heir of Nawab family for Rs 1 lakh. The goods seized include letters, hand-drawn maps, invitations, two lamps, a metal calendar and other documents. The detained men told the crime branch sleuths that they collect letters and documents having autographs and monograms of erstwhile kings and nawabs. They claimed that they are members of Gujarat Coin Society and organise exhibitions of their collections all over the country.

Police said that the accused had purchased scrap from Nawab’s heirs earlier too. In 2014, they had purchased the items through a middleman, but recently, they contacted the Nawab family directly. The nabbed men could not produce satisfactory documents to prove that they have organised exhibitions in the past.

Title: GU pips Nirma, Cept and PDPU
Content: Ahmedabad: The Gujarat State Institutional Rating Framework (GSIRF) initiated by the Knowledge Consortium of Gujarat (KCG) in partnership with the Indian Centre for Academic Rankings & Excellence (ICARE), released the rankings for universities and colleges in the state on Friday. The ratings surprised many academicians and educational institutions.The GSIRF conferred the first rank among 28 universities that participated in the exercise to Gujarat University (GU). Behind GU are Nirma University, Cept University, PDPU, and Junagadh Agricultural University. The KCG website said that teaching, learning and resources, research and professional practice, graduation outcomes, and outreach and inclusivity were the parameters.Among the colleges, St Xavier’s in Ahmedabad was adjudged No. 1, followed by Sir PT Sarvajanik College of Science, Surat; MG Science Institute, Ahmedabad; Manibhai Virani Science College, Rajkot; and MTIN, Changa. In all, 68 colleges had participated in the process. The state has 65 universities and 550-odd colleges, said experts.KCG officials said that the exercise is to improve the rankings of the institutions in the state at the national level. “It’s a welcome step at the state level to understand the parameters and to work to score high,” said a vice-chancellor on the condition of anonymity. “But it’s surprising to see so many better ranked institutions at a lower rank than comparatively newer institutions.” In the 2019 NIRF rankings, only IIT Gandhinagar and Anand Agricultural University (AAU) could get into the Top 100 from Gujarat.

Title: ‘184 lives lost in 365 road accidents since this January’
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: Road accidents killed 184 commuters and left 216 injured in the four districts comprising Allahabad range between January 1 and February 20 this year, shows police data. The number of road accidents reported during the period was 365. The four districts which comprise Allahabad range are Allahabad, Fatehpur , Pratapgrah and Kaushambi.

At 81, Allahabad district witnessed the highest number of road accidents during the period, followed by Fatehpur (38), Pratapgarh (34) and Kaushambi (31). A total of 177 fatal and 188 non-fatal accidents were reported in the range.

The data showed that 120 people were injured in 186 road accidents in Allahabad, followed by Fatehpur (41 injured in 69 accidents), Kaushambi (30 injured in 52 accidents) and Pratapgarh (25 injured in 58 accidents).

Of the 186 accidents reported in the district during the period, 77 were of fatal category and 109 of non-fatal category. In Kaushambi, 30 accidents were of fatal category and 22 of the non-fatal kind.

Fatehpur reported 37 fatal accidents out of 69 cases, while Pratapgarh witnessed 33 accidents were of fatal out of 58 cases during the period.

IG (Allahabad range) KP Singh said he had instructed traffic police to launch fresh campaign to spread awareness about road safety and drives to instil a sense of responsibility among road users.

He said, “Traffic police have also drafted a plan to make city streets and highways safer and are seeking active participation of commuters.”

In Allahabad alone, as many 570 people lost their lives and 913 were injured in a total of 1,365 road accidents last year. City traffic police are working on a post-accident analysis (PAA) of every road accident reported in the city in 2019.

A senior police official said police teams are preparing a chart to list the reason which led to road accidents in fatal and non-fatal categories. “This would also help traffic police upgrade its list of accident-prone areas (black spots) in the city,” he added.

Under the exercise, the road accidents cases have been categorized based on various factors including over speeding, rash driving, road structure design, forced entry into no entry zones, wrong side driving and tipsy driving.

Title: Technology to tap water from air
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: The National Institute of Rural Development and Panchayati Raj hosted the second international conference on water and waste water on Thursday. Delegates spoke of novel methods, innovations being used across the globe for better water management . Mary Conley Eggert , founder, Global Water Works.org introduced a technology that can produce water from air. The institute invited over 30 delegates from US, Germany, Sweden, and Thailand.

Title: Muslim youth thrashed, sodomised using iron rod in Rajasthan's Barmer
Content:
Barmer SP Sharad Chaudhary(ANI photo)

Rajasthan: One man was allegedly beaten in Barmer on suspicion of stealing a mobile phone. Sharad Chaudhary, SP Bar… https://t.co/mTHQHevjyc — ANI (@ANI) 1582293335000

JAISALMER/JAIPUR: A Muslim youth suspected of stealing a mobile phone was allegedly stripped, thrashed and sodomised with an iron rod in Rajasthan 's Barmer district around three weeks ago, his brother said in an FIR filed on Thursday after a video of the assault surfaced on social media.The case was filed at Barmer (rural) police station amid shock and outrage over a similar incident in Nagaur last Sunday, involving two Dalit cousins who had been brutally assaulted by a group of men after being accused of stealing money from a motorbike servicing centre.According to the brother of the Barmer victim, his sibling kept quiet about the attack on him at Tirsingri village on January 29 until someone shared a video clip purportedly showing two men attacking him repeatedly and later using a rod to sodomise him.The victim has since not returned home and switched off his mobile phone, his brother said.Based on the FIR, the police have arrested one person seen in the video and detained another."The complainant has named one Moti Singh and Bharat Singh as the two men who attacked his brother. Prima facie the role of Moti Singh in the assault has been established on the basis of the available footage. The other accused is being questioned," Barmer SP Sharad Chaudhary told TOI.Moti has been booked for kidnapping (Section 365 of the IPC), wrongful confinement (342), voluntarily causing hurt (323) and extortion (384).The accused had called the victim, a driver by profession, to a dhaba and allegedly forced him to drink liquor before forcibly taking him to another location, the complainant said. "My brother was beaten repeatedly with an iron rod and chains. The same rod was used to sodomise him."

Title: Sambhal: Two held with illicit liquor boxes in SUV
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: Police in UP's Sambhal on Friday seized an Innova in which 12 boxes of illicit liquor was being smuggled from Chandigarh. Two persons have been arrested.

Area circle officer Siddharth said that after receiving a tip-off, a police team was placed near Firozpur bridge on Sambhal-Moradabad road. They launched intensive checking operations of vehicles.

“We spotted an Innova Crysta (UP87 T 1387) coming from Moradabad which was asked to stop but the driver sped away. After chasing a few kilometres, we managed to waylay the vehicle and found at least 12 boxes of branded liquor to be sold only in Chandigarh,” the CO said.

The police said that the arrested persons were identified as Sonu Tomar and Vishal Jail, both residents of Moradabad. An FIR under sections 419 (punishment for cheating by personation), 420 (cheating) and UP Excise Act has been registered against them. After impounding the vehicle and seizing liquor, cops sent the accused to jail.

Title: Mhadei: Goa government will move SC to restrain Karnataka, says Pramod Sawant
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Pramod Sawant said the government is approaching the apex court so that Karnataka is not granted further permi... Read More

PANAJI: Goa government will file an application in the Supreme Court to restrain Karnataka government from taking up any works to divert Mhadei water, said chief minister Pramod Sawant.

This comes in the wake of reports that Karnataka will move to commence work on its drinking water projects by diverting water from Mhadei following the apex court’s interim order on Thursday.

In the order, the Supreme Court had directed the Centre to notify the Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal’s final award of August 14, 2018.

“Within three to four days, we will file an application in the apex court so that Karnataka is not granted any permission for carrying out works even as the Mhadei award is notified,” Sawant told reporters on Friday.

Though it will take a few months before the award is finalised, Sawant said, as an immediate response, the government is approaching the apex court so that Karnataka is not granted further permissions.

He said the government is seeking opinions from legal experts on the matter.

Karnataka has been diverting water illegally, even as there has been no control mechanism installed yet to measure the diverted water. “I accepted this in the House that Karnataka has diverted water illegally,” he said.

A legal officer of the government also accepted that the government’s move to file an application is a precautionary measure, taken in view of Karnataka’s history. “We don’t want it to go ahead with its illegal water diversion,” he said.

Goa’s petition challenging the Mhadei tribunal’s award in part, is also pending before the apex court.

Sawant took on the opposition for criticising his government over the Mhadei issue. He said the Supreme Court directing the Centre to notify the award doesn’t mean that Karnataka has won.

“On the Mhadei issue, the government and opposition should be together, but it is not so,” he said.

Reiterating that his government is firm on its stand on the Mhadei issue, Sawant said the final verdict will be in the favour of Goa. The case will be heard in July when a final verdict is expected.

Title: Youth harassed by cops ‘commits suicide’ in Kheri
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: A 20-year-old man, who was detained by police for questioning since February 17, was found hanging from a Ficus tree outside Hyderabad police station in UP’s Lakhimpur Kheri district on Friday. His family alleged that he was “murdered” while SSP Kheri Poonam, dismissing all allegations, claimed that he committed suicide. The man’s elder brother also alleged that “a married woman was after his brother and was forcibly trying to live with him”.

An autopsy has been conducted in Lakhimpur city and the report is still awaited. The man’s family has now demanded an FIR against guilty officials for “murder”. But, police registered an FIR under IPC section 306 (abetment of suicide).

Identified as Vivek Kumar Verma , the deceased man was a resident of Raipur village and, according to sources, was earlier charged by police under section 498 (enticing or taking away or detaining with criminal intent a married woman) of IPC in non-cognizable report (NCR) registered by one Anjali’s husband, Mukesh. The 27-year-old woman apparently went missing around 10 days ago and later Vivek brought her to Hyderabad police station where the police detained him on February 17. Then, Anjali was sent to her parents while Vivek was kept in custody. According to sources, there was an extra-marital affair between the two for past few months.

After Vivek’s death, both Anjali and Mukesh were taken into police custody. According to FIR registered by police, Vivek’s elder brother Sandeep Verma had alleged that Anjali and Mukesh had deliberately lodged a fake complaint against his brother. The FIR stated that Vivek used to work in a private company in Noida and is said to have met Anjali at Shahjahanpur railway station. Anjali had reportedly come to Noida to meet him on her own and Vivek returned to Lakhimpur to drop Anjali who was “adamant to live with him”.

“After the woman fled from her husband’s house, we ensured that she was brought back to Hyderabad police station on February 17. Police had released the woman but refused to release my brother. I used to visit the police station twice a day to give him food. On Friday morning, my brother called me from a mobile number and he asked me to visit the police station immediately. When I reached within two hours, I was told that my brother had committed suicide. But, how can my brother move out of police custody and commit suicide at a place nearly 70m away from police station and where did he get the rope from? There are many unanswered questions which suggest that my brother was killed,” Sandeep told TOI.

In her official statement, SSP Poonam stated, “We have registered an FIR under section 306 on the compliant of the deceased’s elder brother. Investigation is currently on.”

While Dharamdas Siddharth , the SHO at Hyderabad police station, told TOI, “Vivek was named in an NCR registered at our police station and he committed suicide on Friday morning because he was troubled by Anjali and her husband Mukesh. Vivek was never in our custody and the allegations are incorrect. We have booked Anjali and Mukesh for abetment of suicide and both of them have been arrested.”

Meanwhile, Vivek’s family along with some villagers blocked the Lakhimpur state highway and demanded an FIR against police officials for “murder”. A separate complaint was given to police, but no second FIR was registered at the time of filing this report.

Title: Cops question three Jamia Millia Islamia students injured in December 15 violence
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

A CCTV grab of the incident that took place on December 15

NEW DELHI: Three of the five students, who were injured during the violence at Jamia Millia Islamia on December 15, were questioned by the Crime Branch sleuths on Friday. They were quizzed regarding the identity of the youths, who were seen pelting stones in the videos recovered from the library.

To establish the sequence of events based on the nature of injuries the students had suffered, they were also asked about their whereabouts during the violence. The students claimed to be inside the campus when the cops had entered. They claimed that they could not recognise all the people who were in the university with them from the clips that were shown to them.

Crime Branch had on Thursday issued notices to 10 Jamia students, asking them to appear before it for questioning in connection with the December 15 violence.

The SIT constituted under DCP Rajesh Deo is, meanwhile, probing the role of the people who had obtained the footage from the Jamia authorities on the pretext of filing a court petition. Delhi Police has questioned some university officials as well.

A probe revealed that the videos were selectively cropped and released on social media to create a perception about the police action.

Sources say that the cops would now corroborate the videos from the library with footage and still photos collected from the students and the Jamia authorities to identify a few more people, who had pelted stones at the policemen during the clashes.

Title: Woman, paramour held for her husband’s murder
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Aurangabad: A woman and her paramour have been arrested by the local crime branch of the Aurangabad rural police for allegedly murdering her husband, a blind man, for being a hurdle in their relationship.

The rural police on Thursday found an unidentified body which was badly injured and partially burnt. Within a span of six hours, police managed to identify the deceased. They also arrested the deceased man’s wife and her paramour in connection with the case.

The arrested suspects have been identified as Yasir Wazir Shaikh (33) and Arsheen Syed (35). The deceased has been identified as Ashraf Syed Noor, all of them residents of Kasabkheda in Vaijapur taluka of the district.

The incident came to light when the villagers spotted an unidentified body lying on a stretch between Tidi to Sanvadgaon road. They immediately informed woman police patil Jaishri Dukre who passed on the information to the local crime branch.

LCB team led by senior inspector Bhagwat Phunde rushed to the spot. He said that when the body was found, it was in a bad shape, adding that the suspects even tried to burn it.

Police then circulated the pictures of the deceased with their contacts and sources. On receiving the picture, a photo journalist named Shaikh Raju alerted Phunde about a missing man from Kasabkheda village with similar description.

The LCB team sought the help of local scribes and identified the deceased.

Following an investigation, police found about the alleged illicit relation between the deceased’s wife and Yasir.

The immediately rounded up Yasir for questioning. Initially he claimed innocence, but soon confessed to murdering the man for being hurdle in his illicit relationship with Arsheen.

As per the confession, Yasir was in a relationship with the woman since the last few years.

Earlier this week, he, along with the deceased’s wife, hatched the conspiracy to eliminate him.

Accordingly, on Thursday morning, he contacted Ashraf Syed and took him to a deserted place in Tidi village where he hit the deceased’s head first. Police said that the suspect also confessed to pouring petrol on the deceased and attempting to set him ablaze.

Police said that an autopsy was performed; however, it could not be established if the man died of head injury or burns.

Title: ‘India has most road fatalities in world, not China’
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Ahmedabad: In 2018, India recorded 17 deaths every hour due to road traffic accidents (RTAs), mentioned the ministry of road transport and highways (MoRTH) report, taking the total fatalities to 1.51 lakh. The report added that the overall accidents increased from 2017 to 2018 at the rate of 0.46%, in the same period, the fatal accidents increased by 2.37%.

K K Kapila, president emeritus of Geneva-based International Road Federation (IRF), said on Friday that India has now become the world’s highest road death country surpassing China by accounting for more than 12% of global road accident deaths. He was speaking at the concluding day of the two-day Motor Vehicle Accident Conference (MOVACON) 2020 in the city.

“Reducing the accident deaths is a collective effort — we need accessible and sustainable transport system, inclusion of vulnerable groups of the road users and targeting the younger population,” he said.

Dr Subroto Das, CEO of Lifeline Foundation, said that need of the hour is to improve road management systems, introduce road safety audits for new projects and assessment/ rating system for existing networks. “Along with 3Es of road safety - Education, Engineering and Enforcement - we also need to address the fourth E of Emergency. With improved knowledge of first respondents, we can reduce the fatalities on the road,” he said, adding that the Good Samaritan Act should also be popularized.

Prof P K Sikdar, former director, Central Road Research Institute (CRRI), said that identification of black spots - areas where the riders cannot see approaching vehicles - has not been given due importance.

Title: Gujarat: High gold prices spawn new business model
Content:
Representative image

AHMEDABAD: If you pawned jewellery or gold to get a loan and failed to repay it, the finance company auctions off the gold and recovers its loan. This lending model coupled with rising gold prices has given birth to a new business in the state. A few players are repaying such loans , selling the pawned gold and making a cut on the extra value of the jewellery or gold.This business has clicked because gold prices have been rising steadily. The difference between the market value of such gold today and the amounts lent against such security leaves room for arbitrage. Such players then pay off or buy the debt, sell the gold and return the margin to the borrower for a 10% commission. There are a dozen or so players in Ahmedabad alone.According to those involved in the business, 30% of those who pawn gold end up as defaulters. Most people pawn gold only after exhausting all other credit options and such people prefer not to tell people that they have pawned gold.These gold refinancing players reach out to such debtors by placing advertisements on autorickshaws or pasting posters in public places. “The customers get the difference between the loan outstanding and the gold prices when we sell the pawned gold. If the lenders auction off such collateral, they do not return the difference to their borrowers. We get a commission on settling such loans,” says Mayursinh Jadeja , proprietor of Meena Gold, who claims to have he introduced this business model to Ahmedabad a few years ago. Jadeja says this service is now available in all cities of Gujarat and he plans to expand his business to UP and Maharashtra as well.Dharmesh Patel of Thomas Gold , another such firm, said that those without enough money to close their loans come to them. “The customers know they will lose the difference if the lender auctions off the pawned gold. We make sure they get this amount.” He added that there are a dozen companies in Ahmedabad in this business.

Title: Youth beaten to death at wedding in Uttar Pradesh
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: 22-year-old youth was beaten to death by a group of five for allegedly creating ruckus during nuisance in Ajwaiya village, under Industrial Area police station, late Thursday night.

According to reports, the deceased was identified as Shanktiman Kol alias Baba and was a resident of Ajwaiya village.

Kol was allegedly creating nuisance and shouting near the stage of the wedding venue.

SSP (Allahabad) Satyarth Anirudh Pankaj said a case has been registered against five accused, who are currently on the run.

Police said the two criminal cases were pending against the victim.

Police said a ‘baraat’ from Deeha village had arrived at the residence of one Jai Singh on Thursday night, where her daughter’s wedding was to be solemnized. After the ‘jaimal’ ceremony, Kol started creating nuisance near the stage. When people tried to get him to calm down, he did not listen to anyone.

Inspector of Industrial Area police station Abhay Srivastava said, “The victim had a tiff with some persons over the orchestra band playing at the wedding, following which he was allegedly assaulted. We are waiting for the postmortem report to find out if the youth was in an inebriated state or not.”

A group of five guests present at the wedding allegedly thrashed him with sticks. Kol was rushed to hospital, but he succumbed on the way.

Kol’s family accused Ram Singh, Dadu, Rajoo, Rahul and Brijesh for beating him up.

This story is from February 22, 2020

Title: AIMIM women protest meeting on February 24
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

Hyderabad: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) on Thursday got permission to hold women protest public meeting against CAA, NRC at Eidgah Bilali Hockey Grounds in Masab Tank on February 24 from 6pm to 9pm. The permission was accorded to AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi . Police laid the condition that the organiser should plan separate parking arrangements and participants should not exceed 2,000.

Title: Ex-health officials, activists support sterilisation order
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Bhopal: The controversial order of the National Health Mission, that was withdrawn after outrage, has found support from former health officials and activists. The order had enforced minimum performance standards for male sterlisation.

“Sterilisation until the 1980s was male centric. With introduction of laparoscopic tubectomy, 99% of sterilisation is focussed on women. NHM directive of February 11 is in national interest and that of women who have to undergo the high-risk procedure. No-scalpel vasectomy (NSV) for male sterilisation is far more easy and safe,” said former MP health department director (family planning), Dr B Ohri. In 2016, he was felicitated by union government for promoting family planning and resulting reduction in MMR and IMR.

“It is an issue of basic human rights and gender equality. Why should only women always suffer. Seldom do we find posters or IEC campaigns mobilising male for sterilisation. It is a myth that sterilisation makes the male weak, and it needs to be broken,” said NGO Aarambh director and child and women’s rights activist, Archana Sahay. Of the 146 districts, 26 districts are from MP.

The MP Polpulation Policy 2000 states: — While sterilisation would continue to play an important role in the population control efforts, it would be ensured that the profile of the person undergoing sterilisation is of the right quality in terms of age and parity. The no-scalpel vasectomy will be promoted to increase male participation in family planning...”

Title: Brijpal Shakya custodial death: Five months on, Budaun police register an FIR against SDM, tehsildar
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

BAREILLY: Budaun police has finally registered an FIR against SDM, tehsildar and others in custodial death of Brijpal Shakya. TOI had earlier reported how police had refused to file an FIR in the case despite court’s order and attempts were made to put pressure on Brijpal’s family for a compromise in this case.

Brijpal was picked up on September 23 last year over his pending power bill of Rs 81,947 and locked up in revenue jail for 11 days during which he fell ill and later died in hospital. Following this, Budaun district magistrate Dinesh Kumar Singh suspended three employees of the revenue department, transferred the tehsildar and naib tehsildar and ordered a magisterial probe.

There were seemingly procedural lapses too.

On Thursday, police booked SDM Sanjay Singh, tehsildar Dheerendra Singh , naib tehsildar Rajkumar Singh and three others under IPC’s section 304 (culpable homicide not amounting to murder). The aggrieved family had staged a protest in Budaun on February 14 and given a memorandum to DM Kumar Prashant requesting him to intervene in this matter and get the FIR registered.

A magisterial inquiry ordered earlier in this case had stated that Brijpal died due to the negligence of the lower staff and not because of SDM or tehsildar.

Brijpal’s brother Mahesh Shakya told TOI that the administration is trying to "save the culprits in this case".

The issue went unnoticed until a few local leaders raised it after watching a video uploaded by Shakya went viral on social media.

Later, then district magistrate Dinesh Kumar Singh sought a report from SDM Sanjay Kumar Singh, and suspended naib nazir Madan Mohan , kurk amin Ram Niwas and peon Kanhai Lal , whereas tehsildar Dheerendra Kumar Singh and naib tehsildar Raj Kumar Singh were attached with district headquarters, and were asked to provide a written explanation in three days.

Brijpal’s family members later approached a Budaun court which ordered registration of an FIR against the SDM and others on January 28. A copy of the order was sent to the offices of the DM and SSP. However, the victim’s kin alleged that the police deliberately delayed the registration of FIR and several attempts were made to threaten them to withdraw their complaint.

SP (rural) SP Singh said, “An FIR has been lodged for culpable homicide on the orders of the court and action would be taken after detailed investigation.”
