Title: Bus-truck collision in Jaunpur claims two lives, 24 injured
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

The mangled remians of the bus at the accident site

Varanasi: At least two persons died while over two dozens sustained injuries when a UPSRTC bus collided with a truck near Uchaura Bazaar in Pawara police station area of Jaunpur district on Friday afternoon. The injured persons were admitted to the hospitals.

According to reports, a roadways bus (UP 70 DT 1237) carrying about 40 passengers was going to Gorakhpur from Prayagraj when it collided with a speeding truck (UP 70 FT 7702) coming from opposite direction. A 23-year-old youth, Ravikant Yadav, a resident of Rani ki Sarai in Azamgarh district, died on the spot while a native of Prayagraj Sachchidanand Tripathi (55) succumbed to injuries at the primary health centre.

Police reached there after getting information and started rescue operation. The injured persons were rushed to the PHC and the community health centre Sathariya for treatment. Seriously injured persons were referred to the district hospital.

Title: Motera ready for new innings with ‘Namaste Trump’
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

AHMEDABAD: The Motera stadium, world’s biggest cricket ground , was unveiled to the media by Gujarat Cricket Association (GCA) on Friday ahead of US President Donald Trump’s visit on Monday. The stadium will host the ‘Namaste Trump’ event.

There is speculation that PM Modi and President Trump will address the audience at Motera stadium from a revolving podium. A rectangular stage was dismantled on Thursday and a new circular stage about 30 feet in diameter is being erected. Although officials did not confirm this, sources said the plan could be to make a revolving stage.

The stage being erected for the PM and the US President is located along the boundary line just below the pavilion. Two giant LED screens were being installed at the pavilion end and the commentary box end to beam live visuals of the event. Sound amplifiers have been put up on four metal frames placed in the ground. The pitch area, though, has been cordoned off.

The GCA on Friday clarified that the ‘Namaste Trump’ event was being held at Motera stadium only to host the US President and the event will not amount to inauguration of the stadium.

Title: Actor to students: Don’t mug up, learn concepts
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Naveen Polishetty

HYDERABAD: Academics should not only be about securing good marks or a seat in a coveted institute but also for understanding concepts that will help one deal with real-time issues, said actor Naveen Polishetty .

Belonging to a family of IITians, Polishetty pursued engineering at National Institute of Technology , Bhopal , before becoming an actor. Although he was among the toppers during school, he decided to pursue his passion albeit the risk.

After his recent Bollywood movie Chhichorre - based on the rat-race that students participate in to secure admission in coveted institutes such as IIT - Polishetty discouraged students from rote-learning and nudged them towards associative learning.

“Even if a student secures top rank by rote-learning, they will not be able to indulge in conversations about those topics after three years. It’s important that students understand concepts and enjoys the learning process,” said Polishetty.

Sharing his personal experience, Polishetty recalled how he always lived in a dichotomy between pursuing a conventional course vs what he was passionate about. He claimed that there is a need to encourage an education pattern that enables students to learn skill-sets that they will enjoy pursuing as a full-time career.

“We are far behind in terms of encouraging the younger generation in pursuing courses that are unconventional. Many parents don’t want their children to pursue unconventional courses at the risk of financial crisis. There has to be a change in this mindset,” said Polishetty, adding that only when students pursue careers that they truly enjoy will they be able to do justice to all that they have ever learnt.

Title: Dhanush-Sarang-tested at Jabalpur
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

The weapon systems were test at long proof range Khamaria in Jabalpur district

Jabalpur: In a first simultaneous test, Dhanush and Sarang weapon systems were successfully tested at long proof range (LPR) Khamaria in Jabalpur. The range is managed by Directorate General of Quality Assurance (DGQA), ministry of defence.

“Successful firing of Dhanush and Sarang simultaneously is a culmination of a long-drawn process that spanned over a year since its conceptualization by LPR, Khamaria in Nov 2018 and subsequent planning and execution by officers of DGQA at various levels,” reads an official statement.

“The proof firing of Sarang weapon system began on January 21, 2020 and since then a total of eight Sarang guns have been successfully tested at LPR Khamaria. Simultaneous proof firing of Sarang and Dhanush has been carried out for the first time to showcase the capability of DGQA towards defence preparedness of the country,” the official statement said.

DG, DGQA, Lt General Sanjay Chauhan was present at the venue. Speaking on the occasion, Lt Gen said, “With this achievement, Jabalpur would now become a prominent defence hub in the country to promote make in India initiative of the government of India. It will contribute immensely in saving annually an estimated Rs 100 crore in defence budget and also save time in delivering high calibre guns to the armed forces.”

Title: SUV, truck in head-on crash; 1 dead
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

ALLAHABAD: A 65-year-old man was killed and three others were injured when the SUV they were travelling in collided head-on with a truck near Wazidpur under Nawabganj police station of Pratapgarh district on Thursday night.

The deceased has been identified as Arjun Singh, a resident of Sonbhadra. One of the injured has been identified as Ashish Singh while the others remain unidentified. They have been admitted to a local hospital.

Nawabganj station officer Ashutosh Tripathi said the SUV was carrying at least five passengers and was bound for Lucknow when it met with the accident. Preliminary probe suggests that the truck was speeding. The impact was so massive that a crane had to be brought in to separate the vehicles.

Title: 29-year-old arrested with LSD in Jaipur
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

JAIPUR: A 29-year-old man was arrested with seven lysergic acid diethylamide (LSD) stamps, a psychedelic drug, by the organised crime wing of the Jaipur Police Commissionerate on Friday. This is said to be the first such LSD seizure reported from the city.

The accused, identified as Gaurav Soni, has completed his B.Tech and is pursuing a digital designing course. He was among 21 drug peddlers arrested by the police during the ongoing Operation Clean Sweep from Thursday.

Soni got the LSD stamps from a rave party in Pushkar a month ago. “He is not only a consumer but also a drug peddler. It appears that he was planning to deliver the drugs to his clients while he was arrested,” additional DCP (organised crime) Vimal Singh Nehra told TOI.

“One LSD stamp is being sold for Rs 7,000 to Rs 8,000 in the Jaipur market,” said an officer. According to police, LSD is imported illegally to the country from America, Greece, The Netherlands and Germany.

During the current drive, the police dog squad too helped in nabbing culprits from Jhotwara, Kardhani, Jawahar Circle, Aadarsh Nagar, Jawahar Nagar, Mohana, Manak Chowk, Shastri Nagar and other police station areas.

“We have arrested 21 persons involved in illegal smuggling of narcotics since Thursday. This includes the arrest of B.Tech student,” he added.

Other than LSD, police also seized drugs such as cocaine, smack, brown sugar and ‘ganja’ from peddlers.

“We started the Operation Clean Sweep on October 23, 2019. Since then, we have arrested 308 persons and registered 255 cases against them,” said a senior police officer of the commissionerate.

Title: Telangana set to get nine new private universities from this year
Content:
Representative image

HYDERABAD: Nine new private universities are set to come up in Telangana in the new academic year with the state government recently issuing letters of intent to the institutions. The decision was taken by an expert committee set up by the government. The body received 13 proposals in all.Of the nine proposals, officials said five were from engineering colleges – Sreenidhi Institute of Science & Technology, Guru Nanak Institute of Technology, Anurag Engineering College, Malla Reddy Engineering College (all in Hyderabad) and SR Engineering College (Warangal).The others on the list are: Mahindra Ecole Centrale (by IT major Tech Mahindra), Woxsen School of Business, National Institute of Construction Management and Research (NICMAR) and MNR Group of Educational Institutions. All the universities will offer multi-disciplinary courses in engineering, management, construction and design among others, officials added.“Considering the demand for emerging technologies, we will offer courses that have a greater focus on them, such as artificial intelligence, to enhance students’ employability quotient,” said MN Raju, chairman and managing trustee of MNR Educational Trust, Hyderabad.Similarly, Malla Reddy Group of Institutions too will have undergraduate and post-graduate programmes in emerging technologies such as data sciences, internet of things, robotics, artificial intelligence and embedded systems. Its new campus at Maisammaguda in Medchal-Malkajgiri district will be a women’s university.“At NICMAR we will focus strongly on construction management where students will learn about managing construction industry and infrastructure projects,” said an official from the higher education department of the Pune-based institution that’s making its foray into the state this year.While Woxsen will offer design and management-related courses, the curriculum at the university proposed by Tech Mahindra will revolve around technical courses in engineering and technology.Following the issuance of letter of intent, the government has now asked the sponsoring bodies to submit compliance report within a period of six months. As per the Telangana State Private University (Establishment and Regulation), Act, 2018, these institutions must have a corpus fund of Rs 10 crore at the time of commencement of the university and Rs 30 crore in the form of fixed deposits for a period of three years.

Title: Bijnor court nixes bail plea of 30 anti-CAA protestors booked for arson
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Bijnor: A court here has rejected the bail application of 30 people booked for arson and rioting during the anti-CAA protests and clashes in December last year. Additional district and sessions judge Sanjeev Pandey rejected the bail pleas on Thursday evening by saying, “Crime is of serious magnitude. Therefore bail pleas are rejected.”

Giving details, additional district government counsel Sanjeev Verma told TOI, “The judge heard the bail pleas of 32 accused on Thursday. Out of them, bail applications of 30 were rejected.”

“The judge cited in his order that 36 vehicles, including an ambulance, cars and motorcycles were vandalized. Protesters attacked policemen and civilians. Seven persons, including five policemen and a photo journalist, sustained injuries. 22 people whose properties were damaged during the protest in Bijnor had filed complaints against the protesters. Petrol bottles, batons, illegal arms and stones were recovered from their possession. And the protesters were arrested from the spot. Keeping all these facts and circumstances in mind, the accused cannot be granted bail,” Verma said.

The anti-CAA clashes took place in Bijnor city and its several areas including Nagina, Nahtaur, Najibabad, Jalalabad, Chandpur, and Sherkot. Police had registered 34 cases against 3,900 protestors in the district. Of them, 149 protesters were arrested and sent to jail.

The protesters were booked under various sections of IPC, including sections 147 (punishment for rioting), 148 (rioting, armed with deadly weapon), 149 (every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object), 323 (voluntarily causing hurt), 353 (assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty), 336 (act endangering life or personal safety of others), 427 (mischief causing damage), 436 (mischief by fire or explosive substance with intent to destroy house, etc), 307 (attempt to murder), 188 (disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant), and 120-B (criminal conspiracy). Two persons were also killed in firing in Nahtaur.

Title: MPT gets immigration counter
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Vasco: An immigration counter at Mormugao Port Trust cruise terminal was inaugurated on Friday afternoon by minister of state for shipping Mansukh Mandaviya .

He also assured the state of a ropeway project, connecting Mormugao to Dona Paula, in a bid to boost tourism.

The counter, a long-pending demand, will ease difficulties of the tourist visiting the state on cruise liners.

“Goa is one of the top tourist destinations and more and better facilities will be set up to attract quality tourists,” Mandaviya said. He also promised an early expansion of the cruise terminal to facilitate more number of cruise liners.

The ropeway project, too, will be a huge tourist attraction, Mandaviya said.

Meanwhile, when asked about the slowdown in MPT ’s business, North Goa MP and minister for state for defence Shripad Naik attributed it to the ban on mining in the state.

Also present at the function were Rajya Sabha MP Vijay Tendulkar and MPT chairman E Ramesh Kumar.

Title: BJP MLA’s son booked in celebratory firing, FIR skips mention of father’s name
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: A BJP MLA’s 20-year-old son, Vikas Khatik, was booked for celebratory firing in Khurja town of Bulandshahr . A video purportedly showing the Khurja MLA’s son firing in the air during an engagement ceremony went viral following which, the local SSP ordered an FIR.

According to SP (rural) Harender Singh , who has been entrusted with the task of investigating the case, said, “An FIR has been filed and our investigation is on.”

Surprisingly, Khatik has been booked under IPC’s section 336 (act endangering life or personal safety of others) and not under the Arms Act, though the FIR does mention the incident of celebratory firing. In addition, the name of the accused’s father has been left also ‘unknown’ in the FIR.

When asked if he was carrying a weapon licensed in his name, the SP (rural) said, “The weapon was a licensed one and a report has been sent recommending its cancellation.”

Despite repeated attempts, the legislator could not be contacted.

Just a week ago, 10, including a groom, were injured when pellets hit them during celebratory firing at a wedding in a village in Meerut. This led to violent clash between the two families.

Last year in October, an Army subedar, who was on leave, died after a bullet hit him during celebratory firing. The incidents generally increase during the wedding season.

“We have given strict orders to all police officials of the zone to act swiftly and strictly on these matters. Firstly, if anyone is found involved in celebratory firing, not only a case will be filed against him but his weapon will also be impounded and his licence will be cancelled within 24 hours. Even the organizer of the event will not be spared in that situation and similar penalty will be slapped upon him,” said ADG (Meerut zone) Prashant Kumar

In Peerzadiguda, Boduppal, activist Prashant Mamidala said, “Plastic was being used rampantly at a temporary market here. Fruits and flowers were being handed over in plastic covers. There must be greater awareness among people.” A similar scene was seen near several Shiva temples. In Domalguda, too, the local market was overflowing with plastic. tnn

Title: Rejig in state Congress soon, performers to be promoted
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Newly appointed AICC General Secretary and State in-charge Deepak Babaria along with party's State President A... Read More

Bhopal: Major changes in the state Congress is expected within a month. AICC general secretary in-charge of state affairs Deepak Babaria spent three days here earlier this week and met workers and office-bearers from across the state. “Where district presidents have completed five years, by and large changes will be made. In rarest of rare cases, we may retain the same person but overall, there will be changes,” Deepak Babaria said.

Congress party will reward those district presidents who worked hard over the past five years and contributed to the formation of government in the state. “Promotions will be given within the party and their services will be availed in appropriate positions,” Babaria said.

State Congress will also set-up coordination committees at the block, assembly constituency and district levels to address people and party workers related issues. “People usually take their grievances to the MLA, who then takes it forward to ministers. That may not be possible to resolve each case,” Babaria explained.

“Hence, a systematic and methodical approach will be placed. People’s issues can be taken at the block level, then the assembly constituency or the district levels,” he said. If the problem needs further redressal, then it will be brought to the state level where ministers will be involved.

There have been increasing complaints that ministers do not listen to party workers or take their calls. Deepak Babaria said there are two aspects to the problem. Sometimes, workers bring certain issues which cannot be resolved by ministers under the existing laws.

Babaria claimed that he will also hold meetings with cabinet ministers of the Kamal Nath government so coordination between the organization and the government is smooth. Babaria’s meeting with Nath cabinet members maybe held in the coming week.

Appointment of state Congress president, however, may take some more time. “The AICC president (Sonia Gandhi) believes in consensus. And till that consensus is reached over the candidate, PCC chief appointment will have to wait,” he said.

Asked what is the Congress party looking for in the new state Congress president, Babaria replied, “He should be efficient, energetic, inclusive in all respect and charismatic. He will be someone who will work with everyone and take every section with him.

Title: Devotees throng city temples, take out Shiv Baraats on Mahashivratri
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kanpur: The festival of Mahashivratri was celebrated with spiritual and traditional gaiety in the city on Friday.

All the temples were beautifully decorated with flowers and colourful lights on the occasions. Huge processions of Shiv Baraat were taken out from various localities of the city .

Elaborate security arrangements were made with deployment of heavy police force across the city, Besides, the traffic was also restricted on the routes leading to prominent Shiva temples on the day. Devotees started thronging the temples to offer prayers to the lord from early morning hours. Long queues of people could be seen infront of the famous Parmat temple and Siddhanath temple in Jajmau.

DM Dr Brahm Dev Ram Tiwari also reached Parmat temple to offer prayers on the occasion. He also engaged in cleaning of the temple premises and asked the devotees arriving there to keep public places clean and tidy. He also took stock of security arrangements at Parmat.

Huge rush was also seen at Pawan Dham Dev Lok in Saket Nagar, Van Khandeshwar at P Road. Many devotees also observed fasts on the day. Special aartis and Rudrabhisheks were prformed at temples.

On Friday evening, Art of Living conducted ‘Maha Rudrabhishek’ and ‘Mahasatsang’ at Merchants’ Chamber of Uttar Pradesh.

Title: Vigilance on a sticky wicket in VS Sivakumar case
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

VS Sivakumar

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: The vigilance case against MLA V S Sivakumar is likely to end up as a damp squib as investigation hasn’t established anything to directly link Sivakumar with the illegal wealth amassment case. The only case with vigilance sleuths is the assets amassed by three of his aides, which are disproportionate to their incomes.

Top sleuths, who worked in agencies like CBI that have probed several graft cases, said that the FIR registered by VACB against Sivakumar is likely to come against the agency. The FIR statement straightaway has given clean chit to Sivakumar as it begins by saying that “the vigilance inquiry could not reveal disproportionate assets to the known source of income of suspect officers (Sivakumar and three others)”.

It says that the ‘close associates’ of Sivakumar ‘suspected to be the benamis’ have acquired assets disproportionate to their known sources of income. “The FIR clearly says that Sivakumar has no disproportionate assets, which means that the very purpose of conducting a probe against an individual, who has no disproportionate assets, can be challenged in court,” a senior official said.

Also, proving that the three ‘associates’ are the MLA’s benamis is going to be a challenge for VACB; unless there is some piece of evidence to establish a benami transaction, the case will not stand judicial scrutiny, said legal experts. “Being close associates does not mean that they are his benamis. In cases where benami link must be established, there should be some evidence that can establish that the accused had provided funds to associates to acquire their assets,” said former law secretary B G Harindranath.

Sources said agencies like CBI that has vast resources at its disposal, struggle for years in major cases to establish this link and most of the time, it cannot be proved. Sources cited how agencies like CBI had to give clean chit to Maharashtra ’s political leaders whose names came up as accused in the infamous Adarsh housing scam, after the agency could not establish links to prove that they held properties in benami names in the flat complex.

A senior official said there was something fishy in the way searches were conducted in Sivakumar’s home. “The FIR was registered, publicized and the search was conducted a day later. Usually when searches are to be conducted, the FIR is secretly produced in court, a search warrant is obtained and a surprise check is conducted; which was not so in this case,” he said.

Meanwhile, VACB team submitted its search report, along with all documents that were seized during the searches, before the vigilance court on Saturday. On allegations regarding the bank locker, Sivakumar said he had handed over details of the locker to VACB. “We weren’t using it for years. Anyone can understand that by checking the bank’s logbook. The key was misplaced,” he said.

Title: Delhi: Parents kill 25-year-old for marrying in same ‘gotra’
Content:
Sheetal's family members have confessed to the crime.

NEW DELHI: Angry over her “secret marriage” with a man of the same gotra, the family of a 25-year-old woman from east Delhi allegedly murdered her, drove to Aligarh in Uttar Pradesh and dumped her body in a canal. The woman, Sheetal Chaudhary, and her boyfriend, Ankit Bhati, belonged to the same community.The murder took place on January 29, but the family managed to keep it under wraps. Bhati lodged an abduction complaint on February 18 after he failed to contact Sheetal.Three days later, cops from New Ashok Nagar police station arrested six members of the woman’s family, including her parents Ravinder Chaudhary and Suman, uncle Sanjay, and relatives Om Prakash, Parvesh and Ankit. DCP (East) Jasmeet Singh confirmed the arrests on Friday evening.The remains of Sheetal’s body and her belongings were found by UP Police in the canal on January 30. However, they cremated the body due to lack of identification.The family members have been booked for murder, destruction of evidence and hatching a criminal conspiracy. They were produced before a court and sent to Tihar Jail in judicial custody for 14 days.During interrogation, the family members reportedly told police that they strangled Sheetal on the night of January 29 and then drove with her body in a seated position in their WagonR. The relatives followed the parents in another car and dumped the body in a canal near Jawan in Aligarh, which is 80-100 kilometres from Delhi. The family returned to Delhi the same night.During the probe, police scanned the call details of the family members and found them calling each other while going towards UP. They were questioned individually through Wednesday night during which they gave conflicting statements. They broke down during cross-examination and confessed to murdering Sheetal. They took police to the spot where they had dumped the body, but could not find it.Delhi Police contacted their counterparts in Aligarh, who scanned through their records and found that a woman’s body had been found in the canal on January 30. The body was kept in the local mortuary for identification till February 2. When nobody turned up to claim the body, UP Police preserved her belongings, got an autopsy done and performed the last rites as per protocol. Bhati identified Sheetal’s body from her clothes and photos and confirmed her death.

Title: Power cuts add to water woes in Secunderabad
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Picture used for representational purpose only

SECUNDERABAD: Residents of Secunderabad Cantonment Board (SCB) are facing water shortage due to erratic power cuts and scarce supply by tankers. Those dependant on tankers said that they were forced to wait for at least 48 hours to get their supply. However, a source in SCB said that tanker is supplied within 24 hours of booking.

“Even though there are power cuts, we are trying to make sure our consumers aren’t inconvenienced. Slight interruptions may occur twice a week,” the source said.

With Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board being unable to provide the assured quantity, SCB is compensating for the shortage. To ensure that residents do not face shortage in summer if the power cuts continue, ward members have requested coordination between SCB and the electricity department.

Title: Gujarat Cricket Association unveils stadium ahead of Modi-Trump show
Content:
Motera stadium was unveiled to the media by the Gujarat Cricket Association (GCA) on Friday.

The magnificent Motera stadium , the world’s biggest cricket ground, was unveiled to the media by the Gujarat Cricket Association (GCA) on Friday, ahead of President Donald Trump’s visit to Ahmedabad on Monday. The stadium will host the ‘ Namaste Trump ’ event, a mega joint show of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and US president, Donald Trump.Meanwhile, there is speculation that PM Modi and President Trump will address guests at Motera stadium from a revolving podium. A rectangular stage that was being erected at the Motera stadium for the dignitaries was dismantled on Thursday and a new circular stage about 30 feet in diameter is being erected. Although officials did not confirm this, sources said the plan could be to make a revolving stage.The stage being erected for PM Modi and President Trump is located at the ground level along the boundary line just below the pavilion. Two giant LED screens were being installed at the pavilion end and the commentary box end to beam live visuals of the event. Sound amplifiers have been put up on four metal frames placed in the ground. The pitch area, though, has been cordoned off.The Gujarat Cricket Association on Friday clarified that the `Namaste Trump’ event was being held at Motera stadium only to host the US President and the event will not amount to inauguration of the stadium. “The name of the event is `Namaste Trump’ and the stadium will host the event. The stadium will be inaugurated later,” GCA vice president Dhanraj Nathwani said.Over a lakh guests will attend the `Namaste Trump’ event at Motra stadium on Monday. About 5,000 special invitees will be seated inside the ground, GCA officials said. `Namaste Trump’ banners bearing pictures of PM Modi and the US president have been put up all around the top periphery of the stadium.

Title: No activities in 300-metre periphery of Narmada during Kumbh: Govt. assures HC
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

A report presented in the high court stated that ‘Gau-Kumbh’ would be organised 300 metres away from Narmada r... Read More

Bhopal/Jabalpur: Appearing on behalf of the state government, advocate general Shashank Shekhar assured a division-bench of M P high court that no activities would be carried out in the 300-metre periphery of river Narmada during ‘Narmada Gau-Kumbh’ being organised at Gwari Ghat in Jabalpur from February 24 to March 3.

He was responding to a public interest litigation (PIL) filed by Pramod Dinkar Rao, which contended that events like ‘Narmada Gau-Kumbh’ pollute the river terribly as hundreds of people assemble on the banks of the river, stalls are put up and activities of different kinds are carried out. Citing example, he said bhandara (community feast) organized on Narmada Jayanti had generated as much as 35 tonne garbage on the banks of the river. He said epidemic had broken out in Allahabad once after the Kumbh Mela. He further contended that temporary toilets would also be put up during the event and it is not clear where the sewage would be disposed of.

Following preliminary arguments in the matter on Wednesday, the division bench of chief justice A K Mittal and Justice V K Shukla had instructed the district collector and Jabalpur municipal commissioner to present details of arrangements made to ensure that river Narmada is not polluted by the event.

A report presented in the court on Thursday stated that ‘Gau-Kumbh’ would be organized 300 metre away from the river. There are 15 spots identified for performing yagna and 30 acre land has been reserved for parking of vehicles. Besides, tents are being put up for lodging and a temporary hospital is also being arranged at the venue. Dustbins and bio-toilets are being provided so that the garbage and sewage don’t become a menace. The ‘Visarjan Kund’ is also 100 metre away from the river bank, the report said.

After advocate general, Shashank Shekhar, assured the court that adequate arrangements are being ensured to keep the event pollution-free as much as possible, the court disposed of the petition.

Title: 8 get life imprisonment for killing four-wheeler drivers
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kanpur: Additional district and sessions judge (XX) Kanpur Nagar Anil Kumar Kharwar on Thursday sentenced eight members of the gang involved in murdering drivers and looting their vehicles to life imprisonment along with a fine of Rs 35,000 on each.

The convicts were identified as Neelu Tripathi alias Ashish, Ravi Kumar Balmiki alias Baba, Raju alias Rajendra, Amit Kumar alias Shanu, Mohd Nafees, Babu alias Ajay Katiyar, Vinay Katiyar and Manoj Katiyar.

The court issued a non-bailable warrant against accused Manoj for not being present when the court delivered the judgment.

According to ADGC (criminal) Kailash Narayan Shukla, the accused had booked a loader (Chhota Hathi) owned by one Satish Kumar, a resident of Damodar Nagar under Barra police on October 8, 2011.

The accused killed driver Rajesh Kureel when he was going to the booked destination and threw his dead body near Mandhana and looted the loader.

Police after investigation arrested Neelu Tripathi and Ravi Kumar Valmiki in the case. The accused, during interrogation, revealed and admitted that they were member of the gang which used to book four-wheelers. The gang members kill drivers and then loot vehicle, they said.

Title: Ahmedabad mayor is chairwoman of Abhivadan Samiti
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Bijal Patel

The ‘ Donald Trump Abhivadan Samiti ’, organizing the `India roadshow' and the Motera stadium event in Ahmedabad as part of the high-profile visit of US President Trump, was an elusive body till Thursday. Now it has a chairwoman in Ahmedabad mayor Bijal Patel.

Chief minister Vijay Rupani on Friday said that that the welcome committee is headed by mayor Bijal Patel. “The committee is helmed by Bijal Patel and includes two MPs, Padmashri recipients and leading citizens of the city,” Rupani told reporters.

On Thursday, Union ministry for external affairs (MEA) spokesperson Raveesh Kumar had first mentioned the name of the ‘Donald Trump Nagrik Abhinandan Samiti’ committee during a press interaction in Delhi.

The same day municipal commissioner Vijay Nehra in Ahmedabad claimed that he was not aware of any such umbrella organization, but said that more than 300 socio-cultural bodies of Ahmedabad were participating in the event.

On Friday 3pm, however, the office of mayor Bijal Patel declared on Twitter that she was the chairwoman of the ‘Abhivadan Samiti’. The preparation for the event has been under way for over a month now.

Title: Uttar Pradesh: Tantrik hired by a villager found murdered in his house
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

KANPUR: Body of a ‘ tantrik ’ (occultist), with throat slit open, was found lying in a pool of blood in the house of a villager Sughar Singh in Bakewar police area of Etawah district on late Thursday night. He was hacked to death in Kudariya village under Bakewar police station of the district.

According to police, the deceased, identified as Hargovind Singh of Malepura village of the district, had gone to Kudariya village to cure Sughar Singh’s daughter-in-law Lakshmi, who has been ill since long through his occult practices. The tantrik was apparently hacked to death by her family members, the police said.

Sughar Singh and his family members, including Lakshmi, have been absconding since then.

According to police, Hargovind used to treat patients with black magic by sacrificing animals.

“Body of Hargovind with his throat slit open was found lying in a pool of blood. A goat and a cock, apparently sacrificed by him, were also recovered from Sughar’s house,” said a police official.

SP (rural) Omveer Singh, said, “We have launched a probe into the matter. The body has been sent for the postmortem examination. Prima facie evidence indicates that the occultist was hired by Lakshmi’s father-in-law Sughar Singh and was later was murdered following a dispute with the family members. We have also recovered carcasses of a goat and a cock, apparently sacrificed by Hargovind before his murder. There were signs of protest all over the house. Raids are underway to arrest Sughar Singh and his family members”.

Title: Notorious Delhi criminal of Naidu gang arrested after encounter in Meerut
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

MEERUT: A criminal facing over 12 cases in Delhi was on Friday arrested after a brief encounter with UP police in Meerut, just three days after his gang leader and notorious gangster Shiv Shakti Naidu was shot dead in an exchange of fire in the western UP city.

Ravi Malik, who got injured in the encounter before being overpowered and arrested, was also a member of the Naidu gang. Its members were active in Delhi, western UP and Haryana and had carried out several sensational heists and murders in the last few years, including the Rs 8crore robbery in Lajpat Nagat area.

Malik’s three accomplices managed to escape during the encounter near Modipuram area of Meerut, police said.

Senior superintendent of police (SSP) Ajay Sahni said, “We asked them to stop, but they fired on us from the vehicle. In the retaliatory firing, one of them, Ravi Malik alias Bhura, was injured. But his three aides managed to escape in nearby sugarcane fields. We recovered a pistol, a few cartridges and 12 mobile phones.”

Additional director general of police (ADG) of Meerut zone, Prashant Kumar, said, “During questioning, Malik told how he along with Naidu, Tilak Raj and Honey had planned to kill police inspector Vipin Kumar , a property dealer of Shamli, Vipin Chaudhary and Delhi police ’s special cell ACP Lalit Negi .

“However, the plan to kill Negi led to fissures within the gang after which Naidu and Bhura killed Honey and seriously wounded Tilak Raj on January 31 in Meerut’s Kankerkhera area.”

Malik, a resident of Alipur area of Delhi, carried a reward of Rs 1 lakh on his head and was helping Naidu strengthen the gang in western UP. Several cases are registered against him in Delhi, UP, Haryana, Punjab, Uttarakhand and Rajasthan. In fact, in Delhi alone, he is facing over 12 cases.

On Tuesday, Naidu gang’s ringleader Shiv Shakti Naidu was fatally wounded in a gunfight with police in Kankerkhera area of Meerut. Naidu was lodged in Tihar jail before he got the parole and went missing. He shot to infamy following Rs 8crore heist in Lajpat Nagar on January 28, 2014. Naidu and his gang had looted the cash when some businessmen were going to deposit it banks in Karol Bagh.

Title: Sheetal Chaudhary murder: How family almost got away with it
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Sheetal Chaudhary

NEW DELHI: The family of Sheetal Chaudhary, arrested for allegedly murdering her, had told the neighbourhood in east Delhi’s New Ashok Nagar that she was harassed by Ankit Bhati, a neighbour, and now studying from her uncle’s home in Haryana. It was the persistent efforts of Bhati, whom Chaudhary had “secretly married”, and police’s quick action that unravelled the mystery behind her disappearance.

An FIR under IPC 365 (abduction) was registered on February 18 by Bhati, who suspected a foul play behind her disappearance and alleged her family might have harmed her for marrying him.

Chaudhary and Bhati fell in love in 2016. Bhati was handling his father’s dairy business while Chaudhary was pursuing a BEd course from Kurukshetra University. After two years, they decided to spend their lives together, Bhati said. Despite fearing a backlash from the victim’s family, the couple tied the knot at an Arya Samaj temple in October 2018 but decided to keep it under wraps, Bhati told the cops. Chaudhary finally decided to tell her family in the last week of January after her sister’s wedding.

As she spoke to them, all hell broke loose. Her father, a milk trader, was adamant that the marriage in the same gotra would dent the family’s image, police said. The family members allegedly hatched a plot to kill her on January 28. The case was cracked after police checked with the uncle.

This story is from February 22, 2020

A 19-year-old boy attempted suicide on Friday at Kharmanghat, allegedly due to harassment by his employer. The boy hanged himself to the ceiling but his family saved him. tnn

Title: Temperatures plunge as heavy rain lashes Meerut
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Meerut: Meerut experienced heavy rainfall and thunderstorm on Friday so much so that the minimum temperature recorded four degrees Celsius below normal temperature here. The city received 9.4 mm of rainfall on Friday. The showers started late on Thursday night and continued till Friday morning.

The maximum and minimum temperatures recorded on Friday were 16.7 degrees Celsius and 14.1 degrees Celsius, respectively. Meanwhile, the maximum and minimum humidity levels recorded here were 89% and 79%, respectively.

Title: POCSO court finds man guilty of raping daughter
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

MUZAFFARNAGAR: Four years after being booked for raping his 14-year-old daughter , the POCSO court here pronounced the man as guilty. The quantum of punishment will be announced on February 24.

According to sources, the survivor’s mother lodged a complaint against her husband in May 2016, accusing her husband of raping their daughter at Shahpur police station.

She had said that she left her daughter and children in her husband’s care and gone to her parental house for a few days. On her return, her daughter related her ordeal, saying her father had raped her after lacing her drink. She had also accused another member of her husband's family of harassment.

The woman said she was beaten up for complaining against her husband by her in-laws and other members of husband’s family. “I have left my husband's house with my daughter,” she added.

According to sources, a case under various IPC sections, including 376 (rape), was registered and the accused was sent to jail.

The trial was conducted in the POCSO court here.

On Thursday, special POCSO court (ADJ 8) found the accused guilty and reserved its decision until February 24.

Government lawyer Dinesh Sharma said, “The court found the accused guilty and the sentenced will be pronounced on February 24.”

Title: A day after eviction, vendors are back near war memorial
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Trichy: A day after the city traffic police and city corporation relocated the street vendors occupying the roads in Gandhi market, the hawkers on Friday were back near the roads passing through the market.

Big Bazaar street and Vellamandi road passing through the congested Gandhi market are often encroached on by vendors who occupy a portion of carriageways.

Acting on the complaints, city police and corporation officials removed a section of street vendors from a portion of Vellamandi road and Big bazaar street on Thursday. With the vendors relocated, the market roads became free with little traffic jams for motorists. The happiness, however, was short-lived as the vendors came back to the road again.

A section of street vendors within a day after being evicted returned to Vellamandi road and space near the world war memorial. “Gandhi market roads without traffic snarls on Thursday surprised many. But the traffic jams are now back with the vendors reappearing near the war memorial,” P Venkatesh, a resident of Tharanallur added. Residents said that they are apprehensive that street vendors will gradually occupy the space near Gandhi market bus stop, thus defeating the purpose of relocating the hawkers. TNN

Title: Kerala: Police may retender controversial project
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: Police are likely to go for a retender of the controversial integrated traffic enforcement system ( ITES ) project in the wake of differences among the members of a technical committee .

According to top police sources, the project, which has reached a stage where the 11-member technical committee is examining the two private companies that have submitted the bids, would be retendered as the committee is divided regarding the choice of companies and also in the wake of recent controversies relating to implementation of multiple projects in police department involving private players, including the central intrusion monitoring system (CIMS) project.

“Transparency will have to be ensured at any cost especially in the wake of recent issues against police. The tender conditions will be modified so as to attract more international players for the project. Since there are no assured returns for the private firms unless people violate traffic rules and fine is slapped, more players are unlikely to bid under the existing tender conditions,” top police sources said.

While in the first two bids, only one player turned up, in the third bid, two players expressed interest. For technical evaluation, the marks were split for various criteria, including number of years that the bidder has been engaged in automated enforcement system, number of sites for which the bidder has demonstrable expertise and experience in automated enforcement system, average annual turnover from enforcement systems of bidder in the last three financial years, average net worth over the last three financial years, manpower deployed for such projects, quality of the proposed project execution methodology and plan, ISO certification and technical presentation.

The technical committee is being headed by crime branch director and ADGP Tomin J Thachankary and also has senior police officials and representatives from IT mission, C-DAC and motor vehicles department. In the absence of the chairman and a section of officers, the remaining members had preferred one company, while the other section ended up choosing the other after verifying its credentials. Ultimately, both the companies ended up scoring good marks well over the qualifying limit (which was 70), because of which the final clearance required from the technical committee could not be granted to one of them. Only after the technical clearance, the financial bids will be opened and the company will be selected which will then have to receive clearance from the government.

Under ITES project, as many as 350 speed-limit violation detection systems (SVDS), 30 red-light violation detection systems (RLVD) and 100 helmet absence detection systems (HADS) will be installed and existing pollution under control (PUC) will be upgraded to enable online issuance of PUC certificates. All components will be connected to the proposed command and control centre to be set up at the police headquarters, in a safe and secured way.

The project has been envisaged in a BOOT (build own operate transfer) mode, in which there will be a concession period of 10 years, wherein the technology will be brought by the bidder, while the data and software ownership will be with the police. The successful bidder will obtain revenue through a service fee on challans generated and PUC certificates issued and at the end of contract period, all assets will have to be transferred to the police at no cost.

Title: Trump's visit: 2 more routes will be blocked in Ahmedabad
Content:
Cops in Ahmedabad on Friday.

City traffic police officials on Friday said that two more routes will be blocked due to the US president, Donald Trump’s event in the city on February 24 bringing the total number of routes blocked to six.The routes will be blocked from 8am till the end of the event. These routes include a stretch between Powerhouse Circle to Zundal Circle and from Powerhouse Circle to Tapovan Circle.People can take alternative routes from Powerhouse Circle towards ONGC Road through internal roads. People can also take a route between Chimanbhai Bridge to Jagatpur through Balolnagar and GST Overbridge and from Prabodh Raval Circle through Gota Bridge towards SG Road.

Title: Gold worth Rs 15 lakh seized at RGI Airport
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Gold worth Rs 15 lakh seized at RGI Airport

Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) caught a passenger from Doha at RGI Airport while attempting to smuggle 366 grams gold paste worth Rs 15.56 lakh. tnn

Title: Single-use products in corporation offices to attract fine
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

People using plastic carry bag in city

TRICHY: Employees in the main and zonal offices of the city corporation have been told to stop using all types of use-and-throw products even if they are completely biodegradable and eco-friendly. The move was to eliminate the use of banned plastic products and to minimise the waste generation capacity of corporation offices by avoiding single-use products .

Officials and workers were warned that use of single-use plastics in offices will attract penalties from officials entrusted with the task of keeping the corporation campuses free of plastics and single-use products. “Even biodegradable plastic carry bags are banned inside the corporation offices. The usage of single-use products, plastic or eco-friendly, will add burden to the waste collection process,” an official source in the corporation said. Employees irrespective of their seniority and rank were told to buy parcel food only in vessels. Even aluminium foil sheets and corn-starch covers, widely used alternatives to plastic, are banned in corporation offices.

“Vessels can be washed and reused but aluminium sheets which become waste ought to be collected, segregated and processed for recycling. To save time, officials were told to use vessels for parcelling food,” the official added. Sanitary supervisors, inspectors and officials in the corporation’s health department will enforce the rule which is already in force. A penalty of Rs 200 to Rs 500 is to be collected from the defaulters and their names will be displayed on notice boards of offices for violating the ban. The objective of the restrictions is to serve as a model for residents in reducing individual waste generation capacity and avoiding banned plastics, corporation sources added.

Title: Chennai: Customs officers held for smuggling gold
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

CHENNAI: Two customs officers and another who retired recently from the department were arrested by Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) on Friday and sent to prison along with 13 passengers on charges of smuggling gold into the country. DRI officials refused to part with details of the charges.

Police sources identified the arrested officials as customs inspectors Vikas Sharma and E V Rajan. The former official is Sathish Kumar. The two serving officers allegedly helped passengers bring in gold, while Sathish Kumar informed the gang about the officials who would be on duty.

According to the case investigated by DRI on Wednesday, 18 passengers who landed in Chennai by flights AK 11 from Malaysia, 6E 1212 from Colombo, EK 544 from Dubai and UL 121 from Colombo, were intercepted and 12.693kg of gold worth Rs 5.44 crore was seized from them. As a follow-up investigation, officials searched the house of a retired tax assistant of the customs department in Kolathur. DRI officials suspect he was co-ordinating the smuggling. Airport witnessed some drama after the seizure on Wednesday. DRI had boarded the passengers in a vehicle outside the arrival hall of the international airport for further inquiry at DRI’s office in T Nagar when some 50 people attacked the officers. In the melee, some of the detained passengers escaped.

Called for an inquiry. 13 of the 18 passengers turned up at the DRI office.

Title: Delhi: Census, NPR updation to begin from April 1
Content:
File photo used for representational purpose

NEW DELHI: Amid protests in several parts of the nation against National Population Register (NPR) and a few states being reluctant to implement it, Delhi has prepared an action plan for Phase-I of Census-2021 and updation of NPR .According to minutes of the meeting held on January 27 under the chairmanship of Chief Secretary, Vijay Dev, the houselisting and updation of NPR will be done between April 1 and May 15 for areas under New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC). In the rest of the city, the exercise will be held from May 11 to June 24.The second phase of the population enumeration will begin from February 9, 2021.The meeting was attended by representatives of the municipal corporation as well. A copy of the minutes of the meeting is with TOI.For this task, according to the document, “Delhi has been divided into 283 charges. As many as 272 charges will be there in three Delhi municipal corporations. NDMC has been divided into nine charges, and eight wards of Delhi Cantonment Board have been clubbed into the two charges.”For the Indian census , which is the largest administrative and statistical exercise in the world, about 40,000 enumerators and 6,200 supervisors, including reserves, are expected to be deployed in Delhi. Teachers of government schools, MCD schools and Kendriya Vidyalayas (KVs) are usually appointed as enumerators, while lecturers from government schools and KVs are appointed as supervisors.Census-2021/updation of NPR-2020 would be extensively leveraging the technology to improve the quality of data collection and early release of data.“Data would be collected either on paper or through smartphone-based mobile app. The code directory has also been developed to record descriptive responses to save time in fieldwork and processing of data,” the document, which has been shared with all district education officers, added.

Title: Trump's visit: Stay alert, keep CCTVs ready, police tell Amdavadis
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Cops at Motera stadium in Ahmedabad on Friday.

The city police on Friday issued three notifications, alerting people about to the possibility of terror attacks during the upcoming visit of US president Donald Trump and Prime Minister Narendra Modi on February 24.

The notification issued by the city police chief Ashish Bhatia says that hotels and guest houses having ten or more sitting and lodging arrangements, should install CCTV cameras in such a way that faces, and registration numbers of vehicles could be identified.

According to police, robbery and dacoity also take place during high profile visits and CCTV cameras installed at several places play an important role in detecting any crime.

As a preventive step, owners of jewellery shops, angadia firms, shopping malls, commercial complexes and multiplexes should remain vigilant and deploy additional security guards, the notification stated. The police have suggested installing CCTV cameras at underground parking slots and keeping recordings for at least 15 days.

In the second notification issued on Friday, it has been made mandatory for the house owners to inform the nearest police station about the identity of their tenants and the monthly rent they have been paying. The notification will be in effect from February 21 to April 20, 2020.

The third notification issued by the police commissioner has declared the city skies no drone-flying zone.

Title: Trump's visit: Medical facilities set up at Motera stadium, roadshow route
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Motera stadium on Friday.

AMC and the state government have set up medical centres at the Motera stadium and along the roadshow route of PM Narendra Modi and US President Donald Trump on Monday.

Two medical emergency centres, equipped with defibrillators, ventilators, oxygen cyclinders, multi-para monitors and injectable emergency medicines have been set up just outside the Motera stadium, a civic body statement said on Friday.

In addition, 12 medical teams of the AMC, seven mobile medical vans and 14 ambulances will be posted inside the stadium.

Title: Fitness gets a platform: Now, get a free entry ticket for 30 squats at a Delhi station
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Anand Vihar Railway Station

NEW DELHI: Praveen Kumar hurries into Anand Vihar Railway Station where he has to receive a relative. After looking around for the platform ticket counter, he approaches the helpdesk for assistance. Instead of guiding him to the relevant counter, the staff point to an electric blue machine festooned with garlands. Kumar notices the ‘Fit India Squat Machine’ written on it. The 35-year-old is informed that if he manages 30 squats on the machine in 180 seconds, he will get a platform ticket for free. In the next minute and a half, he catches his breath before smilingly receiving a slip giving him access to the platform.

As part of its effort to improve amenities at the station, Indian Railway Stations Development Corporation Limited (IRSDC) installed the machine not only to meet Fit India campaign goals, but also to make the railway station interactive and fun for passengers. This is the first time that such an exercise machine, common in many stations abroad, has been installed in India. “The Fit India squat kiosk is in line with the Prime Minister’s vision. More squat machines will soon be installed across the country,” said an IRSDC official.

Gaurav Chaudhary of IRSDC, stationed at the helpdesk, disclosed that over 200 people had tried the machine since its installation on Thursday, with many keen to beat the time target. “People who have time are willing to give the exertion a go. Some have even tried completing the 30 squats in less than a minute,” said Chaudhary.

A signboard will take over the task of informing people from the helpdesk. “Since the machine is new, we are here to guide people about how to go about it. No buttons need be pressed; the machine’s sensors detect a person automatically and start the count,” explained Chaudhary. The machine senses whether the squat is ‘correct’ and ‘low enough’ or not.

Among other facilities recently installed is the ‘Pulse Health Kiosk’. It allows people to measure parameters such as body composition analysis and blood pressure. There is also a Robocura massage chair, bottle crushing machines and a Dawa Dost outlet where people can buy medicines at a discount of up to 80%.

S K Lohia, MD and CEO, IRSDC, said, “We are committed to redeveloping the station to give passengers world-class amenities. This is a good opportunity for interested parties to invest too.”

Title: Delhi: Trader dies trying to ward off snatchers
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Ravi Singhal

NEW DELHI: A grocery store owner was killed by three men outside his shop in Fatehpur Beri when he tried to stop a gang of men from snatching a cash bag from his helper’s hand. The man attacked the snatchers with a rod he used to pull down the shutter, following which the gang members opened fire.

Atul Thakur, DCP (South) said a case of murder, attempt to murder and robbery has been registered.

The incident happened around 10pm on Thursday when the man, Ravi Singhal, was on his way home to Dera village with his helper Bhagwan Dass and was carrying a bag containing Rs 5 lakh. Singhal, being an office-bearer of the local market association, had collected the cash from the other shopkeepers as membership fee.

He asked Dass to hold the bag while he pulled down the shutter. One of his relatives, who also owns a shop nearby, said that two men riding a bike approached them from behind, snatched the bag from Dass’s hand and started to flee. Hearing his helper’s call, Singhal hit the robbers with the rod. Panicked, the men suddenly whipped out a pistol and fired at him and fled towards Gurgaon. Dass too was left injured.

The incident happened within 100 metres from the trader’s house due to which his family rushed out hearing the gunshot. “We rushed Singhal to a hospital. But on the way, we spotted a PCR team and asked them to clear the way for us, but they asked us to first call 100 after which a team would be deputed. We did not have time. By the time we reached the trauma centre, he died,” said Narender, one of his relatives. The cops said they would find probe if there were any lapses on the PCR’s part.

The family suspects the role of someone known to Singhal behind the incident, since he usually left the shop with Rs 10-20,000. On Friday, however, he was carrying a large amount. Narender said they scanned the CCTV footage and found the criminals lurking around in the area for nearly 40 minutes before attacking Singhal.

Title: Kerala: K Surendran stresses on BJP’s potential
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

K Surendran takes charge as BJP state president on Saturday

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: BJP state president K Surendran assumed office on Saturday. Expressing his unflinching faith in BJP’s potential to emerge as a strong third political alternative in the next few years, Surendran said he would be least interested in building up a Surendran faction in the party.

Surendran was accorded a warm welcome by hundreds of BJP workers assembled in front of Thiruvananthapuram Central railway station this morning. Garlanded with marigold flowers, Surendran was taken to BJP state office in an open vehicle.

“People, even those who are not BJP members or sympathisers, have started thinking aloud about the need for a third alternative front against the LDF and UDF which are wreathed in corruption. There lies ahead a perfect chance for the growth of BJP. One among every six persons who walk in the road in Kerala is a BJP man. Now, its a party that gets 30 lakh votes and has a vote share of 16%. I am grateful to the good work done by my predecessors who occupied this chair before me and I am well aware of the expectations the BJP workers and the general public have on BJP,” Surendran said.

“Communal terrorists have overpowered the LDF. The graft in police department was not limited to state police chief. It was a scam carried out with the concurrence of chief minister’s office. The UDF and LDF were engaged in compromise politics,” he said.

Union minister and BJP former state president V Muraleedharan said it was the first time a popular leader was chosen to lead the party in Kerala. BJP former president P K Krishnadas, former state organizing general secretary P P Mukundan, senior leader O Rajagopal, national secretary H Raja, former state president C K Padmanabhan and state spokesperson M S Kumar spoke.

Those who were conspicuous by their absence were former state president Kummanam Rajasekharan, general secretary Sobha Surendran and spokesperson B Gopalarishnan. Though M T Ramesh and A N Radhakrishnan attended the function, they did not occupy seats on the stage.

Title: Uprooted kerbstones pose threat to drivers on key south Delhi road
Content:
The portion of Lala Lajpat Rai Marg skirting the Lodhi crematorium has turned into a veritable death trap.

NEW DELHI: The portion of Lala Lajpat Rai Marg skirting the Lodhi crematorium has turned into a veritable death trap . Public Works Department is redesigning the central verge of the road to prevent people from crossing the busy thoroughfare and the uprooted kerbstones are heaped along the middle of the road, posing a hazard to unsuspecting drivers.There are no barricades or notices to warn vehicles about the danger. Since the stretch is not well lit, the risk of cars ramming into the stone heaps remains high. It is especially dangerous after dusk when drivers tend to speed on the road. Apart from a few bollards marking the part that has already been restored, drivers are almost blind to the stones.The kerbstones have also reduced the road width by half a lane, thus creating a bottleneck for traffic approaching the Lodhi flyover. As it is, even normally the 100 metre suffers because of its variable width.This is aggravated by vehicles parked on the roadside by mourners coming to the crematorium and two loops of the Barapullah elevated road emptying into the road near the Jangpura metro station.In addition, a petrol pump is located on the stretch, again affecting the smooth flow of traffic.The traffic police claimed to have raised red flags before the Barapullah loops were opened for public use, but nothing was done to rectify the problem in the past four years. “We have requested the contractors to remove the stones from the road, but they seem to be waiting for enough debris to build up before carting it away,” ventured a traffic police officer. PWD officials did not respond to queries on the lack of safety measures taken by the contractors.Recently, a makeshift U-turn also popped up opposite the gates of the crematorium. Even though policemen blocked it with metal barricades, the construction work on the central verge required their removal and people began using the U-turn again.

Title: Goa: IT, shipbuilding to be key export sectors
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: The state government on Friday finalised an export strategy aimed at identifying potential sectors so as to help develop infrastructure facilities, services and logistic facilities, safeguard interest of exporters and boost exports.

Before implementing measures , each department will be required to take prior administrative and financial approval from the state, the Goa cabinet decided while approving the strategy.

The policy has been formulated with the assistance of the Union ministry of commerce and industry, which looks at boosting sectoral exports of states. It has identified “champion sectors” and “key sectors” as those with export potential.

While pharma, mineral, marine electronics, optical fibre, and chemical come under champion sectors, IT, shipbuilding, tourism and, agriculture and allied sectors, have been identified as key sectors.

The strategy has also identified bottlenecks and suggestions to improve the state’s sectoral exports, besides covering various ease of doing business measures and issues where the state is required to coordinate with the central government.

In addition, the export strategy covered existing infrastructural facilities with suggestions for bettering them and proposed that the government take up measures to improve export via sea, air and land routes.

While Goa hasn’t made any headway in exporting agri products, the strategy pointed to commodities like rice, legumes, spices, flowers, fruits, vegetables and coconut as having export potentials and recommended that the state encourage contract, community and organic farming, set up a plant quarantine facility and promote certain produce as “Brand Goa”. With Goan cashew in great demand, there is a suggestion that the nut be brought into focus.

Another sector that has been highlighted is the marine sector, which contributes 1.6% of the total foreign exchange earned through export of seafood products.

Title: Shaheen Bagh road opens twice, not quite
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

The Kalindi Kunj border was opened twice on Friday morning.

NEW DELHI/NOIDA: The Kalindi Kunj border , which has been closed now for 68 days due to the road blockade by anti-Citizenship Amendment Act protesters at Shaheen Bagh, was opened twice on Friday morning, triggering confusion among commuters who thought the traffic restrictions had been lifted. Police officers said this caused around 3,500 vehicles to collect at the Kalindi Kunj-Molarband crossing, creating a huge traffic jam there.

The police barricades preventing vehicles from accessing the blocked GD Birla Road were first lifted around 9am to let through some kanwariyas. The barricades were again removed a couple of hours later to allow two ambulances, one of which was carrying a body of an accident victim, to reach Delhi past Shaheen Bagh.

The confusion was triggered by a few four-wheelers tailing the ambulances before the cops could put the barricades back in place. News spread in the media that the Kalindi Kunj road was open for traffic, and commuters took the quicker route to south Delhi from Noida only to find their way blocked at the culvert near GD Birla Marg.

The traffic police had to divert the traffic to the Madanpur Khadar-Pushta Road along the Agra canal. This required vehicles on the Mithapur Road to be stopped, causing anxiety among cops that the small culvert on the stretch would not be able to bear the load of the heavy traffic. Police, accordingly, allowed only light vehicles to pass. The heavy commercial vehicles had to idle there until the traffic thinned after the peak morning rush.

The cops had a tough time controlling the agitated drivers. “We tried to stop the cars, but nobody was listening to us,” said a Noida policeman. “Whenever these situations arise, all we can do is click photographs and later issue challans to the vehicle owners.”

It was around 11.30am that Noida Police closed their end of the road again. Movement on the stretch had been stopped at the Noida end to ensure no vehicles crossed the Kalindi Kunj bridge and created a bottleneck at the multi-point Kalindi chowk.

It took police on both side of the border some time before commuters could be convinced that the barricades had been removed only to let through two ambulances. Krishna, who was passing by the area in the morning, however, noted that the route had earlier been opened for some kanwariyas.

Rajesh S, DCP (traffic), Noida, said the road was closed soon after the ambulances drove through. “Only school buses and ambulances are exempt at this traffic diversion, though we cannot stop vehicles in cases of emergency,” the officer said. “The route was opened for some ambulances, which were ferrying accident victims to Delhi, and the border was closed soon after that.”

Asked about the restrictions being lifted for the kanwariyas, the DCP said, “A bus had broken down just ahead of Mahamaya Flyover and a jam had ensued. Only those kanwariyas on foot were allowed past the barricades.”

Later in the day, Noida traffic police tweeted an advisory for commuters. “As per the directions of Delhi traffic police, the diversion due to the protest on Road Number 13A of Jamia Nagar will continue on February 21, 2020. Please use alternative routes to travel towards Delhi/Faridabad,” said the advisory, posted around 2 pm.

People expressed impatience at the continued blockade of the route, which offers the quickest run to south Delhi and Faridabad from Noida. Twitter user Rakesh Kumar Ojha posted, “It’s a complete failure of the government to take control of the situation. Just few thousand people have made life miserable for lakhs of people by blocking the road. All have right to protest but no one has the right to block a common public road. Why was Supreme Court required to pitch in?”

Delhi Police is exploring the possibility of allowing light vehicles to access Okhla Road via Abul Fazl Enclave Road, which skirts the Okhla Bird Sanctuary.
