In Nagpur district, around 32 students have been identified in seven different talukas who do not have access (as per distance guidelines) to primary education.

Title: Three injured as students clash in Panjab University hostel over birthday party in Chandigarh
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Police at hostel number 3 Panjab University

CHANDIGARH: A few students of chemical engineering department of Panjab University (PU) clashed with each other at hostel number 3 over a birthday party on the premises in the early hours of Friday, leaving three injured.

The injured are Saurabh Yadav and Rohit Prajapati, supporters of SFS, and Subham of ABVP.

On Friday morning, when student outfits were protesting outside the hostel, members of ABVP and SFS again allegedly clashed with each other. However, no complaint was filed as the two groups reached a compromise.

Students at hostel number 3 said, “We saw a group of students entering the hostel with hockey sticks, baseball bats and sticks after midnight. They went in the hostel and thrashed students.” Later, members of ABVP and SFS started levelling allegations that the supporters of the opposite group were involved in the attack. ABVP and SFS separately presented a memorandum to dean students welfare (DSW) Emmanuel Nahar, holding the other outfit responsible for the attack.

The SFF alleged that ABVP members was indulging in ragging and when its supporters objected, they attacked them. Varinder Singh of SFS in the memorandum said, “Ragging is a punishable offence and an anti-student activity. The authorities have a responsibility to ensure no ragging takes place on the campus.”

Similarly, ABVP, in its memorandum, termed the incident as “SFS ki goondagardi’. They held a protest outside the office of the vice-chancellor and raised slogans against SFS.

Title: Vice-President calls on youth to fight evil
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Coimbatore: Vice-President M Venkaiah Naidu on Friday called on the country’s youths to come forward and fight corruption, illiteracy, separatism, poverty, and social and gender discrimination that have infected the society at different levels. He was at Isha Yoga Centre to attend the Maha Shivratri celebrations.

“I call on the youths to fight today’s evil and take both the nation and globe on the path of prosperity, peace and harmony,” he said.

Putting emphasis on the importance of unity among the people, Naidu said, “We may speak different languages and practice different faith. We may have different costumes as well. However, all of us are culturally one, irrespective of caste, creed, sex and religion. India is one and that feeling has to be present in everyone.”

He said it was important to preserve the Indian culture and civilization and pass them on to the future generations. “For this, festivals like Maha Shivratri is important as it will help the youth imbibe the age-old cultural values.”

Citing the World Health Organization’s (WHO) report, Naidu said India has the highest suicide rate in southeast region and that was the second leading cause of death. More than prosperity, he said, what the world needed today was happiness and peace, which only could eradicate evil.

Naidu also used the occasion to promote yoga. “For us, yoga is not a belief but a technology to transform self. It is an art and science that brings calmness and peace. It is not a political activity and it should not be seen through political prism. Everyone should practice and promote yoga for our betterment.”

Expressing happiness over prime minister Narendra Modi’s move to take up yoga with the United Nations (UN), he said the UN has recognized yoga and approved it worldwide.

Title: 500 MC sanitary workers refuse to wear GPS watches
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Chandigarh: As many as 500 sanitation workers of the municipal corporation (MC) have refused to collect the GPS-enabled watches that help to monitor their movement on field owing to “health issues”.

The sanitation employees are, however, divided. Some of them have started wearing the watches without any objections. Sources in the department said those directly associated with the Sanitation Employees’ Union are resisting the move, claiming the watches were causing giddiness.

Krishan Chadha, president, Sanitation Employees’ Union said, “We have refused to take the watches from the sanitary inspectors. We will remain firm on our decision not to wear the watches due to health complications. I have called a meeting of the union and other members to discuss a plan to gherao the office of the MC on February 27 against the move.”

The allotted watches are now lying with the sanitary inspector. “We have given the watches to the sanitation department to distribute then to the employees. I will check on who have refused to wear them. The orders will, however, be strictly implemented at any cost,” said Satish Kumar Jain, additional municipal commissioner, who heads the sanitation wing of the MC.

On the other hand, field employees of the engineering department of the civic body have started wearing the watches.

Unavailability of employees on the field, poor working and weeding out ghost employees were the key reasons behind the introduction of the GPS-enabled watches in the MC. Complaints of a majority of the employees of the sanitation wing not working in their area of operation had also been reported in the past.

SALARY LINK PLAN DELAYED

The municipal corporation’s plan to link the salary of the employees with their working hours based on the data collected from GPS-enabled watches worn by them will be delayed. “Employees are not showing reluctance in sharing their Aadhaar card, photos and other details, all of which are required to complete the exercise,” said an official. “Till date, we have managed to get the details of only 50 employees after distributing 2,100 watches in different departments. The attachment of employees’ salary with the GPS-enabled watches will be completed by April instead of March now,” he said.

Title: Pune: Sant Tukaramnagar metro station nears completion
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

With 75% work over, Sant Tukaramnagar will be the first Metro station to be commissioned in the city

PUNE: Sant Tukaramnagar station on the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation-Dapodi Metro route is nearing completion at a fast pace after the installation of elevators and escalators.

With 75% work over, Sant Tukaramnagar will be the first Metro station to be commissioned in the city. Its work was expected to get over by February-end but Maharashtra Metro Rail Corporation Limited (MahaMetro) said another month would be required to complete the remaining work.

The Metro services are expected to begin on the 5km stretch between Sant Tukaramnagar and Phugewadi on priority. About 30% work of Phugewadi station has also been completed.

Officials in MahaMetro claimed that both the stations would have two levels — concourse and platform. There will be escalators and elevators at both ends of the stations in addition to staircases.

The concourse-level will house ticket counters, waiting lounge and other facilities. Only those with valid tickets will be able to go to the platforms, above the concourse-level. Commuters at the ground-level would be able to reach the concourse by climbing the stairs or using elevators and foot overbridges (FOBs), having entry-exit points on footpaths.

The MahaMetro has planned a foot overbridge at every station. The work of FOB at Sant Tukaramnagar station has reached its last phase.

Officials stated that various agencies had been deployed at the stations to expedite the work. “It is a challenging job to maintain coordination in the work. We are putting efforts to finish major works by March-end,” an official said.

MahaMetro said it had completed laying of tracks on about 4km stretch on the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation-Dapodi route. The construction of the viaduct has been completed on most of the stretch.

The work in the crucial patch of Nashik Phata is yet to be completed. Officials claimed that they had started launching steel girders instead of cement segments at the Nashik Phata Junction section.

Title: BJP targets ‘liberals’, Congress over Waris
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

NEW DELHI: BJP on Friday slammed the recent controversial remarks made by AIMIM’s Waris Pathan and said it sounded eerily like the ‘ Direct Action Day ’ call given by Muslim League on August 16, 1946. The party also questioned the silence of Congress’ Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra .

BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra said, “I feel afraid today because of the fact that I am reminded of a date, August 16, 1946, when Muslim League in undivided India had given a call of Direct Action Day.”

He further said, “Today, we have Owaisi and his party almost akin to Muslim League, giving a call of something like Direct Action Day.” The Muslim League had given a call for Direct Action Day and it led to four days of massive Hindu-Muslim riots in Calcutta, resulting in the death of an estimated 10,000 people.

BJP also said the “so-called liberals” have been unmasked as “they carry the Constitution in their hands and have Waris Pathan in their hearts”.

Title: Rape in school bus: Cops grill principal, transport contractor
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

PANCHKULA: Police on Friday questioned a school principal and transport contractor in connection with the rape of a four-year-old student in a school bus on February 14.

The principal was directed to produce all relevant papers of contract between the school management and the transporter along with other documents of provision of security cover and a woman attendant in the school bus as per the Surakshit School Vahan Policy, said assistant commissioner of police (ACP) Noopur Bishnoi. Bishnoi said, “We have ascertained that the school bus did not have a woman attendant, which is mandatory.

Further action will be taken once the probe is completed.” The ACP said nothing concrete whether the driver arrested in the case was involved in any other sexual assault incidents has come out so far. Deputy commissioner of police (DCP) Mohit Handa said, “The case is being investigated under the supervision of ACP Bishnoi. All aspects related to the Surakshit School Vahan Policy are being looked into.”

The girl was allegedly raped when she was returning home in the school bus.

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme Court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

Title: Rs 100 crore to develop tourist destinations
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Jaipur: In a bid to attract tourists, the chief minister in the Budget announced the creation of a Tourism Development Fund and allocated Rs 100 crore to it. The department will prepare a plan for detailing the areas where the corpus would be spent.

A senior official of the department said that they would draw up guidelines for spending the corpus but it would not be exclusively for promotion and marketing. He said that the department has got allocations of Rs 121 crore, including the Rs 100 crore fund and there is no decision as yet on how much would be set aside for marketing and promotion activities. “We have to chalk out the strategy for marketing and promotion. Accordingly, the corpus would be dedicated,” he said. There are plans to build new infrastructure and facilities which would use some of the money from the development fund, another official said.

“We are planning new attractions like promoting Rajasthan as a film shooting destination and creating facilities for adventure tourism. So, some of the corpus would be dedicated for that,” he said.

Last year, the department had got Rs 51 crore for marketing and promotion activities which was criticized for being too less. The industry said that marketing and promotion was the key to attract tourists, which was the main strategy of the previous BJP government.

Title: Fadnavis status as ex-CM to not last long: RSS 2nd in command
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Nagpur: Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) Sarkaryawah (general secretary) Bhaiyaji Joshi said Devendra Fadnavis’ status as former CM and leader of opposition may not stay for long. “Things don’t last forever so would Devendra Fadnavis’ status as the ex-chief minster or the leader of opposition would also be short-lived,” said Joshi.

Joshi is next to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat. He was speaking at a function to inaugurate a building of Sadhana Sahakari Bank in Jaripatka on Friday. Fadnavis’ father, late Gangadharrao Fadnavis was among the founders of this cooperative bank.

The statement holds importance in light of recent developments in Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, especially chief minister Uddhav Thackrey's visit to New Delhi for talks with Congress President Sonia Gandhi and Prime Minister Narendra Modi. There have been differences between the MVA constituents over the stance on national population register (NPR).

Later talking to news persons, Joshi said nothing is permanent in this world even the post of chief minister. However, it seems that the post of deputy chief minister is permanent for someone. The statement was an apparent indirect reference to NCP’s Ajit Pawar who had been the deputy chief minister in the Congress-NCP alliance and now also in the MVA.

On the sidelines of a function, Fadnavis came down on All India Majlis-e-Itehad-e-Muslimeen (AMIM) leader Waris Pathan on his recent statement. Pathan had said that 15 crore Muslims can prove stronger than the rest of the 100 crore in the country.

Fadnavis said, “Only because it is a Hindu majority nation that Pathan could get away with statements like this. Hindus are tolerant people. There are countries which are known as Islamic countries where none can dare to speak up. Rather the minorities don’t even have the right to express themselves.”

Fadnavis said Pathan should seek an apology from the nation for what he has said.

Title: Mangaluru: Smart Road project languishes owing to lack of coordination
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Construction on of pedestrian underpass between Mini Vidhan Soudha and Town Hall in progress in Mangaluru

MANGLAURU: Though the Mangaluru Smart City Limited (MSCL) has taken up a major project of converting a stretch of road in the city into a Smart Road , the project is languishing due to another development work, and lack of coordination among officials.

The MSCL has reserved Rs 7.6 crore for the development of a Smart Road on the stretch between AB Shetty Circle and Clock Tower Circle . However, the work got stalled soon after another project of a tunnel underpass for pedestrians began near Clock Tower Circle. The pedestrian underpass work involves cutting the existing four lanes between AB Shetty Circle and Clock Tower Circle. Hence, the work on the Smart Road can be resumed only after the tunnel underpass work is completed, says officials.

The Smart Road concept includes broad footpaths with carriageway, railings and bollard system as traffic enforcement method. Placing bollards on either side of each entrance to avoid entry of vehicles on to the footpath, trees to form part of urban design and thereby making the road pedestrian-friendly. Accordingly, the MSCL had begun the work on the Smart Road on the Clock Tower Circle to AB Shetty Circle stretch in August 2018. However, initially they had to revise the plan based on the suggestions of the city police.

Currently, the work remains incomplete due to the construction of a pedestrian underpass at Clock Tower Circle. The underpass between Mini Vidhan Soudha and Town Hall beneath the AB Shetty Circle to Clock Tower Circle road is being constructed at an estimated cost of Rs 6 crore. To facilitate the work, the road from AB Shetty Circle to Clock Tower Circle has been closed, making the stretch one-way. Traffic is allowed from Clock Tower Circle to AB Shetty Circle.

MSCL managing director Mohammed Nazeer said the Smart Road work will be resumed soon after the completion of the pedestrian underpass. “We expect to complete the construction of the underpass on one side by the end of March, and it will be completed before the onset of monsoon. Later, the Smart Road work will be continued,” he said.

Title: Chandigarh: Out on bail, man held with gun, fake notes
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: Police arrested a 42-year-old man for allegedly carrying an illegal country-made pistol, live cartridges, heroin and fake currency in Sector 31 on Thursday night.

The accused has been identified as Sagar Vedpal, a resident of Ram Darbar.

A police team was patrolling the area to keep a tab on anti-social elements when it received a tip-off that a man with arms was coming in a white-coloured Hyundai Accent car to supply heroin near Japanese Garden in Sector 31. The police team laid a trap and caught the accused.

Police claimed a one country-made pistol, 50 grams of heroin, five cartridges and fake currency worth Rs 39,900 was recovered from him. The accused failed to produce any licence or permit for carrying the arms and ammunition. Police seized the drugs, gun and fake currency notes and arrested him after registering a case under Sections of Indian Penal Code and Arms Act.

Police said the accused had bought the pistol from a resident of Deoband in Uttar Pradesh for Rs 15,000 and the heroin from a Nigerian national in Delhi. Police said the accused had got the fake currency notes from one Ruby, a resident of Yamunanagar in Haryana.

The accused is already booked in three cases of murder and under Arms Act in Ludhiana, Ambala and Panchkula. Police said the accused was out on bail . He was living with his parents, wife and child at Ram Darbar and used to work as a DJ in weddings and parties in the city. A local court remanded him in two-day custody. Police said more cases were likely to be worked out during his interrogation.

On February 4 and 5, police arrested two Banur residents with two pistols and five live cartridges in the city.

Title: Pune: Fun-filled carnival in Undri for one & all
Content:
Children will get an opportunity to play an assortment of games and engage in art, craft and science activitie... Read More

PUNE: Happy Streets will bring a one-of-its-kind carnival packed with fun and frolic on Saturday evening at Corinthians Resort & Club in Undri.Exercise, games and activities will keep participants occupied throughout the evening. The main stage will feature exciting workout regimes, including Zumba, aerobics and power activity, all to the latest tunes. If you enjoy the calm, you can head to the Yoga and meditation sections brought to Happy Streets by Sahajyoga and Maria’s Yoga and Pranayam.Children will get an opportunity to play an assortment of games and engage in art, craft and science activities. Podar Jumbo Kids Plus will offer snakes and ladder, obstacle course, tattoo painting and a mascot, while Art Addict will let the kids’ creativity flow with keychain-making, doodle art and pinwheel-making. Children can also enjoy a storytelling session or read for themselves at the reading lounge organized by Kitabi Chai.Skillovate will enthrall participants with a football playing robot, robot activity and drone flying. Cross Strength will provide an energetic workout with HIIT Circuit, cardio kick-boxing and agility training tasks.There will also be an assortment of outdoor games for kids, including golf, archery, cricket, scooters, cycles, skateboards and waveboards. Decathlon will also hold a tent-building workshop.A special section would be there for those fascinated with numbers. Brain Train will bring abacus and mental maths for children of various age groups, including toddlers, to Happy Streets. Skating is also lined up for the young and old, where participants can put on their roller skates and zoom across the carnival stretch.Happy Streets is an initiative of The Times of India, in association with Pune police and Pune Municipal Corporation, powered by Nyati Group.

Title: When thousands stayed awake with Shiva
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Coimbatore: Filled with drumbeats and divine music, the night-long celebration at the Isha Yoga Centre was nothing short of a visual spectacle. Thousands of people from several parts of the globe thronged the centre to witness the 26th Maha Shivaratri celebrations on Friday. The electrifying night began with the Bhairavi yatra. Amid the cheers of participants, Vice-President Venkaiah Naidu took the stage along with Sadhguru Jaggi Vasudev, founder of the centre.

The event started with Pancha Bhutha Aradhana at Dhyanalinga that included an initiation with Abhaya sutra, a thread created to remove doubts and fear. Brahmacharis and sanyasis brought in purified soil and water from Velliangiri Mountains, lit fire from pure ghee that was made from cow’s milk and offered it to the Shiva idol.

The Adiyogi bust was then uncovered and a laser display lit up the 112 feet Adiyogi, thus capturing the multiple dimensions of Lord Shiva.

Taking the stage, the Vice-President released a book authored by Sadhguru, Death – an inside story, one of the much-awaited books for his followers.

Several musicians from the country performed at the event. It included highly popular Indian fusion band Kabir Café - the band named after famous poet Kabir – that took the stage along with drummers from Lebanon. Playback singer Karthik and famous Tamil folk musician Dasan also performed. Parthiv Gohil and Adithya Gadvi, two renowned Gujarati playback singers, enthralled the people with their performances.

As the musicians begin to perform, the huge crowd started to dance to their tune. There was never a silent moment, as the breath gap taken by the musicians were filled with cheerful sound of the audience. The foothills of Velliangiri was filled with colourful lights, music and dance.

The participants were offered food as part of Maha Annadhanam, which was prepared by hundreds of volunteers. They were also offered the Sarpa Sutra, which is the snake ring, and the Rudraksh adoring the Adiyogi. Governor of Himachal Pradesh Bandaru Dattatreya, Union Jal Shakti minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat and state ministers S P Velumani, Dindigul Srinivasan and Udumalai Radhakrishnan attended the event.

Title: Jaisalmer: Mixed bag for the district
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

JAISALMER: Public opinion is divided over the benefits to Jaisalmer district from the state Budget 2020-21. While some experts say that the Budget has left Jaisalmer wanting in many spheres, others say it shall benefit the district in more ways than one.

Although, Jaisalmer MLAs had put forward many demands, but nothing appears to have found a place in the Budget. This was despite a cabinet minister being from Jaisalmer. According to experts, there was nothing special in the Budget, while others maintain that it has provided relief to the common man. For the first time, the state government has announced to form a tourism development fund and has kept a provision of Rs 100 crore for it and this may benefit Jaisalmer, an important tourist centre. The government has announced to train and give license to 1,000 guides at the state-level and 5,000 guides at the district level, both of which are expected to benefit the unemployed in Jaisalmer district. However, the government has not announced any relief to people residing in DNP, where the people had a lot of hopes from the government. Similarly, Jaisalmer has huge reserves of cement grade limestone but there has been no announcement of setting up any cement industry. There has also been no announcement of the conservation of Indira Gandhi Canal. Youths of this area say the government did not pay attention towards generating employment.

Cabinet minister Saleh Mohammad said that the CM has presented the best Budget till now. Jaisalmer has got a lot many things in the Budget and a lot of effort has been included to give employment to youths, he said. Former MLA Chotu Singh Bhati said that the government has made a lot of announcements, but many announcements made during the last year Budget are yet to be implemented. MLA Ruparam said that the CM has given something for each sector in Jaisalmer. He has taken care of everything, whether solar energy or tourism.

Title: Chandigarh: Rs 6 lakh, gold burgled from house
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

CHANDIGARH: Burglars fled with Rs 6 lakh and gold jewellery worth lakhs from a house in Khuda Lahora, police said on Thursday after registering a case.

Shakuntla Devi, the house owner, said she had gone for the marriage of her son at her native place in Hisar, Haryana , on February 10. She said they received a call from their neighbour that the door of their house was broken. When she returned on Thursday, she said she found burglars had taken away three gold rings, a gold chain, a gold necklace, gold bangles, gold mangalsutra, a pair of gold earrings and other silver jewelry apart from the cash. Police registered a case and are scrutinizing CCTV footage installed nearby to identify the accused.

On February 14, burglars had targeted two houses, including one of an IAF official, in sectors 35 and 47 and fled with Rs 19,000, a laptop , three mobile phones and LPG cylinders.

Title: 16 self-proposed town planning schemes under scrutiny of PMRDA
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

The site of the PMRDA's Mhalunge TP sceme (File photo)

PUNE: As many as 16 self-proposed town planning schemes are under the scrutiny of the Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority .

The Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority ( PMRDA ) officials would review the proposals before giving approval to them. Each scheme would come up on at least 100 acres of land.

A source in the PMRDA said residents from Wagholi, Chakan, Pirangut and Hinjewadi had come forward with a land pool of more than 100 acres each for having a planned town planning scheme on the lines of the Mann-Mhalunge town planning scheme.

The PMRDA officials claimed that they had received a good response from the citizens on self-proposed town planning schemes. After scrutinising the proposals, the authorities would publish the notification, work on the layout and take administrative permissions.

The basic concept of the town planning scheme is pooling together all the land under different ownerships and redistributing them in a properly reconstituted form after deducting the land required for open spaces, social infrastructure, services, housing for people from the economically weaker sections and road network. Under the self-proposed town planning scheme, the land owners part with 20% of their land as against 50%, which is the condition of the PMRDA proposed town planning schemes.

Under the self-proposed town planning schemes, the PMRDA is expected to carry out some of the basic infrastructure work. The landowners, along with the developers, would have to plan the area.

“The PMRDA would help facilitate the schemes. But mainly the landowners, along with the developer, would have to submit their detailed plan. The approach road and surroundings would be managed by the authority. The other facilities would be the responsibility of the developer,” said a PMRDA official.

The PMRDA has six proposed town planning schemes. They will soon be rolled out.

The method followed in the town planning schemes is extensively used in Gujarat and Maharashtra to achieve the objectives of the Development Plan. Town planning schemes are prepared with micro-level planning for smaller areas of about 100 hectares.

Title: Mangaluru: Coast Guard conduct pollution response exercise
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

State level pollution response exercise being conducted by the Indian Coast Guard in Mangaluru on Friday

MANGALURU: The first edition of the state level pollution response exercise for the year to validate and reinforce response mechanisms for oil pollution incidents and enable the Indian Coast Guard to fine-tune the actions required in such eventualities was conducted at No 3 Headquarters, Coast Guard, on Thursday. NMPT, MRPL, IOCL and other stakeholders took part in the exercise.

The exercises were conducted in two phases. During phase one, a tabletop exercise simulating oil spill from a tanker was conducted, while a real-time demonstration of oil spill scenario was conducted during the second phase on Friday.

The exercise evolutions included mobilisation of pollution response resources by various stakeholders for combating a marine oil spill in the region, exercising reporting procedures, testing of communication links, threat assessment, search and rescue of distressed crew from the sea, firefighting assistance to disabled merchant tankers and deployment of pollution response equipment for containment and recovery of spilt oil. Moreover, recovery of spilt oil by all stakeholders, transfer of recovered oil to barges for transportation to port or shore reception facility by pollution control boats and demonstration of dispersant spray capabilities by the Coast Guard interceptor boats, offshore patrol vessels and fast patrol vessels were also done.

The inaugural address was delivered by DIG S B Venkatesh, district commander of Karnataka. He said that efforts were made with the synergy of stakeholders through such exercises to extend the Centre’s policy of ‘Swachh Bharat Abhiyan‘ to maritime zones of India through ‘Swachh Sagar Abhiyan’.

Title: Hic, hic, hurray! Heavy discount on liquor rates in Chandigarh
Content:
Many liquor vends have slashed prices by up to 25% in Chandigarh

CHANDIGARH: Several liquor vends have slashed rates by up to 25% . Reason: traders must exhaust the allotted quota of liquor by the end of the financial year on March 31.A liquor bottle, which was earlier available for Rs 650, is now being sold between Rs 450 and Rs 500.To attract more customers, liquor traders have displayed posters and banners outside their vends stating “Heavy discount on liquor rates”. The discounted price list mentioning different brands can be seen outside many vends. However, there is no discount on beer rates as there is no fixed allotted quota of the alcoholic beverage in the excise policy.Subhash Chander Chojar, a liquor trader who is also a member of Wine Merchants Association of Chandigarh, said there is an allotted quota which the trader has to finish by the end of the financial year. If he fails to do so, the UT administration imposes a fine or charges a fee. To avoid the penalty, traders are offering huge discounts, he said. The drop in the prices has lifted the spirits of Bacchus lovers.“We wait for this particular period. We stock up for two to three months as the vends not only offer good discounts on single bottles but more on cases,” said a city resident.A liquor trader said they offer discounts up to 30 to 40% if a customer purchases a case (12 bottles in one case). The trader is paying from his own pocket just to avoid penalty from the UT excise and taxation department, he added.The administration had recently invited suggestions from different stakeholders on the proposed excise policy to come into force from April 1. Sources said hoteliers, liquor vend owners and Wine Merchants’ Association could submit their suggestions by the end of this month. Already, various organisations have recommended extending bar timings from 1am to 2am and lowering the drinking age limit from 25 to 21 years. Senior officials of the administration would take the final decision.Sources said the officials would prepare a proposal to be taken up before the UT adviser and deputy commissioner and further discussed with the UT administrator.In the current excise policy, the prices of premium brands of whisky had gone up by around 20%. However, the rates of beer and wine had remained unchanged and those of beer at microbreweries gone down.According to the administration, the 2019-20 excise policy would help it earn a revenue Rs 600 crore as compared to Rs 510 crore in 2018-19.

Title: No fund for flyover, Sun City disappointed
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

The Budget left the city disappointed over the construction of the elevated road, a pressing need to deal with... Read More

JODHPUR: The Sun City received a moderate attention in the Budget presented by chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday. Medical sector has been given a lion’s share of Gehlot’s budgetary announcements for his hometown with a vision to ameliorate the standard of the MDM Hospital in terms of cancer and neuro care, but left the city disappointed on the construction of elevated road, a pressing need of the city to deal with the taxing traffic problem.

“It is welcome that medical field has been given priority in the Budget but absolute neglect for the elevated road which was very important to relieve the traffic problem, has disappointed the citizen,” said a trader Akshit Prajapat.

Jodhpur has been given close to Rs 100 crore for uplift and addition of medical facilities for the cancer and neuro care by announcing installation of PET scan machine, regional cancer centre and neuro intervention lab apart from a paediatric cath lab in MDM Hospital.

Besides, bed capacity of four wards with 30 each and setting up of a homoeopathic college has also been announced for Jodhpur.

Reacting to these announcements for medical sector, Manish Kankaria , a medical practitioner said that these announcements, if landed on the ground, could spell a leap in cancer treatment but he doubted timely allocation of funds for it.

“Linear Accelerator machine had been announced in last budget and wait was still on. Besides this, OPD building at MG Hospital and multilevel ICU are still far-fetched dreams,” Kankaria said.

Gehlot, however, kept the talent generation with regard to refinery in Pachpadra in view, Rs 20 crore budget has been given for upgradation of MBM Engineering College against its proposal of Rs 100 crore to elevate the institution as petroleum university.

Dean of the institution, S K Ojha said that they had expected bigger budget terming 20 crore quite small keeping in view the dreams and vision about the MDM Engineering College.

Industry also has a prominent presence in Jodhpur and the industrialists have been waiting since long for some concrete steps towards new industrial areas near city but while handicraft sector has been given Rajasthan International Export Expo event, textile industry denied textile park, a long pending demand.

Ramesh Maheshwari, said that textile industry is one of the important industries in Jodhpur and is on the target for environmental reasons.

“We had been expecting a dedicated textile park since long so that all the issues could be addressed to ensure smooth functioning of the industry,” said Maheshwari.

Not allocating budget for proposed Jojari River Front, a river, which has been victimized by the industrial effluent, has also disappointed the environment lovers. However, provision of 3 sewage treatment plants and a sewer clearing machine has brought some relief.

Title: Govt likely to give booster dose to pharma companies
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Nagpur: The novel coronavirus outbreak in China has negatively affected manufacturing and trade of life-saving injectables, ophthalmic products and anti-cancer medicines in India. Many pharmaceutical companies will be facing a major crisis of Active Pharmaceutical Ingredients (API) by the end of March 2020, as supply of these important chemicals has completely stopped from China.

To fight this crisis, the government is all set to bring in some major booster dose for local pharma industry, especially the makers of API in country. NITI Ayog and the department of pharmaceuticals (DoP) conducted a high-level meeting on February 19 in which representatives of leading API manufacturing companies in India participated. Some of them shared insights of the meeting with TOI on Friday.

“We were given a detailed presentation on the history and status of the API industry and new challenges. Also, a series of options available to make India a powerhouse in key starting materials, intermediates and API were also shared,” said a source.

APIs are chemicals used to manufacture drugs. They are biologically active within the drug and are specific components responsible for the desired effect on the individual taking it. It’s common practice for pharma companies to import API from China. However, some leading drug manufacturers in India also produce APIs. NITI Ayog wants them to work on a global level now.

CEOs of Biocon, Zydus, Dr Reddy’s Laboratories, and senior officers of Sun Pharma, Aurobindo, Jubliant Life Sciences, Cipla, Mylan, Alembic attended the meeting.

“Drug makers asked for early environmental clearances. Many companies were ready for global scale of operations. But, they were willing to have guarantee of continuation of supply chain even if the virus threat gets over. Government representatives were very positive on their demands,” the source added.

On Thursday, NITI Ayog CEO Amitabh Kanth also tweeted that the meeting was fruitful. “Constructive and positive meeting with captains of industry in pharmaceutical sector to discuss the options for domestic manufacturing of critical APIs on which India is import dependent. Consensus arrived at on a range of policy measures for creating ecosystem in India,” the tweet reads.

Title: Lawyers protest move to transfer 3 imp PILs to Mumbai
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Nagpur: City lawyers on Friday strongly protested the transfer of two important Public Interest Litigations (PILs) to Bombay high court’s principal seat in Mumbai. The lawyers are already at loggerheads with outgoing chief justice (CJ) Pradeep Nandrajog over sudden transfer of justice Zaka Haq to Aurangabad, which was termed as “unnecessary”. The cases were transferred by the HC registry on CJ’s directives, the lawyers claimed.

While terming the move as “shocking and deliberate”, the lawyers sent a requisition to High Court Bar Association (HCBA) president Gauri Venkatraman, requesting her to immediately convene a general body meeting on the “serious” issue and initiate necessary action. Venkatraman couldn’t be contacted while secretary Prafulla Khubalkar didn’t pick up calls.

Lawyers questioned the basis on which the three PILs were transferred to Mumbai. Moreover, there was no demand from any concerned party, like in NDCCB case, where alleged kingpin Sanjay Agrawal had filed an application to move the case to Mumbai. “HCBA’s suo motu PIL was regarding construction of new annex building in the city for accommodating offices and employees of HC administration and also lawyers. We fail to understand the purpose of shifting the case to Mumbai,” they said.

For some pleading the PILs, the move came as a surprise. “They didn’t even take care to intimate us on the transfer. There is no denying the fact it’s the CJ’s prerogative, but it should have some logic. I want to ask them whether they think that judges at Nagpur bench are not competent enough to decide on such issues, that too related to the city. The HCBA should now strongly take up the issue,” HCBA counsel Sudhir Puranik told TOI.

Endorsing him, Bhandarkar, who was pleading for petitioner Manoj Sable in one of the PILs transferred, said the HC regularly passed detailed orders due to which infrastructure of various courts was improved. “The news of transfer came as a bolt from the blue. Entire legal fraternity is absolutely stunned and visibly disturbed. It’s very demotivating for the lawyers, as they put in a lot of efforts to gather the material and study the subject,” he said.

The requisition also signed by former HCBA secretary Kishor Lambat, now practicing at the Supreme Court, said the transfer would hamper progress of judicial infrastructure as HC had issued several path breaking directives. “It’s standing insult a and abject humiliation of our bar association,” it said.

PILS TRANSFERRED TO MUMBAI SO FAR

* Nagpur District Co-operative Central Bank (NDCCB) scam PIL (No 25/2014), where animal husbandry and sports minister Sunil Kedar is one of the accused

* Suo Motu PIL (No 7/2015) highlighting plight of litigants and lawyers suffering from scorching temperatures, particularly in Vidarbha, & also for HC annex building construction

* Manoj Sable’s PIL (No 67/2015) praying for directives to PWD for construction of additional infrastructure like courts and bar rooms for convenience of lawyers and litigants

Title: Ayad river gets Rs 75 crore, Dewas project neglected
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Udaipur: Despite a reasonably generous fund for rejuvenation of Ayad river, legislators and the public in general are dissatisfied with the state Budget.

With no provisions sanctioned for the ambitious Dewas drinking water project Phase 3 and 4, no funds were announced for replacement of the 30-year-old withering pipeline from Jaisamand to Udaipur.

Chief minister Ashok Gehlot had earlier expressed his desire in completion of the Dewas project and hence, the authorities had pinned high hopes from the government for the project.

The third and fourth phase of Dewas project aims at supplying additional 1,000 mcft drinking water to Udaipur city, which would have solved the water crisis of urban dwellers.

The Gehlot government has sanctioned Rs 75 crore for the restoration and cleaning of the Ayad river. Former home minister and Udaipur MLA Gulabchand Kataria said had the government sanctioned funds for the drinking water project, it would have benefited the region immensely.

“Restoration works are already going on for Ayad under the SMART city and UMC projects. What was really needed was funds for Dewas, which has been overlooked,” Kataria said.

Udaipur rural legislator Phool Singh Meena said the 30-year-old pipeline carrying water from Jaisamand to Udaipur is withering and needs to be replaced. A proposal of Rs 215 crore for laying new a pipeline was sent to the government, but it has been ignored resulting in wastage of crores of litres of water.

Another major project that has been overlooked is the drinking water supply plan from Bhageri to Mavli that would have covered 12 panchayats in the block.

BJP leaders said besides drinking water issues remaining unattended, the government has not granted anything to boost tourism. They also claimed that there was no sanction of new colleges in the tribal areas which would prove a setback to higher education.

Meanwhile, the announcement for an organ retrieval centre in Udaipur has come as a cheering news for the residents. “The centre would be advantageous for the common man as it would help people facing life threatening diseases. This is a welcome step,” P.C Jain, a physician said.

“he government has given Rs 25 crore for drinking water project in colonies under the affordable housing scheme. This would benefit the middle and lower income families to a large extent,” Pankaj Sharma, general secretary, PCC said.

Title: Budget fails to cheer up people from Hadauti area
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Kota: Despite three cabinet ministers from Hadauti region, the Budget announced by chief minister Ashok Gehlot on Thursday failed cheer up people of Kota, Jhalawar and Baran districts.

The ministers are Shanti Dhariwal (UDH), Pramod Jain Bhaya (mining) and Ashok Chandana (sports).

Announcement of oxygen zone (city park) with fund of Rs 100 crore in Kota city, cancer hospital in super specialty wing of Kota Medical College, a share in 800 megawatt solar power plant in Kota Thermal Power Plant, development of new industrial area in Bundi and Rs 970 crore for drinking water supply system in 286 villages and 287 vicinities of Hindoli–Nainwa area of Bundi district have, however, given small relief to the local want, not the satisfaction.

No announcement in the budget was made on IIIT which has failed to hold its classes in Kota even after nine years of its establishment as the classes are still running in Jaipur, on set up of new industries in Kota to fill up the vacuum of a number of industries including IL having been shut down in last decade, on state government’s initiative to speed up process for new airport in Kota and on relief to nearly 2 lakh coaching students by announcement to strap off state’s share of tax on coaching.

Besides, chief minister’s announcement of setting up coaching hub in 65,000 square metre area of Pratap Nagar in Jaipur has further disappointed the locals in Kota as the move for coaching hub in Jaipur is being viewed as an attempt to shift Kota’s blooming coaching industry to the state capital.

Tourism industry in Hadauti has also been ignored in the state budget, however, the CM has announced to create tourism development fund with Rs 100 crore, there is no clear roadmap to utilize the fund to promote tourist industry. The concept of village tourism has got no place in the Budget, while promotion of village tourism is the need of hour to give a boost to tourism industry in the state, believe the people associated with tourism industry.

Meanwhile, the interests of farmers in Hadauti have also not been protected as no announcement for the forming new agro industries, processing units has been made in the Budget.

The farmers expected the government would announce to open purchase centres on government supported price at gram panchayat level, but regrettably no such move has been made in the budget, said Kota division convener of Akhil Bhartiya Kisan Sayukt Sangarsh Samiti, Fatehchand and added the paddy cultivators in Hadauti also expected that the CM would declare Rajasthan export state for paddy like Punjab and Haryana but absence of such declaration has disappointed the paddy cultivators, who currently have to bear loss while selling their crop.

Title: MAHE set to take in 450 PhD students this year
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

MANGALURU: From 158 PhD students at Manipal Academy of Higher Education ( MAHE ) in 2014 to 350 in 2019, the number is expected to be around 450 this year.

“At MAHE, the focus clearly has to be on top-quality research. We want to push our doctoral programmes and ensure that enrolment crosses 1,000 per year very soon,” said vice-chancellor Dr H Vinod Bhat .

Dr H Shyamala Hande, director of the Centre for Doctoral Studies, said a substantial number of the students will be supported by the Dr TMA Pai scholarships for full-time PhD programmes. “MAHE is now an institute of eminence. We are also looking forward to having more UGC-CSIR-NET, DST-Inspire and other national scholarship holders. We offer incentives like fee waiver, conference travel and project support for those with national scholarships,” said Hande who teaches histology at Melaka Manipal Medical College.

“We are proud that 61% of the enrolled candidates are women, although there is no such discrimination during admissions. This year, we are expecting a decent number of international students too,” she added

One of the reasons for the increase in registrations is that PhD is now the minimum qualification for an academic career in universities in India. Soon after doing masters, students aged 22-25 enrol for PhD and complete the course in four or five years. “During the last admissions, the boom was in pharmacy and engineering. These streams require a lot of funding and lab facilities for PhD projects and MAHE supported many competitive projects through intramural funding. The numbers have increased in health and biological sciences; and momentum is picking up in management, commerce, humanities, social sciences and some not-so-common disciplines such as European studies, geopolitics and hospitality management,” said Hande.

The Centre for Doctoral Studies selects, enrols, supports and retains academically distinguished students. A final count of students is taken in December, as MAHE gets applications through the year. Besides, admission is only one step, students have to register their research topics and defend their proposals before they can be counted. There are two orientation programmes in the year which is followed by the admissions of Dr TMA Pai scholars. Admissions for this category are done in January and July, said Hande.

Title: Remember Gujarat, warns BJP MLC Vyas
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Nagpur: BJP MLC and party’s spokesperson Girish Vyas’ reaction over AMIM’s Waris Pathan’s comment has led to a war of words.

After Pathan, the former MLA from Byculla said 15 crore Muslims of the country will prove stronger than 100 crore of the rest, Vyas in an interview to a television channel said Gujarat of 2002 should not be forgotten.

Talking to TOI, Vyas confirmed having said so and also mentioned it has to be understood in the right perspective. “This was a reaction to what Pathan had said for which a criminal offence must be registered against him,” he said.

Questioning chief minister Uddhav Thackeray’s stance, he said Pathan’s statement can hurt communal sentiments. “If they speak like that then even we cannot keep quite and take it lightly,” said Vyas.

“Everyone has the constitutional right to express their views on a subject. However, such statements can only lead to riots,” he said. tnn

Title: Should’ve sent all Muslims to Pakistan in 1947: Giriraj Singh
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Giriraj Singh

PATNA: Union minister Giriraj Singh , known for making controversial statements, has said that the country is paying the price for not sending Muslims to Pakistan in 1947.

“Had Muslim brothers been sent to Pakistan at the time of partition in 1947, we would not have to face a situation like this (protests against CAA) today,” Giriraj said at a BJP event in Purnia, adding, “It was a major lapse for which we are paying the price.”

The Begusarai MP’s remarks at a BJP event on Thursday snowballed into a controversy when the video of his speech went viral on Friday. The Union minister was on a two-day visit to create awareness about the Citizenship Amendment Act among the local party workers and leaders.

“Time has come to dedicate ourselves for the cause of country. Before 1947, while our forefathers were fighting for Independence of the country, (Muhammad Ali) Jinnah was planning to make Bharat an Islamic state,” Singh said. Purnia, where he made the remarks, is a major town in the Seemanchal region, which has a sizeable Muslim population.

He stressed the need for CAA, which seeks to fast-track granting citizenship to persecuted non-Muslim refugees from Pakistan, Bangladesh and Afghanistan. “If Bharatvanshi (people of Indian origin) will not get a place in India, then which other country will give them asylum,” the firebrand BJP leader said.

However, Giriraj’s statement has been opposed by BJP’s NDA allies in Bihar —LJP and JD(U). Both parties strongly disapproved his remark saying such “polarising” remarks by saffron leaders had resulted in setback for NDA in the recent Delhi assembly polls.

“Many times, our coalition partners say things which the LJP does not agree with at all. This is one such statement. Had a person of my party spoken in this fashion, I would have taken responsibility and acted against the person,” LJP chief Chirag Paswan said here on Friday.

“Giriraj Singh is such a leader that he does not even care to obey the advice of his party president J P Nadda. Nadda had recently said BJP faces embarrassment due to such leaders. Giriraj Singh should give more attention to the activities of his departments, instead of issuing controversial remarks,” JD(U) spokesperson Arvind Nishad told TOI.

Title: KSRTC bus accident: Gireesh, Baiju given heroes’ farewell
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

KSRTC employees paying tributes in front of the photographs of bus driver Gireesh and conductor V R Baiju

PERUMBAVOOR: At Shanthinilayam in Okkal, heart-rending scenes unfolded as Devika Girish, the teenage daughter of VD Gireesh, the driver of the ill-fated KSRTC Volvo bus , bid farewell to her father. Devutty, as she was called by her father, broke into frantic crying, a sight unbearable to watch.

Gireesh, who was loved by everyone professionally and otherwise, had a hero’s farewell at the Pulluvazhy village near Perumbavoor on Friday. Hundreds poured in to the small house since six in the morning to pay their last respects . Former KSRTC MD Tomin J Thachankary, who had once written a letter of appreciation to Gireesh and his conductor V R Baiju , reached the house in the morning and paid his tributes.

Valavanayath house at Valayanchirangara, built in less than four cents by Gireesh through his hard work about three years ago, was not enough to hold the crowd, almost the entire village, which arrived to bid adieu to their friend. By 11.15am the body was taken to Okkal for cremation.

Thampy, a close friend, said that Gireesh was a gem of a person. “I have known him for years. Before he got his job about 10 years ago, he used to work in my bus. Even after he stopped working with me, we continued our friendship. He was there for any kind of help, and now he is gone, leaving all of us,” said Thampy.

Devika, a Plus One student at NSS Higher Secondary School, Valyachirangara, used to make a call to her father every morning. Her call on Thursday, however, was unanswered.

His mother, Lakshmi, wife Smitha and sister Sindhu was at home when the horrific news started to spread. Neighbours and relatives initially tried to shield the family from knowing the news from TV. They had cut the cable to the home and kept quiet for a while before formally telling them about what has happened. A heartbroken Smitha couldn’t even go to Shanthinilayam, where the cremation took place. Gireesh’s nephew Naveen performed the funeral rites.

At Veliyanad near Piravom, the native village of V R Baiju, the KSRTC conductor who lost his life in the accident , Baiju’s wife Kavitha was inconsolable. She was completely shattered as she couldn’t even get a final glimpse of her husband, whose body was crushed beyond recognition in the accident.

Their only daughter, Bhavita, was preparing for her Class X examination when she lost the guidance of her father. Hundreds, including his colleagues, turned up to pay their last respects to Baiju, who was a popular figure in the locality. The cremation was held on the house premises around 10am.

“Baiju was a socially aware individual. We know him as a person who helps anybody in trouble. We are yet to recover from his demise,” said Balu C A, a friend of Baiju. Baiju’s brother Biju performed the rites.

Title: Ashok Gehlot-headed investment board to fast-track big ticket biz proposals
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

The government also announced strengthening the existing single window mechanism, rechristened as ‘One Stop Sh... Read More

JAIPUR: The Board of Investment under the chairmanship of the chief minister proposed in the state Budget announced on Thursday will seek to expedite approval process for large investment proposals which currently takes 3-6 months. Similarly, the government also announced to strengthen the existing a single window mechanism, rechristened as ‘One Stop Shop’, with time-bound clearances to enhance ease of doing business.

As per the existing practices, investment proposals above Rs 100 crore are cleared by a state-level empowered committee, after which they go the cabinet for final approval. But once the new board gets instituted, the proposals would not require cabinet approval in normal cases.

A senior official in the government said that the chief minister is ‘very determined’ to make the approval process completely hassle-free as he wants bigger investments in the state. “The success of new MSME Act that requires no state approvals up to 3 years has vastly influenced his views. He wanted the decision making process to be faster and approval mechanism time-bound. That’s how the idea of a board of investment came about,” said the official.

He said that for the One Stop Shop, the department studied the best models available in the country and that took them to Punjab and Andhra Pradesh. “Punjab and Andhra Pradesh have the best single window clearance mechanisms. We took them for our reference and made improvements keeping the specific needs our state. Under the new system, approvals will be under one roof and time-bound,” he added.

The One Stop Shop cell will have officers from 14 departments (the number will increase gradually) and housed in Bureau of Investment Promotion department. “For every approval and clearance, there will be a fixed time. If the officer of a particular department fails to provide the clearance, the BIP commissioner will have the power to approve the proposal of the investor,” added the official.

Ease of doing business has been a major concern for the industry as they do not want to lose precious time and opportunities thereof. “The new MSME Act indicates that investors like to commit capital if there are less bureaucratic hurdles,” added the official.

Title: CCI okays GMR-Groupe ADP deal
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

(Representative image)

HYDERABAD: A day after GMR group said it is selling 49% stake in its airports business to Aeroports de Paris SA (Groupe ADP) of France, the deal has been approved by the competition watchdog Competition Commission of India (CCI).

The clearance was granted by the competition regulator on Friday under the green channel route. Applications made under the green channel route are deemed approved, subject to certain combinations.

CCI said on Friday in a release that it received a green channel combination filing from ADP SA for acquisition of 49% stake in GMR Airports Ltd (GAL) and 100% stake in GMR Infra Services Ltd (GISL), an operating and holding company.

“There are no horizontal overlaps, vertical links or complementary businesses between ADP and GAL and GISL…In the absence of any overlaps between the parties in India, the proposed combination does not raise any risk of adverse effect on competition in India and is accordingly being submitted through the Green Channel route under Regulation 5A of Competition Commission of India,” ADP said in its application to the competition regulator.

While GISL is an operating and holding company whose primary business is to hold shares in GAL, GAL is an unlisted public company that is a subsidiary of GMR Infrastructure Limited. GAL is engaged in developing, managing and operating airports in India and around the world along with associated business activities.

GMR Group had, on Thursday, announced that it will be selling 49% stake in GAL, which operates the Hyderabad and New Delhi international airports, to the French airports operator for a consideration of Rs 10,780 crore. This includes Rs 9780 crore towards secondary sales of shares by GMR group and Rs 1000 crore equity infusion in GAL.

As per 2019 passenger statistics, the combined passengers handled by GMR Airports and Groupe ADP stand at 336.5 million, which is the highest across the world.

Apart from the Hyderabad and Delhi airports, GMR group also operates the Mactan Cebu International airport in Philippines and has under development greenfield projects like Mopa airport in Goa and Heraklion airport at Crete in Greece.

Title: Centre can’t notify Mhadei award for 6 more months
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

PANAJI: Even as the Supreme Court passed an interim order directing the Centre to notify the August 14, 2018 order of the Mhadei Water Disputes Tribunal, the Union government cannot notify the award for six more months as its Jal Shakti ministry has extended the time for submission of the final order till August 19.

The tribunal was given an extension after it requested the Centre for more time to reply to clarifications sought by the riparian states—Goa, Karnataka and Maharashtra—to the August 14, 2018 order.

Once the award is passed, the affected parties get one-year time to seek clarifications from the tribunal.

“All three states—Goa, Karnataka and Maharashtra—had sought clarifications from the tribunal. With the notification of the Jal Shakti ministry, it will take minimum six months to notify the Mhadei award,” advocate general Devidas Pangam told TOI.

Incidentally, the Centre’s notification giving an extension to the tribunal to submit the final order was issued on Wednesday by Jal Shakti ministry additional secretary T Rajeshwari, while the Supreme Court, hearing a Karnataka government’s petition for notifying the tribunal’s August 14, 2018 award, had passed an interim order on Thursday.

Pangam also said that once the tribunal gave its clarifications, it will submit its final award to the ministry for notification. “Depending on the decision, the tribunal can modify its earlier award given on August 14, 2018,” Pangam said.

Sources said one of the clarifications sought by Goa and Karnataka was on the tribunal’s order that diversion would be permitted only during the five monsoon months—from June 1 to October 31.

Though the tribunal had said that no diversion would be permitted during the non-monsoon period—from November 1 to May 31—“even if some inflows are observed into the reservoir (s)”, sources said they wanted a clarity from the tribunal about it.

The Supreme Court’s interim order carried a condition that the notification of the tribunal’s award was subject to the outcome of the petitions filed by Goa, Karnataka and Maharashtra against the August 14, 2018 order.

The Supreme Court also admitted Goa government’s special leave petition challenging the award and posted it for final hearing on July 15, 16 and 24.

In its SLP, Goa has sought quashing of the tribunal’s award allotting 3.9tmc (thousand million cubic) ft water to Karnataka for drinking purpose.

In August 2018, the three-decade old dispute between the three states over sharing of the Mhadei water ended with the tribunal rejecting Karnataka’s demand for 36.5tmc ft of water and allotted it only 13.4tmc ft, including 3.9tmc ft for drinking purposes through diversions, against its demand for 7.5tmc ft.

Title: NRC chief zeroes in on ‘doubtful’ names on list
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

File photo. (PTI)

GUWAHATI: Less than six months after Assam ’s updated National Register of Citizens ( NRC ) was published, the new state coordinator for the exercise has raised doubts about the quality of screening and enumeration on the basis of a list of “ineligible persons” who have allegedly made it to the citizenship rolls.

In a circular to the deputy commissioners and district registrars of citizen registration, former state coordinator Prateek Hajela ’s successor Hitesh Dev Sarma said he had been informed that people declared as foreigners by tribunals, doubtful voters identified by the Election Commission and their descendants had found their way into the NRC.

“A list of such persons has already been shared from your end... As such, you are requested to share the details of such persons who are ineligible for inclusion in NRC, but whose names got included,” states the circular issued last Wednesday. “You are requested to note that this matter is of utmost importance as the details received from your end have to reported to the Registrar General of India urgently...Send the details within tomorrow (February 20) positively.”

A total of 3.3 crore people had applied for inclusion of their names in the NRC in 2015. Three years later, the final draft was published, containing 2.89 crore names. Of the over 40 lakh names that were excluded, 36 lakh filed claims. On August 31 last year, the final list was published with 3.11 crore inclusions and 19 lakh exclusions.

Several organisations, including Aasu, have since moved the Supreme Court seeking re-verification on various grounds. While Aasu claims the list of inclusions is far smaller than it should be, the BJP-led government insists that many Hindus have been erroneously left out. The state government is arguing for re-verification of at least 20% of the data, especially in the three districts bordering Bangladesh , where it believes the exclusion rate was “abnormally low”.

Assam Public Works, the NGO whose 2009 PIL led the SC to order the NRC exercise, has filed a plea seeking “100% re-verification”. It claimed the final list contains names of almost 80 lakh foreigners, including jihadis.

Title: 2016 ISIS module case trial to resume at Cherlapally jail
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Hyderabad: After the verdicts in the 2013 Dilsukhnagar twin blasts and 2007 Gokul Chat-Lumbini Park twin blasts, the Cherlapally jail will yet again witness trial in a terror case.

Trial will resume in the 2016- ISIS conspiracy module case, in which eight persons, including the Yazdani brothers, were arrested and chargesheeted by National Investigation Agency.

The trial against the accused — Abdullah Bin Ahmed Al Amoodi, Mohammed Ibrahim Yazdani, Habeeb Mohammed, Mohammed Illyas Yazdani, Muzaffar Hussain Rizwan, Yasir Naimathullah, Mohammed Ataullah Rahman, Abdul Raoof — was taken up by Nampally court in 2018. However, it got discontinued because of technical reasons, and the accused have been languishing in Chanchalguda jail.

After some of the accused approached the Telangana High Court, based on its direction, they were recently shifted from Chanchalguda jail to Cherlapally jail, where the trial will resume at a court hall, which is located inside the prison premises.

When contacted, sources in Telangana prison said that once they get the new schedule, which they are expecting shortly, from the Nampally court for the trial to resume, they will make arrangements in the prison premises.

NIA had earlier in their chargesheet alleged that the eight accused planned to commit subversive activities by using explosives, besides targeting police stations or policemen in Hyderabad.

The investigators claimed that during their investigation, they found that the accused had pledged allegiance to self-proclaimed ISIS leader, Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi. They were also accused of being in touch with a foreign handler.

They were booked under charges like conspiracy, Unlawful Activities Prevention Act (UAPA), Arms Act, and Explosives Substances Act.

At Cherlapally court, when trials were conducted few years ago in Dilsukhnagar twin blasts, all the five accused of the Indian Mujahideen outfit were awarded death penalty in 2016. Similarly, in the Gokul Chat-Lumbini Park blasts case, two accused got death penalty while one got life imprisonment in 2018.

Title: Maharashtra: Jayant Patil justifies winding up of Jalyukta Shivar
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Jayant Patil

PUNE: State water resources minister Jayant Patil on Friday justified his department’s move to scrap the Jalyukta Shivar scheme initiated by former chief minister Devendra Fadnavis , claiming that the work executed as parts of the project were “substandard”.

The minister said his department would carry on water conservation projects across the state, but asserted that the government could not afford to spend public money on the “poor quality” Jalyukta Shivar scheme.

“We had repeatedly raised our voice in the Assembly over the issue. Payments were made before the elections for work that were incomplete and of substandard quality. The chief minister has now told to stop payments to such works and go ahead with their execution only after a review,” Patil said here on the sidelines of a function.

The minister said the Maha Vikas Aghadi government was “not intentionally suspending any scheme or project” taken up by its predecessor. “The execution of the water conservation projects and other schemes will continue in a better way,” he said.

Alarmed by a series of droughts, Fadnavis had in December 2014 launched the scheme in 34 districts across the state. The aim was to make Maharashtra drought-free by 2019. The scheme provided for deepening and widening of streams, construction of cement and earthen dams, work on nullahs and digging of farm ponds. It was proposed to make 5,000 villages drought-free every year and water empowerment for 25,000 villages across the state.

Referring to the state’s economic development, Patil said the Patil said the rate had slowed down in the past four years and the citizens’ expectations were not met.

He said, “Many projects were announced, but failed to gather pace. The Metro projects implemented in the state have not received the expected response. The Nagpur Metro is facing losses. The state is incurring expenses on the metro and will face a financial burden.”

At another function in the city, the minister said there was a need to initiate steps for “judicious use of water” because of the increasing demand, especially from the urban areas. He emphasized on the need to recycle and reuse water and install pre-paid meters to curb wastage.

Title: Burglary gang arrested in Hyderabad, Rs 9.5 lakh recovered
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Representative image

HYDERABAD: LB Nagar police arrested four notorious burglars and recovered Rs 9.5 lakh cash and an iPhone from their possession.

LB Nagar sleuths intercepted the accused when they were moving under suspicious circumstances at LB Nagar. The accused include a private employee from Kawadiguda identified as Annaram Mallikarjun (24), auto driver R Rakesh (22), food delivery boy from Khairatabad Md Aslam (21), and a businessman from MS Makhta Abdul Nadeem Qureishi (35).

According to the police, Mallikarjun and Rakesh are relatives. “Mallikarjun used to work as a cluster manager at Nikkou Logistics in LB Nagar. He lost his job due to improper behaviour, and he decided to take revenge on the company by stealing money from the office,” LB Nagar inspector V Ashok Reddy said.

As per his plan, Mallikarjun stole the office keys before quitting the job and gave them to Rakesh. Using the keys, Rakesh entered the Nikkou Logistics Office, removed the CCTV camera as well as the digital video recorder before stealing Rs 9.91 lakh cash from the locker.

“While Rakesh was committing the burglary, Mallikarjun stayed in constant touch with him through WhatsApp call. After the burglary, the duo kept about Rs 3.2 lakh cash with them and gave rest of the amount to other accused asking them to exchange it for commission,” the inspector said.

By analysing the CCTV cameras and cellphone details, the police arrested the accused.

Title: Ashok Gehlot’s dream project finds no favour in Budget
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

JAIPUR: Though the third detailed project report of Jaipur Metro phase II is ready, the dream project of Ashok Gehlot government didn’t get any budgetary allocation. Without any budgetary provision, it will be very difficult to complete the project.

Metro phase II will be from Ambabadi to Sitapura which was considered to be better route looking at the number of passengers in that section. In the last two DPRs, metro was supposed to be underground but as the expense was high, third DPR said to have mentioned entire route to be elevated. It is said that after making it elevated, 60% budget of the metro was reduced. Department was expecting some kind of budgetary allocation on Thursday.

Sources in the department said, “It was a dream project for Gehlot which was inaugurated in 2015 but still nothing was allocated. It is said that allocation was made last year so we can expect that this will continue in 2020 year as well. Nothing has been certain as of now.”

It is expected that around 4.2 lakh passengers will travel every day in the metro phase II. From Ambabadi, it will cross Sindhi Camp bus station, Maharani College, Tonk Road, Sanganer airport to finally reach Sitapura.

Whether the government will allocate the budget in the middle of the year that is also not certain and if nothing has been done, this year phase II work will have to wait.

Title: Maharashtra: Beed civic staffer under fire for water supply disruption
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Beed water supply committee chairman Ravindra Kadam held a meeting of the water supply department staff on Fri... Read More

AURANGABAD: The Beed Municipal Council (BMC) on Friday issued a notice to its staffer responsible for the disruption in water supply in some areas of the city.

The residents of Beed city are getting water supply once in five or six days. Over the last few days, the residents from several areas of the Old City faced disruption in water supply schedule. Acting on the complaints of residents, Beed municipal council’s water supply committee chairman Ravindra Kadam held a meeting of the water supply department staff on Friday .

He asked the staff to ensure that the residents are getting uninterrupted water supply. He also ordered an inquiry abput the allegations made by the residents.

After conducting an inquiry, it was found that supervisor SH Pardeshi deputed on the Bindusara Dam supply line had taken a leave of 5 to 6 days without any application or information to the administration. Subsequently, the water supply on the said line was affected. Nikam said that a show-cause notice has been issued to the staffer in this regard. In the meeting, Nikam asked the staffers to ensure that the residents get water on time.

Incidentally, the Old City area of Beed receives water supply from the Bindusara Dam which is 10km away from the city. The new area located on the outskirts of the city receives supply from backwaters of Majalgaon Dam which is at a distance of 80km from the city.

Nikam told TOI that the poor water supply frequency of the city will be addressed soon. “A repair work on leakages in the supply line will be carried out. Also, a new distribution line from the backwaters of Majalgaon Dam has been installed. The connections will be completed in a year’s time and then we can supply water on every third day to the residents,” he said.

Title: Govt transfers NHM director, scraps sterilisation circular
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

Bhopal: The Madhya Pradesh government on Friday withdrew a controversial order that asked male health workers to ensure at least one male sterilization per month or lose pay and job. Minister P C Sharma acknowledged the “fault”, and National Health Mission state director Chhavi Bharadwaj, who issued the order, was removed in the evening.

The circular, issued on February 11, said that all 3,000-plus multi-purpose health workers (MPHWs) must mobilise at least five to 10 ‘willing beneficiaries’ for male sterilisation. Those who fail to get even one man for sterilisation by March 31 will have their salaries withheld until they complete the task, it warned. District collectors and chief medical and health officers (CMHOs) were asked to identify MPHWs who don’t perform their task and apply the no-work no-pay principle. If the situation didn’t improve, collectors could recommend compulsory retirement of MPHWs, it said.

The order sparked outrage despite damage control by the administration. BJP tore into the Congress government on Friday, saying that it reminded of Emergency-era forced sterilisations. Former CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan dubbed it “Emergency part-II in MP”. “If health workers fail to meet targets, the government can take action but the decision to cut their salary and retire them shows dictatorial attitude,” Chouhan tweeted. Newly-appointed BJP state president V D Sharma questioned the “real motive” of the government behind the order, and tweeted: “The government is trying to save the minister by taking action against an official.”

On the back foot, the government withdrew the order and launched into damage control. Health minister Tulsi Silawat condemned the warning issued to male health workers in the NHM order, and said it stood revoked with immediate effect. PR and legal affairs minister PC Sharma, said, “The order has been quashed. It was a fault at some level.”

Late Friday evening, the government transferred IAS officer Chhavi Bhardwaj — the driving force behind Bhopal’s Swachh Survekshan silver in 2016-2017 — as officer on special duty at the secretariat. No reason was mentioned in the transfer order, which was issued despite Mahashivratri being a government holiday, but it’s understood she was removed for the ultimatum given to male health workers to meet sterilisation targets.

Following the fiasco, top health department officials pointed out that the order was issued by Bhardwaj in the light of dismal sterilisation figures — districts like Betul, Morena and Balaghat don’t have a single male sterilisation. The order cited the National Family Health Survey-4 report, which says only 0.5% men opt for sterilisation in Madhya Pradesh. Of the 3.03 lakh people who underwent sterilisation in 2018 in Madhya Pradesh, an overwhelming 98.8% were women. Only 3,727 males underwent the far easier procedure of vasectomy.

“There is nothing wrong in male participation in sterilisation and family planning. The order could have been lightly worded,” said a senior health department official. “Tubectomy and vasectomy are voluntary, and couples choose the method best suited to them. There is no coercion,” the official added.

Title: Coaching hub plan gets thumbs up
Content:
This story is from February 22, 2020

The CM has earmarked land for coaching centres at Pratap Nagar

JAIPUR: Chief minister Ashok Gehlot has proposed a separate 67,000 sqm land belonging to Rajasthan Housing Board for a coaching hub in Pratap Nagar here in his Budget speech on Thursday. This was a long-standing demand of traders and residents of Gopalpura Bypass Road and Barkat Nagar area where these centres have become a nuisance.

Commissioner of Housing Board Pawan Arora on Friday welcomed the move. “We have been planning it for a long time and this Budget proposal will give a final push. We are planning to build a eco-friendly coaching hub in Pratap Nagar. Once this plan is implemented, we plan to implement in other cities as well,” said Pawan. There are hundreds of coaching institutes at Gopalpura Bypass and surrounding areas. Most of the coaching institutes do not have parking space that usually creates traffic problems.

President of Gopalpura Bypass Traders Union, Pawan Goyal , said students of coaching institutes are harming them financially. “None of the coaching institutes have parking space and in the evening traffic jam is routine. Hundreds of vehicles are parked encroaching roads in the area. Many banks, clothing shops, malls and other business have shown interest in the area but due to coaching centres, no contract is finalised. If these students are shifted outside the city, it will be profitable for us,” said Pawan.

There is no provision for fire safety as well. Last year, Jaipur Municipal Corporation (JMC) closed down many coaching centres in the area due to lack of fire NOC.

Residents of the area also complained of disturbance created by the hostellers. Shyam Sundar, a resident of Mahesh Nagar, said group fights, rash riding of bikes, disturbance in parks have become common. “There are many houses where students are vacating on time. It is no longer a safe area for family members and it is better if these coaching institutes are shifted out of this area,” said Shyam.
